Shart Summary

I wish to come again!! In Portland Oregon I will come one week and serve best lamb kebab you remember?! But I need a helps with some expensives for make it happening!! I will fly in the airplane to Portland on August if I can get a helps for the ticket. If you will help I send you the copy of my story book LAmB GOES IN TOWN!!

IF IT IS SUCCESS TO RAISE UP THIS MONEYS FOR THE TICKET THEN WE WILL HAVE SECRET KEBAB ON A PUBLIC PARTY IN SOME PARK IN PORTLAND AND A WHOLE TOWN CAN COME FOR THE LAMB ONE FINAL TIMES!!

Details Explanesion

I need a helps for the airplane ticket and some local expensives just $1500 NO BIG WOOP. If I can get it then the Lamb of Secret Kebab will make the ass picnic for all in Portland, Oregon in second week for August.

Every body who is putting $20 will get my book!! You put $40 you get 2 books!! You put $500 and you get the special dinner cooks for you and a 5 friend by ME THE TURK and every body is get a signed copy of my BOOK!! 

Other Way You Would Help

SPREAD IT!! You put the word on Tweets and Facebook it is so simpel!!

 

I LOVE YOU PORTLAND I HOPE WE CAN HAVE THE PARTY TO FANCY DANCE!!

story:
Summary

The Chabot College Planetarium is not just an educational venue for our students, it’s an Astronomy and Science based Educational classroom for our Community. In years past Chabot College Planetarium was one of the premier college planetarium in the San Francisco Bay area. We were once funded to teach and hold ongoing planetarium shows for all, from young children to older adults, and for local school groups of all ages.

That was then and this is now. We are no longer funded to provide the public element of our mission, so vital to our community. So that is why we are coming to you, to help us to transition back to providing personnel and programs that will engage the vast community of everyone interested in

Astronomy and Science, from kids to seniors.

We currently provide an exceptional simulated view of the sky in our 30-foot dome provided by our all-digital Spitz SciDome projector. With this state-of-the-art projector, along with exceptional software we are able to produce realistic images of Planets, Stars, and Galaxies along with video in a truly immersive environment.

We, the Friends of the Chabot College Planetarium, are asking for your contribution so that we can help the Planetarium accomplish its original mission.

Please donate and you too will be one of the True Stars of Our Community!

 

What We Need

We need your help so that as the Spring of 2013 begins, our doors will be open with new programs and an individual to run them for the fiscal quarter. We are hoping to build an endowment that might support the planetarium in perpetuity. But for now, working together, we can again bring the wonder of Astronomy to our Bay Area community. Achieving our $35,000 funding goal will help to meet two critical needs:

1. Providing a Public-Program Planetarium Director:

A person who will coordinate, organize, and lead classes and public programs in Astronomy and Science for the Planetarium, working with the current full-time faculty of the college.


2. Provide Planetarium Needs:

There are many challenges ahead and much to be done to accomplish our goals. Our wish list is great, but not unobtainable. Your generous contribution will help us bring back our outreach efforts by enabling us to:

• Purchase materials for new program development (new fulldome films and outreach materials for science activities).

• Expand and enhance our team allowing us to increase our impact and increase  number of community visitors and students we serve.

• Provide training for Chabot students interested in learning the audio visual instrumentation used in our planetarium, so that they can produce programs that will be seen and enjoyed by the greater community.


The Impact

The impact will be enormous. Carl Sagan once said “I can find in my undergraduate classes, bright students who do not know that the stars rise and set at night, or even that the Sun is a star.” We want to make sure our students and our community know at least the basics of astronomy, and hopefully much more about the solar system, the stars,  and the universe in which they live.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word. Any help you can lend by forwarding this campaign link to your own network would be very much appreciated. You can use the Indiegogo share tools above to do this — through Facebook, Twitter, Google+, or email. If you happen to live in our area and would like to get involved, we would be grateful for any time and resources you have to contribute.

Please contact us at email: chabotplanet@gmail.com phone:

(510) 397-9708 or Facebook - http://www.facebook.com/ChabotPlanetarium

Thank you so much!

story:
PRÉSENTATION
www.boldor.com


Le Bol d’Or, c’est 24 heures de course à un rythme infernal pour les équipages de 3 pilotes
comme pour les machines.

 

• Un objectif en OR pour le TEAM PL PERFORMANCES

Venez participer à l'aventure du TEAM PL PERFORMANCES :


Après une saison 2012 incroyable, couronnée du titre de vice champion de france d'endurance O3Z.

Notre envie de montrer aux grands pilotes que des petites équipes sont capable de leur coller à la roue , nous parrait une évidence !

Nous nous fixons comme objectif d'être le premier équipage amateur à accrocher les Teams Usines !

 

En plus de la bonne humeur , et de notre envie, le but de cet évènement étant de montrer de quoi nous sommes capables afin l'an prochain de remettre cela et de pouvoir y associé un but caritatif pour une grande association.


Seul une performance en 2013 sera montrer aux sponsors que l'image qu'on ce fait des motards et de leur solidarité n'est pas qu'une illusion , et qu'il sont capable de transmettre un vrai message.

 

Nous comptons sur vous !

 

 

• Un plateau en or !


Stratégie de course, esprit d’équipe, préparation mentale et physique, parfaite maîtrise technique
et technologique sont autant d’ingrédients indispensables au succès.
Plus de dix nations, dont les teams officiels des plus grands constructeurs animateurs du Master
of Endurance sont engagés dans la conquête du trophée suprême : le fameux Bol d’Or.

 


• Une ambiance en or

 

Au-delà de l’intérêt sportif et médiatique, le Bol d’Or est un événement où règne une ambiance
folle!
La centaine de milliers de motards réunis pour la circonstance vit un week-end de passion débordante.
Les nombreuses animations réparties sur l’ensemble du site occupent le public 24h non-stop (show Stunt, le village, espace tuning, bars, restauration, fête foraine...).
Le confort et la bonne humeur des spectateurs sont assurés grâce à la qualité des services offerts :

camping gratuit, 100 000 places assises en tribunes, sanitaires répartis sur l’ensemble du site, parkings gardés, consignes, etc.
L’accent est également mis sur la sécurité.
L’esprit de fête, renforcé par le traditionnel concert du samedi soir, confère au Bol d’Or une atmosphère que l’on ne retrouve nulle part ailleurs.


LA CATÉGORIE
LA PRÉPARATION


Dans ce championnat plusieurs catégories s’affrontent pendant la course :
- EWC endurance world championship (machines proches du superbike)
- Open (catégorie ouverte aux prototypes et machines hors catégorie)
- Et Superstock dans laquelle nous souhaitons nous engager (machines proches des motos de série)


SUPERSTOCK :


Capacité de motorisation qui doit rester dans la cylindrée homologuée
Modification d’alésage et d’allumage non autorisée
Poids minimum à respecter


• Préparation et entretien des motos par Patrick Lefèvre,
Président de l’association et gérant de la concession PL PERFORMANCES.
Il prépare également tout le matériel nécessaire au bon déroulement des courses et journées d’entrainement (stand matériel, consommables , pneus,
plaquettes, huile moteur , outillage).
• Les pilotes s’entraineront régulièrement afin d’assurer les meilleures performances lors de la course.

Les entrainements seront suivis par l’équipe TEAM PL PERFORMANCES.

 

 

Détails du Budget :

Engagement(1350 €en 2012) :Prévision 2 350 €

Essai pré Bol: 900 €

Pneumatiques : 24 roues arrières et 12 roues avant 8 000 €

Infrastructure BOX(panneau publicitaire, cloisonnement, structure accueil visiteurs, outillage, consommable)6 000 €

Essence 22L /Heure = 1000 L d’essence pour la semaine 1 700 €

story:
It is a story told too often.  So often in fact, that we are rarely fazed by pictures of children caught in the cycle of poverty.  A continual flood of these images has caused many to become passive as the problems appear insurmountable.  I too am guilty of this as I sit in the comfort of my Toronto home, but now living and working in Kenya has changed all that.  The images are no longer safely flashing at me from behind a screen, but are now grasping my hand, kissing my cheek and stroking my hair.  It is not a sad story of desperate children, but a story of hope and potential.  It has only been 1 month since I met Bonface Reteron (10), Joseph Muriuki (10), Grace Wanjiko (9), Gabriel Nyoro (11), Anne Muringo (9), Samuel Muthui (9) and Jeremiah Mahoha (4), but it only took 1 minute for them to work their way into my heart.  With dreams of becoming teachers, pilots and dancers these 7 are not fazed by circumstance, but are determined to rise above their current situation to accomplish their goals.  These are children who dance for hours with no music, eat the same food everyday without complaint and are ecstatic to see you, even when you arrive empty handed. 
 
In 2010, two local teachers (Mwaniki and Cecilia) rescued these 7 children from the Majengo slums and were determined to give them a proper home despite their own meager salaries.  They rented a small house just minutes from Kanoga Primary School in Nyeri and hired a local woman as a live-in caretaker.  While they have given all they have, the home is still lacking essentials such as water and electricity.  Currently the children are carrying home a limited amount of water from the school and are sharing one paraffin lamp amongst the 8 of them (including the caretaker).  Without a sufficient supply of water, the children suffer from ringworm as they cannot properly bathe or wash their sheets.  While Bonface still remains number one in his class, the others are beginning to struggle with the sun setting at 6pm and no light to study by. 
 
After much discussion with the teachers we have determined that $500 per child would be enough to pay for food, school fees, rent and necessities for one year.  This money could also be put towards a number of items including...
 
1) A water tank and pipes to catch and store the rainwater running off the roof     
2) A fence around the property to further ensure the children's safety
3) A paraffin lamp
4) Fertilizer for their garden
5) Firewood
6) Tutors for the children (1 hour per day for all 7 children only amounts to $28 per week). 
 
A small donation can make a big difference in the lives of these children and I encourage everyone to get involved.  I realize that money is tight for many these days, so if you cannot donate please contribute by passing this message along to friends and family. 
 
These children have already contributed a great deal to my life and I can't wait to see with a little help what they can accomplish!
 
Thank you for your support!
 
Rachel & Mary
 
 
                                           The Starfish Story
                                                - Loren Eiseley
While walking along a beach, an elderly gentleman saw someone in the distance leaning down, picking something up and throwing it into the ocean.
 
As he got closer, he noticed that the figure was that of a young man, picking up starfish one by one and tossing each one gently back into the water.

He came closer still and called out, “Good morning! May I ask what it is that you are doing?”

The young man paused, looked up, and replied “Throwing starfish into the ocean.”

The old man smiled, and said, “I must ask, then, why are you throwing starfish into the ocean?”

To this, the young man replied, “The sun is up and the tide is going out. If I don’t throw them in, they’ll die.”

Upon hearing this, the elderly observer commented, “But, young man, do you not realise that there are miles and miles of beach and there are starfish all along every mile? You can’t possibly make a difference!”

The young man listened politely. Then he bent down, picked up another starfish, threw it into the back into the ocean past the breaking waves and said,

                                  “It made a difference for that one.”

story:
“The battle for the kind heart is never won; it must be fought steadily with every child, with every person, with ever new generation.” Captain Will Judy, Founder of National Dog Week – 1949

As Hurricane Sandy knocks at our doors and minds, please take care of your people and pets. Thankfully, government agencies have learned from the past and most shelters will welcome your pets. Be safe please.

National Dog Week has come and gone and we thank all who have joined in our campaign by contributing and sharing the NDW Story. The Paws to Pose cameras are returning and we can't wait to see some great shots of dogs celebrating their special week across America. The Likes on our Face Book Community Page more than doubled, too. Thank you America for helping us spread the bark about our unique canine heritage!

For over twenty years I’ve preserved the past using vintage postcards as a central focus of my unique artwork. The beautiful images of these cards that date from the early 1900s are extended onto their mats in a painterly fashion leaving their unique provenance uncompromised.

In fact, it was a series of poignant black and white postcards depicting dogs and cats that inspired me to start writing. Viewing these moving works of art published over 100 years ago, it struck me that the desire to help our Companion Animals remains a constant and that through the use of the creative process, the message can be powerful and enduring.

These images coupled with my growing curiosity about something called the National Dog Week Movement, fueled my writing career. National Dog Week was established by Captain William Judy in 1928. Judy, who published Dog World Magazine for several decades, set aside the last full week of September to officially honor the nation’s dogs.  Long before their official use, Judy was a champion of military and police dog forces and believed they deserved an organized period of recognition.

My blog was established over two years ago to give this special seven days the relevance it deserves and has introduced me to many incredible people who have made significant changes in the way our Companion Animals are treated.

Today, I am asking you all to help me in my work. The funding I receive will go to the creation of a new website that celebrates the dog-human bond through great literary works, music, painting and more, in the manner Captain Judy intended. It will also help me to promote the positive work of organizations such as Project Pets – Spay, Neuter, Love and Covers for Critters and projects like Paws to Pose.

This year’s National Dog Week Project, Paws to Pose, has dog-lovers throughout the nation capturing the spirit of the American Dog through photos and a journal kept during the week of September 24th. In time, and with more support,  these projects will expand to include many more participants.

HELP GIVE A VENERABLE, MEANINGFUL OBSERVANCE ITS DUE!

If you appreciate and respect man’s best friend, and other loving Companion Animals, enjoy great books and works of art and want to help preserve the integrity of National Dog Week I hope you will fuel my passion. It really is all about tapping the well of compassion and positive energy in humankind.

Even the smallest donation will help. Thank you.

Dr. Patrick Mahaney, Hollywood Vet and TeddyHilton Blogger talked up NATIONAL DOG WEEK last year. http://www.patrickmahaney.com/news/national-dog-week-promotes-animal/

Dr. Patrick Mahaney, Hollywood Vet and TeddyHilton Blogger talked up NATIONAL DOG WEEK last year. http://www.patrickmahaney.com/news/national-dog-week-promotes-animal/

story:
Currently, within the Down syndrome community there are no National Level subscription based publications in circulation catering to families, educators, community leaders, medical providers, foundations, or associations and we would like to change. We would also like to see a copy in every Doctors office in America and abroad. With over 10 years experience in the publishing industry we have the necesary processes in place to ensure our success. We can now easily accomplish this goal by January of 2013 with your help. we could even get issues into some of the big-box chain stores!

Share Your Story!

Are you the proud parent of a child, grandchild, or friend with Down syndrome? Do you have a blog or monthly newsletter within your organization? We want to help you get your stories published and into the mainstream public! More than anything we hope to change the hearts of Medical Providers and potential parents who has received a diagnosis that their child may be born with Down syndrome. We are looking to add writers, researchers, Mom's & Dad's, siblings, and especially Self-Advocates and other individuals with Down syndrome who can articulate their life experiences and help us bring the DS community closer together on a level never available before! Be sure to visit our website (in development) over the next few weeks (we will post regular updates right here) where you will be able to get more information and learn how you can be a part of this great project!

A Perfect Gift!!

Our magazine will make a perfect gift for your friends or loved ones. If you know someone who has a child with Down syndrome or who works in a field of medicine that would benefit from having a subscription, please take advantage of this opportunity and buy them a gift! As a contributor you are making it possible for us to accomplish something completely unexpected by hundreds of thousands of amazing families!

Send Subscriptions To Your Local Doctors Offices!!

Help us reach our Medical Professionals! If you are inspired by this opportunity but don't know anyone within the Down syndrome community, you can still help us!! We want to reach as many doctors' offices, gynecologists, hospitals, caregivers, and the like! So go grab your phone book, call your friends, and let's get this done!!!

Advertisers!

Are you a company, business owner, or product manufacturer that would benefit from reaching 15,000+ families, educators, politicians, and medical providers? This is your opportunity to secure a "Founding" position as an advertiser! Purchase/Sponsor subscriptions in bulk right here to get started!

Affiliates!!

We would love to help support your organization and provide you with an amazing vehicle for reaching families throughout the country. Sponsor in bulk and get them to your members! Together we can make this a reality!

Partners/Sponsors!!

We want to become a partner with your organization and provide you with an amazing vehicle for reaching families throughout the country and adding your voice to ours. Join us and help mold the conversations and messages. Sponsor in bulk and get them to your members. Together we can change hearts!

 Here's How Possible This Is With Your Contribution!

  • With just 1000 subscribers we can print our first two issues.
  • We plan to print every other month to start; 6 issues a year.
  • 3000 subscribers will ensure our first years success.
  • 6000 subscribers will make it possible to print every month!
  • We plan to print at least 15,000 copies of each issue.
  • We will be USPS “Periodical Compliant”.
  • 10,000 subscribers will make it possible to print 20,000 per month, distribute to box stores, and create our smartphone app.
  • 20,000 subscribers will make it possible to print 50,000 per month.
  • Again, one of our primary goals is to get each issue into as many doctors offices as possible.
We are looking for Angels, Founding Sponsors, Partners, Affiliates, Advertisers, Grandparents, and Businesses that would like to help us by sponsor subscriptions in bulk!

If you would like to participate, here’s how you can help & ensure our success.
  • Become a DST Angel by sponsoring 1000 subscriptions.
  • Become a Founding/Sponsor and pre-order 500 subscriptions.
  • Become a Mission Partner and pre-order 100 subscriptions.
  • Become an Affiliate and pre-order 10-50 subscriptions for your members.
  • Grandparents! order 5 issues as gifts for your extended family!

Become a Founding Business Sponsor @ enjoy a 30% placement discount. (Periodical Compliant)

  • “Full Page, Six Issues” Sponsor 421 issues
  • “Half Page, Six Issues” Sponsor 221 Issues
  • “Quarter Page, Six Issues” Sponsor 121 Issues

___________________________________________________________________

WHY IS ALMOST EVERYTHING IN HERE ASSOCIATED WITH THE NUMBER 21?

The 21st Chromosome is one of 23 pairs found in us humans. People normally have two copies of this chromosome. The trisomy of the 21st chromosome (an extra little guy that's attached) causes Down Syndrome. Chromosome 21 is the smallest human chromosome, 47 million nucleotides (the building material of DNA) and representing about 1.5 percent of the total DNA in cells.

In 2000, researchers working on the Human Genome Project announced that they had determined the sequence of base pairs that make up this chromosome. Chromosome 21 was the second human chromosome to be fully sequenced. Pretty cool eh!

story:
Short Summary

Salutations! I'm Bobbi Roque Hornik - a music teacher in Northern Manitoba, Canada. I love getting kids excited and inspired about music.  Many of our students come from homes where music is simply not an option.  The only place these kids get to experience the power of music is in my classroom.  This year I want to add a new dimension to my classroom through drumming.

Drumming is powerful.  It is one of the most ancient of human musical abilities.  All cultures and peoples from around the world had drums. The particular drums I want to get have an interesting story.  

The drums I want to buy are called cajons (ca-hones) and they were the instruments played by the slaves in South America.  Because they were made from shipping crates and could easily be hidden they were the perfect instrument, as slaves were not allowed to play music.

Why are they perfect for us?  They are simple, durable, and sound great!  The people that make them are a small company in Southern Manitoba - so they are "local".  And they handcraft them.  Awesome!

Drumming is empowering and gives these kids a real sense of accomplishment.  When you help us out, you will really be becoming a part of the bigger picture of life on this planet.  These children will remember drumming in my class for years to come.  They may go on to become musicians or may just have their lives enriched beyond anything they have ever known.  

We'd really appreciate it if you'd help us make this dream come true: take some time right this second to enrich the life of a child and click "Contribute Now".

What We Need & What You Get

We need exactly $6440 for 25 drums.  This includes shipping and tax.  I have a whopping budget of $700, so that brings it down to about $5700.  If we don't raise the entire amount I will simply buy fewer drums.  All of the money raised will go towards drums.

We have some wonderful perks that will give you a warm fuzzy feeling every time you think about your contribution.

$25 - A student will write you an email thanking you personally for helping us.  We will include a clip of the student drumming.

$50 - A student will write you an email thanking you personally for helping us.  We will include a clip of the student drumming.  You will receive several mp3s of different groups of students drumming.

$100 - You will get the thank you, the mp3s, and an exclusive video of my elite drumming group playing.

$500 - You will get the thank you, the mp3s, a video of my elite drumming group playing, and we will name a drum after you.  Your name will live on in a drum!

The Impact

In my classroom, all kids are accepted, encouraged, and inspired to be the best person that they can be.  

By helping buy drums you are contributing to a child's sense of self, their belief in their own abilities, and their experience of life as more than just a series of events.  Through playing music they begin to see their lives as melodies interwoven with other sounds to create harmonies that echo throughout the entire world.  Really.  That is how important you are in the life of a child you don't even know.

You are helping enrich a child's education and life.  All for a few bucks you would've spent on fast food or somewhere you wouldn't even remember.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute money, perhaps you would help spread the word?  Email, Facebook, tweet, and tell.  Use any and all methods to let other people know about our campaign.  Sing it from the rooftops if you want!  And remember to use the Indiegogo share tools.

Hey, and if you have an extra cajon lying around that you don't need, want, or use - send it our way.  We'd be glad to have it!

story:
The Groovy Projects

Hello!  Nate Lombardi here!  Thank you for visiting our campaign! There is such wonderful momentum growing after a lot of work with some incredible allies here in NYC.  Andrew Kaufman, Knute Ogren, Diane Johnson, Venus Francois, Scott Frace, Sidnei Beal, Claudia Hehr, Dayna Kline, Avatar Studios, Joe DeBonis, The Museum of Tolerance NY, Christopher Trujillio, Paige Chin, Sara Rae Fletcher, Benjamin Farias, Amanda and Adam Weber, Paul and Bonnie Lombardi and Spicky Hilton have already been generous with their support of this endeavor. We hope to partner with you as well in changing the world! 

A tad bit about me: I come from a family of teachers. (Yep, those of you that know me also know my nerdy, hippie, camp-counseling parents. ) Both of my sisters, in-laws and parents have been teachers in their lifetimes.  “We done be real smart-like and sappy folk.“ =) Last year I received my substitute teacher's license in New York City and volunteered at a public school in Brownsville, Brooklyn.  I was incredibly moved by the students and the innate gifts they had to offer, even though they are in a “High risk” school. Not to go overboard but 1980’s Whitney Houston was right on “I believe the children are our future, teach them well and let the lead the way. Show them all the beauty that they have inside….Come on, Everybody now!”

I have always wanted to affect children in a major way and inspire them. I hope to empower them with this presentation and these artistic projects across the country. I believe that the most effective way to make a lasting impression on a student is for them to physically and emotionally get involved in these life lessons.  If we can get them laughing, moving and challenging themselves, it will open up their mouths & chests for us to reach in and touch their brains & hearts.  It’s so important to show them this positive lifestyle option as they are forming their opinions of this world.  (It’s literally the only way that worked for “Mister ADHD“ over here writing the pitch)

The Groovy Projects is a company that empowers students and their teachers to understand how lifting up their peers feels worlds better than breaking them down. Also educating them on how to deal with bullying in order to make it stop. There are many “Groovy Projects” to go about reaching them, including interactive student presentations (and training), art/song contests, DVDs, CD games, short movies, and music videos.  I will enlist some of New York City’s most talented visionaries, on our mission to mold thousands… millions… BILLIONS of children’s perspectives on how to live a positive, encouraging and fulfilling life. We will get these kids excited and involved about creating inspiring art while doing good!

This year I had the privilege to work with the children of Madison-Oneida BOCES, It was quite easy for me to relate to them and their attention spans. (I think I’ve taken 12 snack breaks as I’ve written this.)  This school gets a bad rap and is the “last chance” for some of them. But let me tell you- they are great kids.  The incomparable Emmy and Tony award winning producer, Jennifer Maloney-Prezioso, conceived/directed/produced shot an anti-bullying school music video with Five Time Emmy Winner Joe DeBonis to one of my songs called THE GROOVY PROJECT, which landed us a segment on ABC's 20/20 with Chris Cuomo that discusses the mindsets and rehabilitation of bullies! Here’s the interviews and music video. Please watch!  http://abcnews.go.com/2020/video/groovy-project-music-video-inspires-bullies-change-18432235

"The Groovy Project" received a lot of coverage, and over three-dozen celebrities re-tweeted the music video with enthusiastic remarks. We're so proud of what we’ve accomplished thus far!   Madison-Oneida BOCES has since changed its curriculum and the kids were greatly affected. The music video also led me to hosting and performing in the “Bullied Bus Monitor” Karen Klein’s “No Bully Tour” this October for National Bullying Awareness Month. And now I can’t stop!  There's much more to do!

This has been the perfect platform for me to align with my life goals. A bunch of leads and possibilities arose because people came out of the woodwork to help further this important cause of empowering our youth. Now, with my friends, I'm dedicated to spreading his message to schools and creating content! Click on this appendage of NateKid.com to see The School Presentation and a sampling of the content that will be on TheGroovyProjects.com (which is being built now!) THE GROOVY PROJECTS


With your tax-deductible donation to our account via indiegogo/Fractured Atlas, we can make this mission a REALITY. Please also share this with all of your family, friends, and companies that might rally behind us!

Here are the projects we have planned with your help:

The School presentation agenda:

-To Perform at the Museum of Tolerance for pro-bono for a group of students.

-To book Schools and offer them the return “Groovy Projects” (for free, if paid for with donations,) and for fees if they have the money.  

-Two Pubic Schools in the Bronx pro-bono that we've committed to.

-To approach schools ASAP is important because there are Anti-Bullying Laws that go into effect in July so school will be looking for programs before then.

               *One insurance company covers all the charter schools in NYC. I need to go after them ASAP before they find some else.

 

Project #1

Create positive music in a professional setting that we can give to schools.  The goal is to have an instrumental version for the students to write their own verses and choruses. We will then have a contest for the students and offer them some cool incentives like recording at NYC top recording studio, Avatar!

We’ll ask industry veteran Deejays/producers to donate beats, or give a discounted rate with a small percentage of the purchased material. This will legitimize us in the industry with the hopes of reaching even more celebrated and current hit makers.

 

Project #2

Create a DVD where we illustrate anti-bullying techniques, What to do or say when a bully does certain things to you.  Gay? Fat? Ugly? Short? Terrorist? Etc.  It will contain interviews with successful people that have been bullied. Us playing Izzy Kalman’s “The idiot game.“ 

Teach basic and fun skills including: Beatbox, Ballroom, Swing, Salsa, Body percussion, Freestyle rhyme vs poems, Tap dance, Hip-hop, Ballet and Exercise, Piano, Music production, Music Theory, Guitar.

#2a Flash Drives would be offered instead of, or in addition to the CD and DVD it would contain the “CD,” The Groovy Project video,  “DVD” lessons, the Speech.

 

Project #3

An art and photography contest where we highlight how “Cool” it is to be an individual, no matter what is said by bullies and “haters.”

 

Product #4

To work with educators in order to create an empowering curriculum for younger students.  To interview and student the Olweus Program, meet with Dr. Joel Haber, and Josh Shipp.

 

Project #5

T-Shirts, Stickers, Binders, Book Covers etc 

 

As you would rightfully assume, there are some initial start up costs that are needed to establish and then maintain the company.  Donations will go to materials, recording, photography and video equipment, legal costs, “The Groovy Projects” logo, website costs, business cards, merchandise and administrative costs. 

For the “Projects” we have friends that are very successful in the industry with great equipment that we’ve used, but it was borrowed; and we cannot continue to borrow equipment for every project if we plan to do this on a regular basis. (For example we edited “The Groovy Project” video at The David Letterman’s Show editing suite.) 

To have the right equipment would be most cost effective in a well-oiled machine, which can create these projects “in house.”   If, at the beginning, we outsource services and equipment, will get the best possible price because of our resources and relationships.  So you should expect all of “The Projects” to look and sound like they cost a fortune.  If they do run over budget, which is unlikely, it will be for the right reasons, because every dollar will be spent wisely and approved by the non-for-profit Fractured Atlas.

Here is the of planned projects and their estimated costs from start to finish:

School Assembly

To send a speaker to a school to speak- $500-1500 a day.  Up to 3 schools. Plus Travel.  This fee is on the low to medium side for assembly speakers. We will first look to the schools’ budgets before The Groovy Projects’ budget.

Anti-Bullying/Empowering Music CD for Elementary School students $25,000

Recording Studio, Songwriters, Music Producer Fees, CD Materials, Printing, Copyrights, Mixing, Mastering Hard drives, Studio Engineers.

 

Anti-Bullying/Empowering Music CD for High School Students $25,000

Recording Studio, Songwriters, Music Producer Fees, CD Materials, Printing, Copyrights, Mixing, Mastering Hard drives, Studio Engineers.

 

Anti-Bullying/Empowering DVD lessons 50,000

Recording Studio, Director, Assistant Director, Production Assistants, Grips, Best Boy, Lighting Equipment, Producer, DVD Materials, Printing, Copyrights, Mixing, Mastering, Editing Suites, Hard drives, Editors Computer Software,

 

Music Videos $20-25,000

Director, Assistant Director, Production Assistants, Grips, Best Boy, Lighting Equipment, Producer, DVD Materials, Printing, Copyrights, Mixing, Mastering, Editing Suites, Hard drives, Editors Computer Software,

 

Short Movies $20,000

Director, Assistant Director, Production Assistants, Grips, Best Boy, Lighting Equipment, Producer, DVD Materials, Printing, Copyrights, Mixing, Mastering, Editing Suites, Hard drives, Editors Computer Software,

 

Once these products are finished we want to sell them to schools and organizations that can afford them and DONATE them to students, school and organizations that cannot.

No-Copy DVDs will be sold for $16.99, 10 for $155, 100 for $1,500

No-Copy CD’s will be sold for $13.99 10 for $120 100 for $1,000

Unlimited Use Hard Drives will be sold for $750 two for $1150 5 for 1,500

One can donate to purchase these products for the low-income environments:

 

 If you can't afford 10 bucks for the cause please share this with your wealthy friends and likeminded individuals who want to make a difference!

-Two Pubic Schools in the Bronx pro-bono that we've committed to.
-To approach schools ASAP is important because there are Anti-Bullying Laws that go into effect in July so school will be looking for programs before then.
               *One insurance company covers all the charter schools in NYC. I need to go after them ASAP before they find some else.
 
Project #1 
Create positive music in a professional setting that we can give to schools.  The goal is to have an instrumental version for the students to write their own verses and choruses. We will then have a contest for the students and offer them some cool incentives like recording at NYC top recording studio, Avatar!
We’ll ask industry veteran Deejays/producers to donate beats, or give a discounted rate with a small percentage of the purchased material. This will legitimize us in the industry with the hopes of reaching even more celebrated and current hit makers.
 
Project #2
Create a DVD where we illustrate anti-bullying techniques, What to do or say when a bully does certain things to you.  Gay? Fat? Ugly? Short? Terrorist? Etc.  It will contain interviews with successful people that have been bullied. Us playing Izzy Kalman’s “The idiot game.“ 
Teach basic and fun skills including: Beatbox, Ballroom, Swing, Salsa, Body percussion, Freestyle rhyme vs poems, Tap dance, Hip-hop, Ballet and Exercise, Piano, Music production, Music Theory, Guitar.
#2a Flash Drives would be offered instead of, or in addition to the CD and DVD it would contain the “CD,” The Groovy Project video,  “DVD” lessons, the Speech.
 
Project #3
An art and photography contest where we highlight how “Cool” it is to be an individual, no matter what is said by bullies and “haters.”
 
Product #4 
To work with educators in order to create an empowering curriculum for younger students.  To interview and student the Olweus Program, meet with Dr. Joel Haber, and Josh Shipp.
 
Project #5
T-Shirts, Stickers, Binders, Book Covers etc 
 
As you would rightfully assume, there are some initial start up costs that are needed to establish and then maintain the company.  Donations will go to materials, recording, photography and video equipment, legal costs, “The Groovy Projects” logo, website costs, business cards, merchandise and administrative costs. 
For the “Projects” we have friends that are very successful in the industry with great equipment that we’ve used, but it was borrowed; and we cannot continue to borrow equipment for every project if we plan to do this on a regular basis. (For example we edited “The Groovy Project” video at The David Letterman’s Show editing suite.) 
To have the right equipment would be most cost effective in a well-oiled machine, which can create these projects “in house.”   If, at the beginning, we outsource services and equipment, will get the best possible price because of our resources and relationships.  So you should expect all of “The Projects” to look and sound like they cost a fortune.  If they do run over budget, which is unlikely, it will be for the right reasons, because every dollar will be spent wisely and approved by the non-for-profit Fractured Atlas.
Here is the of planned projects and their estimated costs from start to finish:
School Assembly
To send a speaker to a school to speak- $500-1500 a day.  Up to 3 schools. Plus Travel.  This fee is on the low to medium side for assembly speakers. We will first look to the schools’ budgets before The Groovy Projects’ budget.
Anti-Bullying/Empowering Music CD for Elementary School students $25,000
Recording Studio, Songwriters, Music Producer Fees, CD Materials, Printing, Copyrights, Mixing, Mastering Hard drives, Studio Engineers.
 
Anti-Bullying/Empowering Music CD for High School Students $25,000
Recording Studio, Songwriters, Music Producer Fees, CD Materials, Printing, Copyrights, Mixing, Mastering Hard drives, Studio Engineers.
 
Anti-Bullying/Empowering DVD lessons 50,000
Recording Studio, Director, Assistant Director, Production Assistants, Grips, Best Boy, Lighting Equipment, Producer, DVD Materials, Printing, Copyrights, Mixing, Mastering, Editing Suites, Hard drives, Editors Computer Software,
 
Music Videos $20-25,000
Director, Assistant Director, Production Assistants, Grips, Best Boy, Lighting Equipment, Producer, DVD Materials, Printing, Copyrights, Mixing, Mastering, Editing Suites, Hard drives, Editors Computer Software,
 
Short Movies $20,000
Director, Assistant Director, Production Assistants, Grips, Best Boy, Lighting Equipment, Producer, DVD Materials, Printing, Copyrights, Mixing, Mastering, Editing Suites, Hard drives, Editors Computer Software,
 
Once these products are finished we want to sell them to schools and organizations that can afford them and DONATE them to students, school and organizations that cannot.
No-Copy DVDs will be sold for $16.99, 10 for $155, 100 for $1,500
No-Copy CD’s will be sold for $13.99 10 for $120 100 for $1,000
Unlimited Use Hard Drives will be sold for $750 two for $1150 5 for 1,500
One can donate to purchase these products for the low-income environments:
 
 If you can't afford 10 bucks for the cause please share this with your wealthy friends and likeminded individuals who want to make a difference!

story:
3DTrainer.com has been making the very best in computer animation training for over 10 years now. Our instructors have worked at major film and gaming studios like Ubisoft and Industrial Light and Magic. And have worked on films like Rango, Lord of the Rings, and Avatar.

Now it's time to reboot 3DTrainer and re-record all of award winning training in the latest version of the computer animation software we teach. We will also be creating hours upon hours of new computer animation training videos that teaches viewers everything from the basics to advanced 3D skills.

With your support we will re-record all of our current training in the latest version of Maya 2013, covering the latest features and techniques. And will be adding tons of new videos covering the latest features and techniques.

Here are just some of the many series we will be creating.

  • Introduction to Computer Animation and Autodesk Maya
  • Basics of Polygon Modeling
  • Advanced Modeling Techniques
  • Introduction to Animation
  • Paint Effects
  • Maya nCloth System
  • Texture Mapping
  • Hard surface Modeling
  • Rendering
  • Physical Dynamics
  • Particle Dynamic
  • Rigging
  • Scene Setup and Video Creation
  • ZBrush
  • KeyShot
  • GameSalad
  • GameDesign

Currently all the videos at 3DTrainer.com are free for you to preview while we run our Indigogo campain. Once the campain ends here on indigogo all our videos will convert back to paided, and will need to be purchased to be viewed. But if you pledge your support now you will recieve a lifetime membership to 3DTrainer. That's a life of the latest training for computer animation and game design.

Here are just some of the amazing titles you will have lifetime access to:

Introduction to Autodesk Maya

This series of tutorials will take you step by step through the fundaments of 3D with Autodesk Maya. Wether you are completely new to the world of 3D animation and modeling or an industry pro, this training series will help you take your skills to the next level.

 
Polygon Modeling Tools

With over 50 powerful polygon modeling operation available to you in Autodesk Maya, this set of training tutorials will quickly show you each tool and how it can be used. Learning all these tool early on will help you become a proficient and skilled 3D modeler.

 
Polygon Modeling Techniques

Now that you have learned about all of the polygon modeling tools available to you within Autodesk Maya, it's time to put what you have learned to good use. This series of training tutorials teaches you how to make clean and efficient geometry with precise surfaces and clean bevels.

 

Walker Animation Project

This set of tutorials takes the complicated task of animation, and breaks it down in simple step by step tutorials which will have you animating in Autodesk Maya in no time at all. These easy to follow videos show you how to animate a robot walker and create your first animated walk cycle.

 

Alien Modeling Project

Modeling your first character can be a bit daunting if you don't follow some simple rules. This series of videos will show you how to quickly model an alien character in Autodesk Maya. Through out these tutorials you will be lead step by step through the process of modeling an entire character head to toe.

 
Fundamentals of Animation

Now that you have had a taste of animation in the "Walker" training series it's time to take your skills to the next level as award winning animator David Bokser takes you step by step through each tutorial teaching you the fundamentals of great animation techniques.

 
Robot Modeling Project

Wether you are modeling something simple or the complex curves of a concept car, good flowing geometry is essential for achieving the shapes you want to create. This set of tutorial videos shows you how to build complex forms in Autodesk Maya in easy to follow steps.

 

Paint Effects

Paint Effects within Autodesk Maya is a powerful tool which allows you to quickly create entire worlds of plants, effects, and structors all with simple paint strokes. This series of tutorials videos will teach you the many powerful settings and features of Paint Effects.

 

Introduction to Texturing

Being a great texture artist starts with knowing the fundamentals of texturing. This series of training videos takes you step by step through many powerful texturing techniques within Autodesk Maya. These tutorials start you off with the basics, before moving on to more advanced features.

 

Alien Planet Project

Throughout the past several training series we have been coving many important fundamentals in various areas like modeling, texturing, and animation. Now it's time to put all of those tools to work as we create an entire animated scene of an alien world within Autodesk Maya.

 

Concept Car Modeling

Josh Bare is a veteran modeler of the film and video game industries. He has worked on such films as King Kong, at Weta Digital in New Zealand, and block buster games like Gotham Racing. 4 Throughout this training series Josh will teach industry techniques for modeling concept cars.

 

Working with 3D Layers in Photoshop

Photoshop has always been known for 2D design. In recent years Adobe has pushed the envelope by adding some very exciting 3D features. This series of tutorials will take you step by step through the workflow of modeling an object in Autodesk Maya which is then imported into Photoshop for texturing.

 

Introduction to nCloth

With the introduction of the nucleus engine in Autodesk Maya came a new, more power, and highly accurate dynamics system. Maya nCloth lets you create incredibly realistic cloth simulations. This set of video tutorials will teach you all of the core features and settings for nCloth.

 

Rendering with Mental Ray

Throughout this training series, Matt Berenty a veteran in the 3D industry, teaches you step by step how to set up realistic skin shaders in Autodesk Maya using Mental Ray.

 

AND MUCH MUCH MORE!

story:
No Paypal, why? See below

What is CouchPotato

For people who read this and go "Da fuck is this!?".
 
CouchPotato is an automatic NZB and torrent downloader, just fill in what you want to see and CouchPotato will add it to your "want to watch"-list. Every day it will search through multiple NZBs & Torrents sites, looking for the best possible match.
Once a correct release is found, it will send it to your favorite download app.
 

Why do you need a server that costs money!?

The server gets hit with around 40 requests per second. It is used for movie info, searches, movie ETA and checking if an imdb url is a movie (and not a show). Next to that the forum and other stuff CouchPotato related.
All this needs speed. You don't want to wait 10s before a search is returns results, instant is what we want! The current server can keep up in the slow hours, but on sunday evening (the busiest hours) it sometimes takes more than 20s to return something..
 

What will this money get me?

The 1500 bucks will pay for the server costs for 1 year. I currently use FutureHosting as a provider, but I don't know if I'll stay with them. This will not pay for the full package, but I will pay the rest myself. Even if the goal isn't reached, the costs will be there and I will be paying for it myself ;)
I never done anything like this and have no idea if this will work out.
 

Update: already made it to 1500 dollars! What now?

I'm working on a new, easier and more plugable API server, written in NodeJS. Now I can't promise anything, but I'm writing this with the idea in mind that I can run from multiple sources. So eventually, when the time is ready, I might opensource it so a few people that want to, can run their own.
The extra money will go to testing some of this stuff out, getting a small seperate NodeJS server. The rest will just be used for next year!

Why can't I use Paypal?

Paypal is playing internet police. They blocked my account a few months ago, letting me wait to get my money out (luckily it wasn't much). So I don't have Paypal and will never again will be able to use Paypal unless I change my name. I tried making a new account, but it got blocked a few minutes after it was created.
I understand that some of you don't have a creditcard, but I can't 'un-asshole' Paypal ;)

story:
BREAKING NEWS!! Dreams come true!

Due to your incredible generosity....ALL Additional donations will go to Social Justice Field Trips!! 

Hello! We are Urban Art Beat.

We provide incredibly personal and transformative workshops that use art and music as a medium for change. Our dream is to run a Free Summer Camp in the heart of NYC where young people, 12-21, can express themselves artistically, learn new musical skills and build life long relationships. 

 

Like to make a tax deductible donation? Please do so through our fiscal sponsor, NYFA. http://urbanartbeat.org/site/donations/

A quick history .....

2006: Founded in the Bronx  For the past seven years we have drawn on the positive, collaborative and creative practices of NYC's original Hip Hop culture to engage and inspire our most under served youth in the tri-state and across the globe.

2011: First Summer Workshops  We realized that young talent across the city were not being creatively challenged during July and August so we started a small summer "camp." Community Activism was our focus. Ten teens wrote and recorded original songs, ran workshops for everyone from toddlers to adults effected by domestic violence, and toured the five boroughs spreading inspiration.

2012: Summer Camp at The Door    Last year we partnered with The Door- A Center for Alternatives that has been serving young people since 1972. As Door members our participants had access to access to safe space, musical instruments, free meals, health care, legal support, college guidance, job training and more.

2013: You Join the Movement!

SUMMER CAMP 3.0!! With your help, we will offer young people, age 12-21, six weeks of free Summer Camp at The Door. Participants will learn how to write, perform, and record their own lyrics on social justice topics. Not only that, with the expertise of our talented mentors and dedicated volunteers, students will compose their own musical scores, improve their craft and musicianship and learn how to collaborate successfully with other artists to make a difference. 

We pride ourselves on our ability to give individualized attention, this fosters life long relationships and empowers our participants to harness their creativity to make the world a better place. 

WHEN YOU GIVE...

$25 A young person recieves a music lesson! 

$65 A young person can go to camp for a week!

$400 A young person can go to camp all summer!

We will maintain a 1:5 mentor:youth ratio, providing the close, personalized mentorship and instruction we believe is integral to our mission and often absent from many of our students’ lives outside of UAB.

Thanks to The Door, we are 1/2 way there!! They have provided us with their space, equipment, and meals. Add that to your Indiegogo donations, and together we will create an incredibly memorable Summer Camp experience!

Here's our budget for the entire summer:

 

If we raise more than our projected goal, we will be able to take our talented youth out into the community on "Social Justice Field Trips," that include Domestic Violence Shelters, Immigrant Rights Marches, Park Clean Ups and more!" Music makes any event better, and we love to share ours!

 THANK YOU FOR SUPPORTING CREATIVITY IN OUR YOUTH

POSITIVE ENCOURAGEMENT LEADS TO GOAL BASEDGROWTH!  

Like to make a tax deductible donation? Please do so through our fiscal sponsor, NYFA. http://urbanartbeat.org/site/donations/

Join the movement! Your contributions will change a life. We cannot do this alone! Please add your voice to our cause by personally telling your friends and family!  THANK YOU! Generations of Gratitude!

story:
Pajama Program

Thousands of children visit Pajama Program's Reading Center every year. In our New Reading Center we will be able to serve even more. We will continue providing New Pajamas and New Books to children living in various situations including foster care, group homes, shelters and temporary housing facilities. Many of these children are abandoned, abused or neglected. 

 

How you can help

We need help finishing our New Reading Center:

  • Book Shelves to run the length of the walls $3300.
  • Pajama Storage $375
  • A Rug for the children to sit on $380
  • 2 revolving book towers $1100
  • Pajama and book totes $845

If we don't reach our goal, we will put the donated money toward as many of the items we can purchase. All Contributions are appreciated. Any contribution above $100 get you invited to the Ribbon Cutting Ceremony on June 5th, 2013.

 

The Impact

By contributing to Pajama Program's Reading Center, you will be providing children in need a safe place to read with an adult. For many of these children it is rare to have an adult read with them, and encourage them. You will be making a difference to children in need.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help in other ways as well.

 http://pajamaprogram.org/WordPress/help-us/

use the Indiegogo share tools to let other know about us!

story:
Summary

Hello, my name is Dawn and I am actor and lover of theatre and Shakespeare. I began specialising in Shakespeare at the age of 20 when I was accepted into the London Academy of Music and Dramatic Art in 2007 in an intensive Shakespeare course.

Combing a love of acting and travelling I headed to New Zealand in 2009 where I was accepted into the South Seas Film & Television School to develop my skills in On-Screen Acting. After graduating I got and agent and have been working in New Zealand as a professional actor ever since.

I have worked in numerous theatre productions and recently worked on a NZ television drama. I have my own acting studio in Central Auckland, ‘Studio the Stage’, and it is here where I train and teach acting and Shakespeare.

I have been accepted into the Shakespeare Institute to study a Masters Degree in Shakespeare & Theatre Studies. I will be studying this course via Distance Learning between 24-36 months.

The Shakespeare Institute programme focuses on how Shakespeare's plays work in performance. It encourages a historical approach to interpretation and styles of presentation and it promotes the value of close reading as the basis for evaluating the plays on the page, stage, and screen. I will have the opportunity to look at different productions and adaptations of Shakespeare’s plays in their historical, political, and cultural contexts and think about the performance choices actors and directors make when approaching Shakespeare’s texts.

I have many creative visions about what exactly I want to achieve after completion of my Masters and then PhD in Shakespeare and Theatres Studies. Mostly, like any Shakespeare lover, I want to come up with new ways of telling the stories that can be accessible through all cultures, countries and ultimately languages.

Ultimately you will be giving me the chance to share my knowledge of Shakespeare around the globe. By helping in this campaign you will be giving me peace of mind of not having to worry about whether I can afford the next module or not. You will be giving me the freedom to concentrate 100% on my studies which will allow me to really excel and achieve the very most out of this important time of study.

Breakdown of Costs

This Postgraduate Masters Degree in Shakespeare Studies is £5,490 in total.

Fees for part-time and distance learning modes are £610 per module and £1,830 for the dissertation:

6 modules x £610 = £3,660

1 x dissertation = £1,830

Total course fee is £5,490 ($8,385 USD)

If this campaign is successful any additional money I raise will be put towards my studies, more specifically, suggested textbooks and reading material and research towards my PhD.

If I don’t reach my intended goal, any money I raise will still go towards this campaign. I have accepted my place at the Shakespeare Institute and am able to pay the course fee in instalments.

The Impact

I feel I will influence and guide many people from an actors’ point of view as well as a practitioner’s point of view and I would relish the opportunity to encourage and strengthen peoples’ perceptions of Shakespeare and his work in an influential and constructive way. Ultimately I want people to have the same approach to and adoration of Shakespeare as I do which in turn will continue his work around the globe in a myriad of new forms.

The very thought of starting my Masters to PhD in Shakespeare and Theatre Studies not only excites me, it grounds me. I'm here because it is something I am dedicated to learn about and eventually teach. All I ask from you is that you take a chance on me.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about my campaign. If you are not able to help but know of others who may then please share this with them especially those who are interested in the arts, Shakespeare or making someone’s dream come true.

 

Thank you!
story_txt:
Summary
Hello, my name is Dawn and I am actor and lover of theatre and Shakespeare. I began specialising in Shakespeare at the age of 20 when I was accepted into the London Academy of Music and Dramatic Art in 2007 in an intensive Shakespeare course.
Combing a love of acting and travelling I headed to New Zealand in 2009 where I was accepted into the South Seas Film & Television School to develop my skills in On-Screen Acting. After graduating I got and agent and have been working in New Zealand as a professional actor ever since.
I have worked in numerous theatre productions and recently worked on a NZ television drama. I have my own acting studio in Central Auckland, ‘Studio the Stage’, and it is here where I train and teach acting and Shakespeare.
I have been accepted into the Shakespeare Institute to study a Masters Degree in Shakespeare & Theatre Studies. I will be studying this course via Distance Learning between 24-36 months.
The Shakespeare Institute programme focuses on how Shakespeare's plays work in performance. It encourages a historical approach to interpretation and styles of presentation and it promotes the value of close reading as the basis for evaluating the plays on the page, stage, and screen. I will have the opportunity to look at different productions and adaptations of Shakespeare’s plays in their historical, political, and cultural contexts and think about the performance choices actors and directors make when approaching Shakespeare’s texts.
I have many creative visions about what exactly I want to achieve after completion of my Masters and then PhD in Shakespeare and Theatres Studies. Mostly, like any Shakespeare lover, I want to come up with new ways of telling the stories that can be accessible through all cultures, countries and ultimately languages.
Ultimately you will be giving me the chance to share my knowledge of Shakespeare around the globe. By helping in this campaign you will be giving me peace of mind of not having to worry about whether I can afford the next module or not. You will be giving me the freedom to concentrate 100% on my studies which will allow me to really excel and achieve the very most out of this important time of study.
Breakdown of Costs
This Postgraduate Masters Degree in Shakespeare Studies is £5,490 in total.
Fees for part-time and distance learning modes are £610 per module and £1,830 for the dissertation:
6 modules x £610 = £3,660
1 x dissertation = £1,830
Total course fee is £5,490 ($8,385 USD)
If this campaign is successful any additional money I raise will be put towards my studies, more specifically, suggested textbooks and reading material and research towards my PhD.
If I don’t reach my intended goal, any money I raise will still go towards this campaign. I have accepted my place at the Shakespeare Institute and am able to pay the course fee in instalments.
The Impact
I feel I will influence and guide many people from an actors’ point of view as well as a practitioner’s point of view and I would relish the opportunity to encourage and strengthen peoples’ perceptions of Shakespeare and his work in an influential and constructive way. Ultimately I want people to have the same approach to and adoration of Shakespeare as I do which in turn will continue his work around the globe in a myriad of new forms.
The very thought of starting my Masters to PhD in Shakespeare and Theatre Studies not only excites me, it grounds me. I'm here because it is something I am dedicated to learn about and eventually teach. All I ask from you is that you take a chance on me.
Other Ways You Can Help
Please spread the word about my campaign. If you are not able to help but know of others who may then please share this with them especially those who are interested in the arts, Shakespeare or making someone’s dream come true.
 
Thank you!

story:
The children of our military service personnel need your help to attend a one week summer camp with their peers.

Operation Military Kids has sent kids to a one week camp for the last 2 years. Unfortunately, their funding was cut this year due to sequestration.  

Through OMK, Military Youth:

  • Meet other youth who are also experiencing deployment
  • Participate in a range of recreational, social & educational programs
  • Gain leadership, organizational, and technical skills by participating in the Speak Out for Military Kids program or Mobile Technology Lab programs
  • Attend single day, weekend or even longer residential camps

Operation: Military Kids is the U.S. Army's collaborative effort with America's communities to support children and youth impacted by deployment. Regardless of whether Families are experiencing deployment for the first time, the second time or another in a series of multiple deployments, OMK’s goal is to connect military children and youth with local resources in order to achieve a sense of community support and enhance their well-being.

In 2011, over 103,000 youth participated in experiences conducted by State OMK Teams in 49 states and the District of Columbia.  

This year we need your help to send these kids to camp.  Any amount will help us reach our goal.  Last year we were able to get 48 kids from Indiana, Michigan and Illinois to camp.  Help if you can, these kids deserve our support!

For your donation you will receive:

$5 donation- Some peace in knowing you have helped                      

$10 donation- One camper personalized thank you note                     

$50 donation- Five campers personalized thank you note                   

$100 donation- Ten campers personalized thank you note                    

$500 donation- All campers attending signed thank you note                

$1000 donation- Group photo and all camper thank you note            

$5000 donation- Group photo and all camper thank you note and a camper made survival bracelet                           

$10,000 donation- Photo book of camp week, thank you, and bracelet, and halo waiting for you!

  Amount Cost/Camper

# of Campers
Campers $18,900.00 $300.00 63
Transportation $1,500.00    
Art Supplies $400.00    
Misc. & Fees $1200.00    
Total $22,000.00    

We hope we can reach our goal through Indiegogo.  Any extra funds raised will be used for OMK camp next year.  We are a 501(c)3 and these funds will only be used for OMK.  You will receive a tax receipt for your donation.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this page and fundraising campaign via the Indiegogo share tools.  Like it to raise awareness.

If you cannot afford to help right now, help us spread the word about this campaign or Operation Military Kids.  If you have any questions regarding our camp or my interest in helping these kids get to camp this year give me a call.  My cell # is 219-201-1101 and my work # is 219-395-9555 Email me at  gbenson@duneslearningcenter.org

My name is Geof Benson and I am the Executive Director of Dunes Learning Center, an outdoor education center located inside Indiana Dunes National Lakeshore.

story:
My name is Erin Banwell and I am the conceptual artist behind The Pyrosphere. In 2010 The Nexus Pyrosphere made its appearance at Burning Man. In 2013 it will be returning, new and improved, with the most advanced technology that fire art has ever seen. In addition to it's mind-blowing 3d fire animations, Black Rock Citizens will be able to control the Pyrosphere in real time with an IPad. Also, the old spider like legs will be replaced by a slightly shorter, less prominent stand.

We would like to see the Pyrosphere grace the playa again this year. In 2010 it had a big impact on the night-scape of BRC and this year we intend to do it even better! 

As far as we know, The Pyrosphere has more flame emitters than any other Burning Man fire art, EVER, and it is definitely the most flame emitters symultaneously controlled by a computer to appear at Black Rock city.

All this amazing-ness takes money, and we are completely crowdfunded (Burning Man has never given us a grant of any kind!) so we are humbly asking you to please contribute to The Nexus Pyrosphere!

 The Team

Erin Banwell, Steve Cronberg, Shannon Stillman, Sean Mitchell, Jordan Layman, Billy Hopkins, James Hall, Shine Couboi

What We Need

Our goal is to raise $15,000 for transportation, fuel, new electronic control system (custom built by us!), Hot Surface Ignitors (in the past we literally lit this thing with Bic lighters and a ladder!!), new wiring, and a few other fixes and upgrades.

The Impact

Check out the making of the Pyrosphere video progress reports:

http://nexusorg.org/category/fire-art/pyrosphere-fire-art/

Anyone can create patterns for the Pyrosphere! Try it out here!

http://nexusorg.org/2010/blog/pyrosphere-sequencer-with-video-tutorial/

More videos of The Pyrosphere in action:

http://www.youtube.com/nexus+pyrosphere

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! We need all the help we can get.

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it!

story:
Get British Columbians AMPED about Music!

THANK YOU! Thanks to our amazing supporters, we have surpassed our goal of raising $15,000 to build AMPED, a one-of-a-kind exhibition showcasing the science, technology, creativity and craft behind the art of music.

Our next goal is to pass the $20,000 mark. With this extra funding we'll be able to make AMPED extraordinary with expanded content and greater interactive opportunities within the exhibition.

As a charity, Science World needs the community to help build this innovative 5,000 square foot exhibit from scratch—and that’s where you come in. Donate today and receive some exciting “perks” including passes to see AMPED when it opens, and a few exclusive opportunities for the serious supporters.  

We want to show that making music is creative and fun; that anyone can make music; and if you’re passionate about it, you could consider one of the many career opportunities in the music industry that the exhibit will highlight.

How will your gift will be put to work?

  • Building materials;  everything from wood to paint to construct recording station booths, DJ re-mix stations, jamming stations and a lounge area within the exhibit
  • Special Programming delivered by our special “AMPLIFIED” volunteers – members of the music community who will be sharing their talent and expertise with our visitors
  • Video production and Displays: we’ll be interviewing music professionals with inside knowledge of the music business, and displaying these clips throughout the exhibit
  • Music Artifacts, lighting, signage, design-work and everything else that is going to make this exhibit spectacular! 

Thank you for checking out the AMPED campaign, and sharing our video through email, Facebook and Twitter.

AMPED Referrals Contest! How to make your referrals count:

1. Make sure you’re logged in to Indiegogo (link on the top right). It is important that you use your main email, so that we can notify you if you win.

2. Share the AMPED campaign using the link and buttons beneath the video. 

3. These buttons are unique to you, so every time someone clicks on a link or share, you get a point!

4. Contest runs till June 21. We’ll tally up the referrals and the top sharer will win a pair of tickets to one of three summer concerts:

Selena Gomez – AUG 14 / Rogers Arena 
Buckcherry – JUN 28 / Commodore Ballroom (19+)
De la Soul – JUL 19 / Commodore Ballroom (19+)

(Note that both Commodore shows have a 19+ age restriction)

story:
Our Story

We are a small collective of radicals and political activists putting on a three day event in central Oxford on the first weekend of March, 2nd-4th. We have a huge number of high profile speakers and groups already confirmed including Terry Eagleton, author of Why Marx was Right, groups like The No Tar Sands Campaign, Traveller Solidarity Network, plus a whole host more.  

In the last year, as the global economic crisis has deepened, we have seen revolutions sweep dictators from power across the Middle East and North Africa and resistance to austerity spread across Europe and the US with the Occupy Movement. There have been a number of general strikes in Greece and mass strikes in Britain.

 

This year's Oxford Radical Forum (ORF) will be held from 2-4th March. This will be the fifth anniversary of the forum, run by students, lecturers and local activists based in the city. This year it is bigger than ever, with almost thirty sessions over a host of colleges and venues during the weekend.

 

The forum opens with â€˜the MENA Revolutions: One Year Onâ€™, with Nadine El-Enany (activist from Cairo), Gilbert Achcar (SOAS), Anne Alexander (Cambridge) and Firoze Manji (Pambazuka Press). This will be followed by a discussion between Terry Eagleton and Alex Callinicos on â€˜Why Marx was Rightâ€™.

 

Over the weekend, we will bring together Occupy activists from New York via live link-up with activists from Occupy London, for reflections on how the movement has changed politics and on how it can develop. International perspectives will also be brought by sessions on political struggle from Latin America to the Eurozone to China. A meeting on sexual liberation will be joined by Ghassan Makaram, a Lebanese LGBTQ activist. On Saturday, Greg Philo will join Moshe Machover and Daphna Baram for a meeting on Palestine and the Media.

 

This yearâ€™s line-up also reflects rising levels of resistance to austerity in Britain. We will bring together trade unionists from public and private sectors, students and community activists. Our session on the future of education will discuss governmentâ€™s decision to withdraw its Higher Education Bill with John Holmwood (Campaign for the Public University) and others. We will also have important sessions on â€˜Defending the Right to Protestâ€™, â€˜Race, Racism and Resistanceâ€™, and even â€˜Radical Scienceâ€™.

 

As always the event is entirely FREE, but we welcome and encourage donations towards the costs of putting on the Forum.

We hope you will join us at the event. Spread the word!

 

Further information on speakers and timetables will be available and updated here: 
http://orf2012.wordpress.com/


Contact Us: 2012oxfordradicalforum@gmail.
Twitter: @orf2012
#oxfordradicalforum


Facebook (event): http://www.facebook.com/

Facebook (group): http://www.facebook.com/

The Impact

We hope to have (What is the impact your campaign may have on others? What if your campaign doesn't happen, what are the consequences? Make it real for people.)


What We Need & What You Get

Although the event is free to attend and speakers are not charging for coming to speak, we are incurring a number of costs including poster and flyer printing, travel expeses for some speakers, room hire in a couple of places. Basically lots of us are paying out of our own pockets which is quite difficult for lots of us. If we have any money left over, we'd really like to begin saving for next year's Radical Forum.


Other Ways You Can Help

You can come along to the radical Forum, first weekend of March, 2nd- 4th at Oxford. Please see our website http://www.orf2012.com for more information. You can also share this with your networks and people you know, we're hoping this year will be the biggest and best year yet!

story:
Who are we?

We are a dynamic educational services company committed to a broad range of quality school aged focused learning; led by passionate professionals who inspire children and their families to come together and in pursuit of this mission. KCA strives to provide a balance of core subjects and general education curriculum that is stimulating, relevant, timely, and geared toward application in the family home and child's age range.

Kids Culinary Adventures mission is to assist kids with daily academic principals through a culinary adventure! We believe because cooking is fun and rewarding, it allows children and teens to emotionally apply academic theory by using math, science, art, history, geography and nutritional understandings. Most individuals will find it easier to anchor learning through cooking because it is a fun tactile artistic expression!

Kids Culinary Adventures offers innovative "hands on" culinary classes for school-age children to explore their creativity and imagination in a fun, safe, stress-free environment - one that respects and challenges learners as active participants in their own exploration. Participants learn to make age appropriate meals, snacks and treats; and we always incorporate a healthy serving of scholastic information.

Chef Chloe mixing up a good time!

How does this fundraiser work?

We are the new owners of Kids Culinary Adventures started in 2002 by an amazing woman and incredible chef. We are taking over and need your help to purchase new equipment and be able to rent a temporary kitchen space while we continue to grow. With your help we will be able to purchase new equipment such as; Kitchen Aid mixers, sheet pans for baking, aprons for our students to wear while cooking, and in general the financial help we need to keep Kids Culinary Adventures up and running as a place we can share our passion for the culinary arts with many more children in a safe and educational setting. We thank you for helping us continue to carry on what is already great and make it as succesful as its ever been.
