story:
The Global Leadership Forum is a program through United World College. It is a two week program running from August 1-14th in New Mexico. It teaches Leadership Skills to those entering their Sophomore and Junior years of High School. I would leave with a plan that I would have developed there for a community service project. This program is very important to me, because I really care about making a positive difference in the world, and this program would give me the skils that I need to be a leader of change. And, I would get to meet incredible people from all around the world!

I decided to apply to the program quite late in the game and so there wasn't a lot of funding available, but fortunately I almost have enough money to go. I only need 700 more dollars!

I know that everyone is really stretched right now because of the economy, but if you could just pitch in even a small amount, I would appreciate it so much. A little bit from a lot of people really goes a long way.

 

Here's what I need:

- I need to raise 700 dollars by this coming Tuesday, July 24th.

- This is only going to be possible if as many people as possible chip in

 

That's all there is to it! If you can't contribute, that's fine, no worries! But if you can that's great, and thank you so much!
story_txt:
The Global Leadership Forum is a program through United World College. It is a two week program running from August 1-14th in New Mexico. It teaches Leadership Skills to those entering their Sophomore and Junior years of High School. I would leave with a plan that I would have developed there for a community service project. This program is very important to me, because I really care about making a positive difference in the world, and this program would give me the skils that I need to be a leader of change. And, I would get to meet incredible people from all around the world!
I decided to apply to the program quite late in the game and so there wasn't a lot of funding available, but fortunately I almost have enough money to go. I only need 700 more dollars!
I know that everyone is really stretched right now because of the economy, but if you could just pitch in even a small amount, I would appreciate it so much. A little bit from a lot of people really goes a long way.
 
Here's what I need:


- I need to raise 700 dollars by this coming Tuesday, July 24th.
- This is only going to be possible if as many people as possible chip in
 
That's all there is to it! If you can't contribute, that's fine, no worries! But if you can that's great, and thank you so much!

story:
Modern Widows Club Magazine is the first ever magazine advocating for widow causes. Women living, growing & reaching back as widow mentors & advocates of the world. Our time, our voice. 

Short Summary:

Be kind to ONE widow today: That's our mission is to guide, develop and promote extraordinary widow mentors and advocates globally to create one powerful voice for all. 

Our goal is to move forward with our MWC following on Facebook/Twitter and bring together widow experts into one viral platform, the MWC magazine. Your contributions will assist us in finding the 11.4 million widows in the US and start by creating 20 formal MWC chapters in the US by the end of 2013 and grow from there. 

History: We began in January 2012 with 3 women in Orlando and now have 4 national chapters in Orlando, Kansas City, Denver & Seattle. 

Until we receive our 501(c)3 non-profit status (in process), the magazine will give us the ability to bring current information immediately to those who need it renew their life after life altering circumstances. How? By inspiring them with those who have walked before them. We will cover wellbeing/ health, legal/ financial, spirit/ faith, living spaces, family, world wide widows, interviews (celebrities, thought leaders, professors, authors, speakers), stories, opinions (dating widows, bitter widows, widow comedians, daughters w/o fathers, widowers) and reviews (books, movies, art, music). 

Our contributors have modern, relevant, purposeful, fresh, edgy and contemplative viewpoints which share the widow experience with connected, open conversations to modernize the perception of the widow journey. A positive from a negative. This is a launching pad to something truly extraordinary for our lives. Widows have so much to give society and yet they feel completely isolated many times. It doesn't have to be this way. 

What We Need & What You Get:

Magazine Cost Breakdown:

Magazine: Main Goal- Graphic design/ logo & homepage design, wireframe, build out, organization of all internal pages fully functional/sharable, development notes, development management, develop, testing time, launch review.

Salary alottment: Hire a part time online manager to compile information, train contributors to plug in to magazine for downloads and input articles/photos etc . This also includes integrated software plug ins to manage information and tag properly. 

Also, we are utilizing this budget to fund the non-profit processing fees. We began 6 months ago and it will be a full 8 months to complete from start to finish. Nuts & bolts: $11,000 (negotiated web designers reduced cost)

Chapter Leader Training/ Salary: Sedondary Goal- If we are fortunate to raise this: Material/bylaw binders, printing, shipping, travel costs to chapter cities, speaking events & time marketing. We will use Skype at first, then as the chapter grows, travel there inexpensively being hosted by leaders. 20 Chapters in 2013 $8000

Contributor/ Expert Training: Printing, shipping, go to meeting fees $300

Overhead costs: Domain annual fee, Trademark protection, GotoMeeting fees, business license, office supplies. $860

Celebration Party at Magazine Launch. Gifts for widows in attendance. We are giving away one HOME MAKEOVER to a widow and sending more MISSION LEGOS to Nairobi widows: $1300

Perks to purchase for fulfillment $540

Impact:

One by one, widows lives will improve and they will reenter into a life that is greater than they anticipated because they've seen others do it before them. Their children are watching and their lives will become fulfilled with time. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Be kind to one widow today. Bring a smile to her face and make your time with her matter like she's the only person in the world. Listen, hold a hand, drop off meals, pray daily, do something even when it feels odd or uncertain. Handymen ask to repair something. Hire her, she may need a job. Teach her a new skill. Share MWC. Mentor her children and give her a day off. Please, make some noise about us, widows already feel like no one hears them or sees them. We want to be that squeaky wheel of empowerment for widows. 

Thank you so much for caring and choosing to grace us with your contribution. The widows of the world are very grateful and rarely ask for themselves. We hope every one will feel their voice is heard and valued. We all want a hand up, not a hand out. Join our movement :)

Blessings to you,

Carolyn Moor, MWC Founder and Friend

James 1:27

*Revenue from Magazine will be be provided on multi levels once up and running, we simply need to get it launched and begin this movement.

OTHER GOOD STUFF about MWC & Founder:

http://tv.growingbolder.com/episodes/little-miracles/

http://www.oprah.com/oprahshow/Troubled-Families/11

http://www.womenyoushouldknow.net/teaching-young-widows-there-is-moor-to-life-than-grief/

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UnFhcGwFhAg 

http://www.amazon.com/Shalom-In-The-Home-Season/dp/B000KGGONQ

http://www.amazon.com/Living-Something-Moor~-Fulfilling-Promise/dp/0557750164

http://whodidgoodtoday.com/tag/moor/

9 yrs on the Board at New Hope for Kids http://www.newhopeforkids.org/board

story:
Hello everyone!  Today I'm asking for your generous support.  My name is Kaitlyn Moore and I am a senior at Moore College of Art & Design, majoring in fashion design with minors in textile design as well as business.  This year I will be making my thesis collection; however, my dream collection is proving to be more expensive than I can manage. 

            I will be creating a collection women's wear separates inspired by Eastern State Penitentiary.  I will also be creating the prints that will be featured in my collection.  Thus brings me to the reason for project.  In order to have my original pattern designs printed, I first have to buy a roll of specialty fabric made to hold the ink dyes.  A single roll of this fabric runs $358.00 in total.  After buying the fabric there is also a cost for printing the fabrics which costs $60.00 a yard.  As anyone in the arts can tell you, quality will cost you!

               All of your generous help will be going to the purchase of fabrics, supplies, and accessories used in the creation and presentation of my thesis collection. Every project has unforeseen expenses, and with fashion it is no exception.  I not only have to create my collection but I also have to purchase all of shoes and accessories for my 5 models.   The fabrics that I will be using are going to be 100% silk chiffon and printed at the highest quality print center in the area of Philadelphia. 

            Of course I want to thank everyone who helps me reach my goals of a beautiful senior collection, so I've come up with a few levels of donation, each with it's own special incentive to thank you for helping me on my way! 

 

$10 Donation-

            For a $10 donation to my collection I will put your name on the sponsor page of my website and you will also receive a custom postcard printed with an original design from the collection signed by the designer!

 

$20 Donation-

            For a $20 donation to my collection I will put your name on the sponsor page of my website and you will receive a custom stress-ball and postcard printed with an original design from the collection signed by the designer! (Because life is stressful, and everybody needs help sometimes!)

 

$50 Donation-

            For a $50 donation to my collection I will put your name on the sponsor page of my website and you will also receive a custom postcard and a tote bag with an original design from the collection printed on it!

 

$60 Donation-

            For a $60 donation to my collection I will put your name on the sponsor page of my website and you will receive a custom postcard printed with an original design from the collection and signed by the designer!  Also you will receive a printed tee shirt with an illustration with an illustration from the collection or an original graphic design!

 

$100 Donation-

            For a $100 donation to my collection I will put your name on the sponsor page of my website and you will receive a custom postcard printed with an original design from the collection and signed by the designer!  You will also receive a handmade 100% silk scarf made out of the fabric that your contribution is helping to create!

 

$250 Donation-

            For a $250 donation to my collection I will put your name on the sponsor page of my website and you will receive a custom postcard printed with an original design from the collection and signed by the designer!  You will also receive 2 tickets to see the collection premier LIVE at the annual Moore College of Art & Design fashion show held at 20th and the Parkway in Philadelphia on May 18th!

 

$1,000 Donation-

            For a $1,000 donation to my collection I will put your name on the sponsor page of my website and you will receive a custom postcard printed with an original design from the collection and signed by the designer!  You will also receive a one of a kind piece from the collection.  These are handmade, one of a kind pieces that will never be made again!

 

          There is always another way to help me create this collection!  Pass the word on to your friends and family! Post it on facebook, twitter, or your own personal favorite form of social media!  The success of my project is based on your generous help! 

             I cant even begin to express how grateful I am for any help that you can offer.  I've been saving my money for the past couple months, but I just don't have the means to do this on my own.  Again, let me say how thankful I am for everyone's help! And stay posted for updates about the collection!


Want more info on my work and my collection?  Check out my website!

http://kaitlynmooredesigns.weebly.com/thesis.html

or follow me on twitter!  @Kmoore0320

story:
Who we are...

Children’s Montessori Cooperative started as a grassroots effort in September 2012, sharing space with a Montessori Toddler Program.  CMC was created to meet a community need for a pre-school and kindergarten alternative that teaches the whole child, not just a standards-based curriculum. 

As a founding teacher of CMC, I firmly believe the Montessori philosophy enriches children’s lives by facilitating a life-long love for learning; encouraging cooperation amongst peers; providing opportunities to build critical thinking skills; and recognizing the planes of development in each child to establish an early preparedness for reading and mathematics. Lessons of grace and courtesy run deep throughout our program, we take time to learn from conflict, communicate our wants and needs, and establish a plan that is valued as fair and just for those involved. 

 

What your contribution will do...

This campaign will allow CMC to move from its grassroots pilot program, a successful first year, to a full-time Montessori program that provides opportunities for more students in an environment equipped with curriculum-based materials. 

Three-fourths of the campaign goal will be spent on Montessori materials that will meet the needs of our pre-school and kindergarten curriculum.  The other quarter of the goal will be used as a deposit and first month's rent in a new space that will meet the licensing requirements to move our program forward.  Fifty percent of money raised that exceeds our goal will be used toward a scholarship fund to reduce the cost of tuition for families in need, with the remainder being used for upgrading our furniture and the added costs of licensing (lighted EXIT signs and extra outlet covers). 

 

What you get...

Your contribution helps to fund a program founded on an educational method that has been successful for over one hundred years.  The Montessori Method has enriched the lives of Larry Page and Sergey Brin, founders of Google; Jeff Bezos, founder of Amazon.com; Jacqueline Bouvier Kennedy Onassis, former first lady (John F. Kennedy); Sean ‘P.Diddy’ Combs, singer; Prince William and Prince Harry; Julia Child, author, chef, TV cooking shows; Gabriel Garcia Marquez, Nobel Prize winner for Literature; Katherine Graham, ex-owner of the Washington Post; and Anne Frank - author, diarist from World War II. Your contribution would put you in the ranks of famous Montessori supporters such as Thomas Edison, Alexander Graham Bell, Yo Yo Ma, and Helen Keller.

If you still need a little nudge to get you into the list of the great supporters, check out our cool perks!

If now is not a good time for you...

Trust me, I understand, you want to support CMC but money is tight! There are still ways you can help.

  • PLEASE SHARE OUR CAMPAIGN! Networking and spreading our message around will bring in friends and family who may be able to financially back our campaign.
  • LEAVE WORDS OF PRAISE! If you are/were a Montessori student or you know someone who is/was, give us some written support and spread the knowledge. 

Thank you for your time...

Thank you for looking, for reading, for sharing, and supporting our campaign.  Every child deserves to be looked at individually and given an opportunity to learn at their own pace. They deserve to explore and blossom freely, within safe and respectful boundaries.  Your support of this campaign allows me to share an exceptional method of education with beautiful young minds.

story:
UPDATE: Funds for this orphanage are much lot more urgently needed than first anticipated. Reuben has informed me that without funding, the building of this orphanage will not go ahead. What started out as a campaign to feed the orphans in Nepal is now a desperate plea to first give them a home. Please give generously to ensure the orphanage I'm going to can actually exist!

Operation: Orphanage

Hi! I'm Dani, and I live in sunny Queensland, Australia.

I went to Nepal in 2008 for 5 weeks, and I'm going back in 2013 for 5 months! I'll be helping out at a brand new orphanage in Urlabari with a local Nepali missionary.

Orphanages are so important in a developing country like Nepal - being able to look after vulnerable children is will be a real honour.

My goal is to raise $5000 to help out this orphanage.

What We Need & What You Get

The orphanage will be brand new so it will have immediate needs. The $5000 will:

  • Clothe around 60 orphans and street children with winter clothes
  • Pay to lease a plot of land to farm food for the kids sustainably for 4-5 years
  • Feed the kids until the plot of land hits harvest time

The Australian and US dollar go incredibly far in Nepal! Just $10 can feed a child in the orphanage for a whole week, which is amazing! 

Check out the unique perks - everything from photos to Nepali swords! Get excited! 

The Impact

Feeding and clothing these children will make a massive difference in Nepal. This seemingly simple act can help them reach their potential and empower them make a difference in their own communities.

Show these kids that they are not forgotten and that we really care about them!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please spread the word! Share this page on your facebook and twitter, tell your friends -  go crazy!
  • Check out www.facebook.com/operation.nepalorphanage for regular updates and more information

Thank you for your support!

story:
Hi, my name is Michelle Poulton-Wasley and I am from Levin, New Zealand which is a small country town an hour north of the capital city of Wellington. It is a rich agricultural area and home to many farmers, including my own family. I have been fortunate enough to grow up on the outskirts of town on a family owned sheep and beef farm called Poulton Farms. My passion to be involved with animals started out at an early age and having been surrounded by animals of all sorts my entire life proved to be the building blocks for my career choice. Upon graduation from Horowhenua College, I chose a career in Veterinary Science as it seemed to be the next step to build my career while fostering my passion for animals. I am currently in my first semester of study at Massey University in Palmerston North, where I learned about ISV (International Student Volunteers) and decided to embark on an animal conservation trip to South Africa.

The reason I am utilizing Indiegogo is because I hope to raise the funds needed to make this trip to South Africa. The volunteer program will allow for not only educating myself about the conservation of animals but also for submerging myself in a vast and rich foreign culture on the other side of the planet. This experience will be immeasurably life-changing in a magnitude of ways such as: It will allow me the chance to work in a foreign country whilst at the same time I can further my education and gain academic credit, I will also be able to implement my passion for animals by working closely with professionals who share my love of animals, and since I place the utmost importance on maintaining holistic well-being for the animal planet, this trip will expose me to the techniques involved in the assuredness of their protection. 

Any contributors to this campaign will help a country farm girl have the trip of a lifetime. I can imagine the landscape I will take in, the animals I will see, the people I will meet, and the information I will learn. I envision myself in the remote South African jungle, surrounded by the plains, face to face with exotic animals, becoming informed of their needs and I can barely contain my excitement. I thank you in advance for contributing to my dream! 

I am trying to raise the funds to pay for the trip via ISV which is the International Student Volunteer Program (link will follow). The cost is $7,500 NZD and it includes airfare, lodging, meals, materials, and the conservation project. The departure is 21 November with return to New Zealand 21 December 2014. I am hoping to raise the entire amount for this experience;however, any money contributed will be used toward the expense if I fall short of contributions. 

In conclusion, we all realize that animal conservation is undoubtedly important to our planet. Habitat destruction through oil exploration and drilling, animal poaching, and illegal ivory trafficking along with countless other factors fully support the need for conservation technique development and application. I believe there are many problems facing the planet, but I also believe that problems are solvable. The solution is simple. The scientific information is there. We are now at a time where the application of this information is of imperative relevance. The value lent to the world as a whole from this program is of indescribable importance. As aforementioned, the holistic well-being of the planet is dependent on a number of different contributing factors and to make my mark in history as a person who was involved the  the overall health and longevity of any species would make me proud. I look forward to any contributions I may receive to allow this dream to come true. Please share any of my information on your social media to friends and/or family members who may want to help me get to Africa!
story_txt:
Hi, my name is Michelle Poulton-Wasley and I am from Levin, New Zealand which is a small country town an hour north of the capital city of Wellington. It is a rich agricultural area and home to many farmers, including my own family. I have been fortunate enough to grow up on the outskirts of town on a family owned sheep and beef farm called Poulton Farms. My passion to be involved with animals started out at an early age and having been surrounded by animals of all sorts my entire life proved to be the building blocks for my career choice. Upon graduation from Horowhenua College, I chose a career in Veterinary Science as it seemed to be the next step to build my career while fostering my passion for animals. I am currently in my first semester of study at Massey University in Palmerston North, where I learned about ISV (International Student Volunteers) and decided to embark on an animal conservation trip to South Africa. 
The reason I am utilizing Indiegogo is because I hope to raise the funds needed to make this trip to South Africa. The volunteer program will allow for not only educating myself about the conservation of animals but also for submerging myself in a vast and rich foreign culture on the other side of the planet. This experience will be immeasurably life-changing in a magnitude of ways such as: It will allow me the chance to work in a foreign country whilst at the same time I can further my education and gain academic credit, I will also be able to implement my passion for animals by working closely with professionals who share my love of animals, and since I place the utmost importance on maintaining holistic well-being for the animal planet, this trip will expose me to the techniques involved in the assuredness of their protection. Any contributors to this campaign will help a country farm girl have the trip of a lifetime. I can imagine the landscape I will take in, the animals I will see, the people I will meet, and the information I will learn. I envision myself in the remote South African jungle, surrounded by the plains, face to face with exotic animals, becoming informed of their needs and I can barely contain my excitement. I thank you in advance for contributing to my dream! I am trying to raise the funds to pay for the trip via ISV which is the International Student Volunteer Program (link will follow). The cost is $7,500 NZD and it includes airfare, lodging, meals, materials, and the conservation project. The departure is 21 November with return to New Zealand 21 December 2014. I am hoping to raise the entire amount for this experience;however, any money contributed will be used toward the expense if I fall short of contributions. In conclusion, we all realize that animal conservation is undoubtedly important to our planet. Habitat destruction through oil exploration and drilling, animal poaching, and illegal ivory trafficking along with countless other factors fully support the need for conservation technique development and application. I believe there are many problems facing the planet, but I also believe that problems are solvable. The solution is simple. The scientific information is there. We are now at a time where the application of this information is of imperative relevance. The value lent to the world as a whole from this program is of indescribable importance. As aforementioned, the holistic well-being of the planet is dependent on a number of different contributing factors and to make my mark in history as a person who was involved the  the overall health and longevity of any species would make me proud. I look forward to any contributions I may receive to allow this dream to come true. Please share any of my information on your social media to friends and/or family members who may want to help me get to Africa!

story:
Artisans.Exchange

Give artisans like Jacques creative freedom.  

In Haiti, Jacques is happy he has an order for a hundred Tree of Life metal wall hangings.  He stencils the design on the sheet of metal drum that he can do with his eyes closed and has done countless of times.  He cuts the design and leans the piece on the stack with the others. The money’s good but he has so many other pieces he’d like to pursue.  You know how it is – you have a passion but life gets in the way.  Help Jacques have the creative freedom about which he can now only dream. 

I met my wife Renice in Kenya in 1999 working as a volunteer at a junior college and very quickly became involved in the vibrant artisan community in Kisumu, We have been working ever since to help lift artisans in developing countries out of poverty by importing and selling traditional handicrafts. Every now and then a fabulous piece is included in a shipment as a “gift” – a hand-batiked tablecloth from Zimbabwe, a life-size antelope trophy head wall-hanging made from strips of tin cans from South Africa, a stunning brass pendant made from bullet shells from Cambodia, to name a few. We would love to be able to encourage artisans’ creativity but our existing models require market demand and scale in production.

Artisans.Exchange is a crowd funded solution to enable artisans to enjoy the creativity they deserve. Angels will receive exclusive wholesale pricing on unique, handcrafted pieces of home décor, jewelry and accessories, as well as the ability to apply their $25 monthly investments to purchases.  Spaces are limited.   Our artisan partners located in the developing world will be funded from the Angel’s investment to create exclusive and limited edition pieces for our Angel members.

Help us to create sustainable livelihoods and produce unique handmade pieces by becoming the Angel you always knew you were. Let the creativity begin!

What We Need & What You Get

In order to get Artisans.Exchange off the ground we need some technology infrastructure and support:

  • To kick start artisan development, we will provide $10,000 in advances to developing world artisans.
  • In addition to the $10,000 we hope to raise, we will invest $10,000 in a robust website that will track Angel investments and enable us sell the unique pieces. We have plenty of experience with eCommerce and a great web developer.
  • The main thing we need is the encouragement and support from potential Angels.
  • Perks will ship within a week of your investment.
  • We are offering a selection of handmade artisan products as rewards and more importantly, every supporter will receive an invitation to become one of our founding Angels when we launch. We expect the full launch to take three months from meeting our goals, but don't worry, we have all the reward products on hand to ship. 

The Perks

The Impact

The people we meet all over the world are incredibly talented yet still often live on the edge of poverty.  The market provides orders for products that they can make in bulk, but struggles to provide sustainability and does a terrible job at encouraging creativity. Large buyers sanitize products of the tradition and details that made them unique.   Artisans Exchange will:

  • Provide a space for artisans to be creative and practice traditional skills that may not work in the mass market.
  • Create sustainability by providing payments and work in the artisans down time.
  • Bring in some amazing pieces exclusively for our Angels.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge will be growing a base of Angels who are willing to invest in artisans futures and to match that with a steady supply of amazing products for the Angels. To manage this process we will limit the number of Angels initially to one thousand, releasing new Angel opportunities only when we are sure we can provide great benefits and real impacts.  

  • For the last 13 years we have placed nearly $6 million in orders from small scale artisans for our traditional wholesale model. We have lost less than $10,000 in non-deliveries. We have amazing relationships in place. This model will help us support those artisans in ways we can not do in the traditional space.
  • We are fortunate to have a great warehouse space and team available. This way every penny invested by Angels can go straight to where it needs to, artisan advances and product development.
  • Our campaign goal will not be enough to get this project fully funded. Renice and I are ready to invest the rest. What we really need is a clear indication that we will be able find our Angels. Our funding goal is set at a level that will give us the confidence to make this happen.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you support this project but are not in a position to help us right now, please share the project via the share tools. Visit Artisans.Exchange and join our newsletter list and keep an eye on us to help spread the word as we launch.

Thank You

Kevin

story:
Hi, my name is Nigel Wilton. I was invited to spend my summer with family friends who live near Cologne, Germany in a town called Bad Honef. The family has two boys, ages ten and twelve, and I will be able to go to school with them for two weeks of the trip.

My mom as been teaching me German for my whole life and it would give me an amazing chance to use it and to learn more.

It will cost $1600 to buy the plane ticket and I would like to bring a few hundred dollars to buy pretzels and Nutella while I am there.

I would like to earn the money by selling my artwork.  Please be sure to click on the Gallery tab above to see samples of my artwork, a slideshow of where I'll be staying and a video of me explaining why I'd like to travel. 

Please buy a piece of my art and support my trip, I would greatly appreciate it. When you make a donation, please tell me which style of art you like best (see styles under the Gallery tab) and I will create a new piece just for you.  Thank you!

story:
Our Story

The free sharing of knowledge has gone on throughout human history, from generation to generation. Only recently in our history has the aspect of monetization been applied to the process of education and each subsequent generation is not as privileged or educated as the previous one. This is a trend which is damaging to each community, nation, and to humanity as a whole. We want to begin a new trend - to help others all around the world empower themselves and in turn, empower others in their communities.

We are building a site with an aggregate listing of educational disciplines. Students will be able to create a profile on our site and choose what they wish to learn about. Some of our available links in the process of becoming available are Physics, Urban Planning, Women's Studies, Mathematics, Aerodynamics, Social Sciences, Engineering, History, Health, Business Management, and The Arts. Besides just listing these courses, the community will be able to share ideas and discuss individual course merit, have a Q&A section, and write papers on the subject they are learning about with constructive interaction from the community either as a whole or just to those within their learning group.

The Impact

Our aim is to allow others to open doors for themselves, to empower themselves to help themselves. This project is happening, but we need support for the licensing of software, paying software engineers, and initiating our first wave or promotions. We have many goals and all of us support our families, our artistic vision, and want to help others but have limited means to do so. Every contribution here supports this goal at a faster rate than we are currently able.

What We Need & What You Get

So here's the skinny. We've got a small team lined up and ready to go - however we need your support to help fund the initial rounds of development that will be required to get this resource off the ground. Every cent we have goes into this, but at the end of the day, it isn't enough to get our idea out to the people for whom it will impact.  Additionally, any extra funds will go towards our corporate sponsorship on the OpenCourseWare Consortium website.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute right now? We understand. We would like to ask that you take some time to see if you can contribute anything on your next payday. Even $5 will help! And if monetary donation is not remotely possible for you right now, what you can do is pass on our link to this campaign to your friends and family. We understand that each person has their own unique set of circumstances and capabilities. Please, spread the word!  Get others involved and aware of what we have going on here. Share our link through all your social outlets and ask everyone to share as well. Our goal is to help others help themselves and this includes you!

story:
Short Summary

There are literally thousands of people trapped in Biblically based cults just in American alone.  These organizations will brainwash, threaten, and even traffic humans for their own needs.  Many are polygamous and take child brides.  These children are then trapped within the organization, forced to have children in one cult in order to "populate the planet with God's spirit babies".  These people are NOT stupid though.  Please don't confuse stupidity with being lost, confused, born into the cult, or just looking for something to fulfill a need they have.

My name is Sandi and I have been studying cults for over 14 years.  I almost joined a cult and thankfully God opened my eyes.  I have dedicated my life to work with people that are trapped like I almost was and want to see them free, thinking for themselves and making their own decisions. 

My funding this trip you will allow me the opportunity to work with people who are in a cult that is disguising itself as a Christian denomination.  There are over 38,000 people in just one offshoot and there are thousands of offshoots.  The number of people affected by this cult is astounding.

What We Need

Here's the lowdown.

 

I will be staying with friends, so thankfully there will be no hotel fees, however, my plane fare was $777.88 (including rental car).  I will also be contributing to food, buying gas for the rental car and since I am taking time off of work, I need to supplement that time off. 

If I don't reach my goal, I am still going to go.  I'll just eat a lot of PB &J sandwiches. 

The Impact

Can you imagine if just one person was able to safely get out of a cult? This may sound like a rough comparison, but if one more person had gotten to leave Jonestown, or if one more person could have left Mt. Carmel during the Branch Davidians raid?  One person.  It may not sound like a lot, but that's one more person who's life was spared.  That's what I want to do.  I want to help people who are looking for a way out to find that way.  By your contributions, you can absolutely save a life.  If I can reach one person, a life can be saved; freed.  I have been working with people in cults for many years and by God's grace, have seen people leave them.  The freedom they now possess is outstanding.  One friend, after leaving her cult, got "Freedom" tattooed onto her arm.  It may not sound like a lot to one person, but it is everything to them.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute, then pray!  Pass this information along.  Let's make a difference is someone's life.

story:
HIV is an invisible virus only because no one cares to see it. With this event...these jerseys...we can make it visible and inspire people to care and see. For 9 years we've spent every moment doing something to change the course of this vicious virus. Friends infected and family. When we say, "It ends with me". It means we won't allow our children to fight this battle…we will beat it.
 
The AIDS Games II is a sporting event designed to help with this mission. No campaign, no charity just inspiration to change something bigger than us.
 
We need to raise 1000$ to provide jerseys for each participant. In return, you get your name on the back of the jersey, an award for donating, signed letter from AIDS Games II staff, picture on our website, logo on our website or an autographed jersey for your records. Any remaining dollars will go towards jersey giveaways for athletes to give to their family as support items.
 
For over 9 years we've been in the community using performance art, poetry, books and unique interactive actions to motivate people. This event...these jerseys...are just part of our growing history of change. Please, take part in something that will outlast time and HIV.
 
Please, tell everyone about this event. Tell them about the jerseys. Starting July 30th, people can buy jerseys to support at home. It's all part of inspiring the world about this event and this virus. We can change this and your click, call, text or word...can be that change.
 
You can also use the Indiegogo share tools!
http://www.indiegogo.com/AIDSGamesjersey?a=811585

story:
*INFO IN ENGLISH (ΠΑΡΟΥΣΙΑΣΗ ΣΤΑ ΕΛΛΗΝΙΚΑ ΠΙΟ ΚΑΤΩ)*
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

WHO WE ARE


FatCut UPCYCLING is a collaborative network with horizontal structure that experiments, creates and transforms seemingly useless objects (garbage) in order to give them greater sustainability and re-purpose them into useful products and educational toys (upcycling*). It is also a laboratory workshop of ideas and know-how freely available to everyone, giving solutions to everyday needs.

From cardboard, newspapers, plastic bags, pallets, soda caps to damaged water heaters and other “garbage”, everything is being processed in order to postpone its arrival to the dump or junkyard and to increase its span of life. This way, the already oversized mass of garbage is de-congested and the energy cost of consumption is reduced. Even the traditional recycling of materials today, as far as we know, is not CO2 efficient and involves the huge cost of blue bins which is intensified by the lack of state management.

FatCut UPCYCLING was founded 3 years ago. During these years we have published the 1st issue of a comic series, we have organized many workshops to show people of all ages how to build ecological stoves out of used heaters, glasses out of beer bottles and educational toys out of plastic cups, among many others. We have held exhibitions touring around the Mediterranean Sea with an upcycled sailing boat, Mystic Blue.


*WHAT IS UPCYCLING?

It is the process by which discarded materials or damaged products are processed into new materials and products of better quality or ecological value. The term upcycling was first introduced by Reiner Pilz in an article by Thorton Kay from Salvo in 1994. The idea of upcycling is about reusing materials and making them useful again or giving them a new identity and value. Furthermore, this would help reduce the consumption of new raw materials in order to manufacture new products.
This reduction in consumption, in turn, leads to a reduction of the required energy wasted for their construction (basic cause for the contamination of air, groundwater and the emission of greenhouse gases).

Downcycling refers to processing materials and products into new materials of inferior quality.
Upcycling, on the contrary, uses the entire product, in order to either make it useful again or give it a new identity and value.


ABOUT CADO PARADISO

Our next project CADO PARADISO (TRASHCAN PARADISE) is entirely made DIT (do-it-together) by our team. It is based in an old factory in Athens with 240 square meters of space.

It’s 90% UPCYCLED. Flying automatic dragons, castles and trampolines made from tires, huge plastic bottle puzzles, PVC tube slides and trashformed bicycle games are, among others, the scenery that aims to trigger the fantasy of the visitor. A series of workshops including DIY toys, geography, physics, biology, political participation and others will be introduced to the kids while and through playing.


OUR PHILOSOPHY

You don’t need to be a psychologist in order to understand how “child” and “play” are interconnected, like the steam-iron and its handle (if the handle didn’t exist, you would simply burn). Each one of us only needs to go back to his childhood memories (if any left) and remember how a small twig transformed into a fairytale dragon or a pebble into the game of stone-tossing ('pentovola' in greek).

Although the industrialization of the “play” and the “lamination” of toys is something relatively recent, the times when children had their time and space to create their own games, seems, at least to the civilized barbarian, something distant, long gone and forgotten. (I don’t have time, you don’t have time, let’s buy it).

The play and therefore the child are not spared from the collective fantasy of perpetual growth, where “space-time” for free creative happiness does not fit in nor is part of one’s daily busy schedule. One’s career starts early enough so as to ensure, more and more, the lack of imagination in the game and later in life. This “spacetime” fortunately, still survives in the so-called “underdeveloped” countries, and contradictory though it sounds, where the presence of “civilized” toys hasn’t castrated the kids’ imagination yet.

Influenced by the great Spanish educator Francisco Ferrer and his 'Modern School', we aim to introduce an educational space-time that will cultivate solidarity, respect towards diversity, participation in decision making and autonomy in a country that still has a medieval educational system based on nationalism and religion. The joy of learning cannot be scored! 


WHAT WE ASK FROM CROWDFUNDERS?


FatCut UPCYCLING members belong to vulnerable social groups.
Therefore our budget is extremely limited. We hope that you will support our effort so that we can achieve:

- the completion of the construction of cado paradiso space

- the basic operational expenses of the space for the first months (rent, bills)

- maintenance expenses and equipment (paint, tools, flowers and plants, papers & markers, sound system)

- transport expenses (buy/rental of a small van for transporting materials)

- the design of a website and print production of flyers & posters

- fees & legal services for our cooperative (lawyer, accountant etc)

We invite you to support our efforts, so we can reclaim the space-times of freedom and fantasy for the children! By supporting us you also support the need for a creative, out-of-the-box education! You are our only communication sponsors, so please spread this news as smoke-signs, to everybody interested!

Sincerely,

FatCut Upcycling
Sotiris, Noha, Takis, Vivi, Dimitris, Vani.

Athens, February 2015


LINKS

Cado Paradiso Upcycled Playground

Fat Cut Upcycling

Mystic Blue EcoSailing & Diving

The Trashformers Comics | official website | facebook


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
ΠΑΡΟΥΣΙΑΣΗ ΣΤΑ ΕΛΛΗΝΙΚΑ
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


H ΟΜΑΔΑ FAT CUT UPCYCLING
Η ομάδα Fat Cut Upcycling, είναι ένα συμμετοχικό δίκτυο οριζόντιας δομής με νομική μορφή κοινωνικής συνεταιριστικής επιχείρησης (ΚΟΙΝ.Σ.ΕΠ.).

Πειραματίζεται, δημιουργεί και μεταποιεί μέσω της άμεσης ανακύκλωσης - upcycling* φαινομενικά άχρηστα αντικείμενα, προκειμένου να τους προσδώσει μεγαλύτερη βιωσιμότητα και να τα μετατρέψει σε χρηστικά προϊόντα ή εκπαιδευτικά παιχνίδια. Παράλληλα η ομάδα αποτελεί ένα ανοιχτό εργαστήριο ιδεών και τεχνογνωσίας που διατίθεται ελεύθερα στον καθένα, δίνοντας λύση σε καθημερινές ανάγκες.

Χαρτοκούτες, εφημερίδες, πλαστικές σακούλες, παλέτες, καπάκια, πόρτες και παράθυρα, μικροσκόπια εώς θερμοσίφωνες και άλλα «σκουπίδια», μετά από επεξεργασία, αναβάλλουν το ραντεβού τους με τη χωματερή και αυξάνουν το μέσο όρο ζωής τους. Κάπως έτσι, αποσυμφορίζουμε τον ήδη υπερμεγέθη όγκο σκουπιδιών και μειώνουμε το ενεργειακό κόστος της κατανάλωσης γνωρίζοντας ότι ακόμα και η παραδοσιακή ανακύκλωση (όπως την ξέρουμε σήμερα) δεν φείδεται εκπομπών διοξειδίου του άνθρακα.

Είμαστε σε λειτουργία ήδη 3 έτη, όπου μέσα σ' αυτά έχουμε πραγματοποιήσει εργαστήρια τεχνογνωσίας (workshops) για την επανοικειοποίηση πρώτων υλών που πετιούνται. Στα εργαστήρια αυτά ασχοληθήκαμε με τη κατασκευή οικολογικών σομπών, ποτηριών, πρεσών για καύσιμο πέλετ και εκπαιδευτικών παιχνιδιών μεταξύ πολλών άλλων. Επίσης στην ίδια φιλοσοφία και λογική, έχουμε εκδόσει το πρώτο τεύχος μιας σειράς κόμικ απο σκουπίδια (Trashformers), έχουμε συμμετάσχει και πραγματοποιήσει εκθέσεις, εκδηλώσεις και περιοδείες σε Ελλάδα, Ιταλία και Γαλλία, με όχημα ενα upcycled ιστιοφόρο (Mystic Blue Eco-Sailing).


*ΛΙΓΑ ΛΟΓΙΑ ΓΙΑ ΤΟ UPCYCLING
Είναι η διαδικασία κατά την οποία, πεταμένα υλικά ή χαλασμένα προϊόντα μεταποιούνται σε νέα υλικά και προϊόντα καλύτερης ποιότητας ή οικολογικής αξίας. Η πρώτη φορά που καταγράφτηκε ο όρος upcycling ήταν από τον Reiner Pilz σε ένα άρθρο του Thorton Kay από το Salvo το 1994. Ο όρος upcycling, που σε ελεύθερη μετάφραση σημαίνει υπερκύκλωση, ήταν τίτλος του βιβλίου του γερμανού Gunter Pauli το 1996.

Το Downcycling είναι η συμβατική ανακύκλωση, δηλαδή η διαδικασία μεταποίησης υλών και προϊόντων σε νέα υλικά κατώτερης ποιότητας, αυξάνοντας ταυτόχρονα τις εργοστασιακές εκπομπες διοξειδίου του άνθρακα (CO2) στην ατμόσφαιρα.

Το Upcycling, αντίθετα, χρησιμοποιεί εξ'ολοκλήρου το προϊόν, είτε καθιστώντας το εκ νέου χρήσιμο, είτε προσδίδοντάς του νέα ιδιότητα και αξία, μειώνοντας το ενεργειακό κόστος και τις εκπομπές ρύπων και αυξάνοντας την εφευρετικότητα και την δημιουργικότητα του ανθρώπου.

ΤΟ "ΚΑΔΟ ΠΑΡΑΝΤΙΣΟ"
Το παρόν υπέρ-εγχείρημα της Fat Cut ονομάζεται "ΚΑΔΟ ΠΑΡΑΝΤΙΣΟ" και μέχρι τη στιγμή αυτή κατασκευάζεται αποκλειστικά από μέλη της ομάδας μας σε μια διαδικασία D.I.T (do-it-together). Πρόκειται για έναν χώρο 240τ.μ, στην οδό Εριγόνης 3, στα Κάτω Πετράλωνα της Αθήνας, που φιλοδοξεί να φιλοξενήσει παιδιά όλων των ηλικιών, προκειμένου να παίξουν, να απασχοληθούν δημιουργικά και να εκπαιδευτούν σε τεχνικές κατασκευής upcycled παιχνιδιών και χρηστικών αντικειμένων.

Ο παιχνιδοχώρος "ΚΑΔΟ ΠΑΡΑΝΤΙΣΟ" κατασκευάζεται κατα 90% απο φύρα. Ιπτάμενοι δράκοι, τεράστια πάζλ από πλαστικά μπουκάλια, μεταποιημένα παιχνίδια με ποδήλατα, μουσικά παιχνίδια και τσουλήθρες απο σωλήνες pvc, κάστρα και τραμπολίνο απο ρόδες αυτοκινήτων και πολλά άλλα θα συνθέσουν μια φαντασμαγορία για τις 5 αισθήσεις παιδιών και μεγάλων.

Στον χώρο θα λάβουν μέρος μια σειρά εργαστηρίων δημιουργικής απασχόλησης όπου η γνώση θα προκύπτει πάντα μέσα απο την χαρά του παιχνιδιού. Μερικά από τα εργαστήρια που προγραμματίζουμε για τον πρώτο καιρό λειτουργίας είναι:
κατασκευές παιχνιδιών, κουκλοθέατρο, μουσική, εικαστικά, χοροθέατρο, φυσική, βιολογία, γεωγραφία, βοτανολογία, πολιτική αγωγή.


H ΦΙΛΟΣΟΦΙΑ ΜΑΣ
Δεν χρειάζεται να είναι κανείς παιδοψυχολόγος για να καταλάβει πως παιδί και παιχνίδι είναι αλληλένδετα. Φτάνει ο καθένας μας να ανατρέξει με όση μνήμη του έχει μείνει στη παιδική του ηλικία και να θυμηθεί πώς ένα μικρό κλαράκι στην όχθη του ποταμού μεταμορφωνόταν στο δράκο του παραμυθιού, ένα βότσαλο στην πεντόβολα ή ενας κουβάς σε καλάθι του μπάσκετ. Παρόλο που η «πλαστικοποίηση» και η εκβιομηχάνιση του παιχνιδιού είναι κάτι σχετικά πρόσφατο, η περίοδος όπου τα παιδιά είχαν το χωρο-χρόνο τους για να δημιουργούν τα παιχνίδια τους, φαίνεται -τουλάχιστον για τον πολιτισμένο βάρβαρο- κομμάτι κάποιου απροσδιόριστου μακρινού παρελθόντος. Γενικώς επικρατεί η λογική "δεν προλαβαίνω, δεν προλαβαίνεις, ας το αγοράσουμε...".


Το παιχνίδι και συνεπώς το παιδί δε γλίτωσαν απ' τη συλλογική φαντασίωση της αέναης ανάπτυξης, όπου ο χωρο-χρόνος της ελεύθερης δημιουργικής ευτυχίας δεν χωράει, ούτε είναι μέρος του καθημερινού ασφυκτικού προγράμματος. Η "καριέρα" ξεκινάει νωρίς ώστε να εξασφαλίζεται η ολοένα και περισσότερη απουσία φαντασίας στο παιχνίδι και μετέπειτα στη ζωή. Οι χωρο-χρόνοι αυτοί, ευτυχώς ακόμα επιβιώνουν στις λεγόμενες «υπανάπτυκτες» χώρες -κι ας ακούγεται οξύμωρο- όπου η απουσία «πολιτισμένων» παιχνιδιών διατηρεί ανέπαφη ακόμα την παιδική φαντασία.

Επηρεασμένοι απ τις διδαχές του μεγάλου ισπανού εκπαιδευτικού Φρανσίσκο Φερέρ, για τις πρωτοποριακές για την εποχή του ιδέες, θέλουμε να αναβιώσουμε εναν χώρο εκπαίδευσης που θα καλλιεργεί την αλληλεγγύη, τον σεβασμό στη διαφορετικότητα, την οικονομία με την πρωταρχική της σημασία, την συμμετοχή και την αυτονομία, σε αντίθεση με το μεσαιωνικό σύστημα του υπουργείου παιδείας και θρησκευμάτων(!).

Η χαρά για την γνώση δεν βαθμολογείται!


ΤΙ ΖΗΤΑΜΕ ΑΠΟ ΕΣΑΣ?


Καθώς η Fat Cut απαρτίζεται από ευπαθείς κοινωνικές ομάδες, το budget μας ειναι εξαιρετικά περιορισμένο. Σας καλούμε να υποστηρίξετε την προσπάθειά μας, προκειμένου να καλύψουμε:
- την ολοκλήρωση της κατασκευής του χώρου
- τα πάγια έξοδα του χώρου (ενοίκια πρώτου καιρού λειτουργίας, λογαριασμοί)
- τον υλικοτεχνικό εξοπλισμό (χρώματα, εργαλεία, φυτά, χαρτικά, ηχητικός εξοπλισμός)
- τα μεταφορικά έξοδα (αγορά ή επινοικίαση βαν για τις ανάγκες μεταφοράς και αποθήκευσης υλικών και πρώτων υλών)
- τον σχεδιασμό ιστοσελίδας και εντύπων παρουσίασης
- τα λειτουργικά έξοδα του συνεταιρισμού μας (ΚΟΙΝ.Σ.ΕΠ.) (δικηγόρος-λογιστής κλπ)

Ελάτε λοιπόν να ξαναδημιουργήσουμε τους χωρο-χρόνους φαντασίας και ελευθερίας που μας έχουν κλέψει! Στηρίξτε την προσπάθειά μας για μια φαντασιακή-δημιουργική εκπαίδευση! Ως οι μοναδικοί χορηγοί επικοινωνίας μας, σας προσκαλούμε να διαδόσετε το νέο αυτό εγχείρημα σαν σήματα καπνού, σε όποιον νομίζετε ότι θα ενδιαφέρεται.

Με εκτίμηση και προσμονή,

Η ομάδα Fat Cut Upcycling
Σωτήρης, Νούχα, Τάκης, Βιβή, Δημήτρης, Bανή.

Αθήνα, Φεβρουάριος 2015


ΣΥΝΔΕΣΜΟΙ ΕΠΙΚΟΙΝΩΝΙΑΣ:

Cado Paradiso Upcycled Playground

Fat Cut Upcycling

Mystic Blue EcoSailing & Diving

The Trashformers Comics | official website | facebook
story_txt:
*INFO IN ENGLISH (ΠΑΡΟΥΣΙΑΣΗ ΣΤΑ ΕΛΛΗΝΙΚΑ ΠΙΟ ΚΑΤΩ)*------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

WHO WE ARE



FatCut
 UPCYCLING is a collaborative network with horizontal structure that 
experiments, creates and transforms seemingly useless objects (garbage) 
in order to give them greater sustainability and re-purpose them into 
useful products and educational toys (upcycling*). It is also a 
laboratory workshop  of ideas and know-how freely available to everyone,
 giving solutions to everyday needs.From cardboard,
 newspapers, plastic bags, pallets, soda caps to damaged water heaters and other 
“garbage”, everything is being processed in order to postpone its arrival to the dump or 
junkyard and to increase its span of life. This way, the already oversized mass 
of garbage is de-congested and the energy cost of consumption is reduced.
 Even the traditional recycling of materials today, as far as we know, 
is not CO2 efficient and involves the huge cost of blue bins which is 
intensified by the lack of state management.FatCut
 UPCYCLING
 was founded 3 years ago. During these years we have published the 1st 
issue of a comic series, we have organized many workshops to show people
 of all ages how to build ecological stoves out of used heaters, glasses
 out of beer bottles and educational toys out of plastic cups, among 
many others. We have held exhibitions touring around the Mediterranean 
Sea with an upcycled sailing boat, Mystic Blue.



*WHAT IS UPCYCLING?
It
 is the process by which discarded materials or damaged products are 
processed into new materials and products of better quality or 
ecological value. The term upcycling was first introduced by Reiner Pilz
 in an article by Thorton Kay from Salvo in 1994. The idea of upcycling 
is about reusing materials and making them useful again or giving them a
 new identity and value. Furthermore, this would help reduce the 
consumption of new raw materials in order to manufacture new products.This reduction in consumption, in turn, leads to a reduction of the 
required energy wasted for their construction (basic cause for the contamination of air, groundwater and the emission of greenhouse gases).Downcycling refers to processing materials and products into new materials of inferior quality. Upcycling,
 on the contrary, uses the entire product, in order to either make it 
useful again or give it a new identity and value.

ABOUT CADO PARADISO

Our next project CADO PARADISO (TRASHCAN PARADISE) is entirely made
 DIT (do-it-together) by our team.    It is based in an old factory in Athens with 240 square 
meters of space.
It’s
 90% UPCYCLED. Flying automatic dragons, castles and trampolines made 
from tires, huge plastic bottle puzzles, PVC tube slides and trashformed
 bicycle games are, among others, the scenery that aims to trigger the 
fantasy of the visitor. A series of workshops including DIY toys, 
geography, physics, biology, political participation and others will be 
introduced to the kids while and through playing.




OUR PHILOSOPHY
You
 don’t need to be a psychologist in order to understand how “child” and 
“play” are interconnected, like the steam-iron and its handle (if the 
handle didn’t exist, you would simply burn). Each one of us only needs 
to go back to his childhood memories (if any left) and remember how a 
small twig transformed into a fairytale dragon or a pebble into the game of stone-tossing ('pentovola' in greek).Although
 the industrialization of the “play” and the “lamination” of toys is 
something relatively recent, the times when children had their time and 
space to create their own games, seems, at least to the civilized 
barbarian, something distant, long gone and forgotten. (I don’t have 
time, you don’t have time, let’s buy it).The
 play and therefore the child are not spared from the collective fantasy
 of perpetual growth, where “space-time” for free creative happiness 
does not fit in nor is part of one’s daily busy schedule. One’s career 
starts early enough so as to ensure, more and more, the lack of 
imagination in the game and later in life. This “spacetime” fortunately,
 still survives in the so-called “underdeveloped” countries, and 
contradictory though it sounds, where the presence of “civilized” toys 
hasn’t castrated the kids’ imagination yet.Influenced
 by the great Spanish educator Francisco Ferrer and his 'Modern School',
 we aim to introduce an educational space-time that will cultivate 
solidarity, respect towards diversity, participation in decision making 
and autonomy in a country that still has a medieval educational system 
based on nationalism and religion. The joy of learning cannot be scored! 

WHAT WE ASK FROM CROWDFUNDERS?

FatCut
 UPCYCLING members belong to vulnerable social groups.Therefore our budget is extremely limited. We hope that you will support our effort so that we can achieve:
- the completion of the construction of cado paradiso space
- the basic operational expenses of the space for the first months (rent, bills)
- maintenance expenses and equipment (paint, tools, flowers and plants, papers & markers, sound system)
- transport expenses (buy/rental of a small van for transporting materials)
- the design of a website and print production of flyers & posters
- fees & legal services for our cooperative (lawyer, accountant etc)
We invite you to support our efforts, so we can reclaim the space-times of freedom and fantasy for the children! By supporting us you also support the need for a creative, out-of-the-box education! You are our only communication sponsors, so please spread this news as smoke-signs, to everybody interested!
Sincerely,
FatCut UpcyclingSotiris, Noha, Takis, Vivi, Dimitris, Vani.
Athens, February 2015

LINKS


Cado Paradiso Upcycled Playground

Fat Cut Upcycling

Mystic Blue EcoSailing & Diving

The Trashformers Comics | official website | facebook

ΤΟ "ΚΑΔΟ ΠΑΡΑΝΤΙΣΟ"Το παρόν υπέρ-εγχείρημα της Fat Cut ονομάζεται "ΚΑΔΟ ΠΑΡΑΝΤΙΣΟ" και μέχρι τη στιγμή αυτή κατασκευάζεται αποκλειστικά από μέλη της ομάδας μας σε μια διαδικασία D.I.T (do-it-together). Πρόκειται για έναν χώρο 240τ.μ, στην οδό Εριγόνης 3, στα Κάτω Πετράλωνα της Αθήνας, που φιλοδοξεί να φιλοξενήσει παιδιά όλων των ηλικιών, προκειμένου να παίξουν, να απασχοληθούν δημιουργικά και να εκπαιδευτούν σε τεχνικές κατασκευής upcycled παιχνιδιών και χρηστικών αντικειμένων.Ο παιχνιδοχώρος "ΚΑΔΟ ΠΑΡΑΝΤΙΣΟ" κατασκευάζεται κατα 90% απο φύρα. Ιπτάμενοι δράκοι, τεράστια πάζλ από πλαστικά μπουκάλια, μεταποιημένα παιχνίδια με ποδήλατα, μουσικά παιχνίδια και τσουλήθρες απο σωλήνες pvc, κάστρα και τραμπολίνο απο ρόδες αυτοκινήτων και πολλά άλλα θα συνθέσουν μια φαντασμαγορία για τις 5 αισθήσεις παιδιών και μεγάλων.
Στον χώρο θα λάβουν μέρος μια σειρά εργαστηρίων δημιουργικής απασχόλησης όπου η γνώση θα προκύπτει πάντα μέσα απο την χαρά του παιχνιδιού. Μερικά από τα εργαστήρια που προγραμματίζουμε για τον πρώτο καιρό λειτουργίας είναι:κατασκευές παιχνιδιών, κουκλοθέατρο, μουσική, εικαστικά, χοροθέατρο, φυσική, βιολογία, γεωγραφία, βοτανολογία, πολιτική αγωγή.

H ΦΙΛΟΣΟΦΙΑ ΜΑΣΔεν χρειάζεται να είναι κανείς παιδοψυχολόγος για να καταλάβει πως παιδί και παιχνίδι είναι αλληλένδετα. Φτάνει ο καθένας μας να ανατρέξει με όση μνήμη του έχει μείνει στη παιδική του ηλικία και να θυμηθεί πώς ένα μικρό κλαράκι στην όχθη του ποταμού μεταμορφωνόταν στο δράκο του παραμυθιού, ένα βότσαλο στην πεντόβολα ή ενας κουβάς σε καλάθι του μπάσκετ. Παρόλο που η «πλαστικοποίηση» και η εκβιομηχάνιση του παιχνιδιού είναι κάτι σχετικά πρόσφατο, η περίοδος όπου τα παιδιά είχαν το χωρο-χρόνο τους για να δημιουργούν τα παιχνίδια τους, φαίνεται -τουλάχιστον για τον πολιτισμένο βάρβαρο- κομμάτι κάποιου απροσδιόριστου μακρινού παρελθόντος. Γενικώς επικρατεί η λογική "δεν προλαβαίνω, δεν προλαβαίνεις, ας το αγοράσουμε...".
Το παιχνίδι και συνεπώς το παιδί δε γλίτωσαν απ' τη συλλογική φαντασίωση της αέναης ανάπτυξης, όπου ο χωρο-χρόνος της ελεύθερης δημιουργικής ευτυχίας δεν χωράει, ούτε είναι μέρος του καθημερινού ασφυκτικού προγράμματος. Η "καριέρα" ξεκινάει νωρίς ώστε να εξασφαλίζεται η ολοένα και περισσότερη απουσία φαντασίας στο παιχνίδι και μετέπειτα στη ζωή. Οι χωρο-χρόνοι αυτοί, ευτυχώς ακόμα επιβιώνουν στις λεγόμενες «υπανάπτυκτες» χώρες -κι ας ακούγεται οξύμωρο- όπου η απουσία «πολιτισμένων» παιχνιδιών διατηρεί ανέπαφη ακόμα την παιδική φαντασία.Επηρεασμένοι απ τις διδαχές του μεγάλου ισπανού εκπαιδευτικού Φρανσίσκο Φερέρ, για τις πρωτοποριακές για την εποχή του ιδέες, θέλουμε να αναβιώσουμε εναν χώρο εκπαίδευσης που θα καλλιεργεί την αλληλεγγύη, τον σεβασμό στη διαφορετικότητα, την οικονομία με την πρωταρχική της σημασία, την συμμετοχή και την αυτονομία, σε αντίθεση με το μεσαιωνικό σύστημα του υπουργείου παιδείας και θρησκευμάτων(!).Η χαρά για την γνώση δεν βαθμολογείται!

ΤΙ ΖΗΤΑΜΕ ΑΠΟ ΕΣΑΣ?


Καθώς η Fat Cut απαρτίζεται από ευπαθείς κοινωνικές ομάδες, το budget μας ειναι εξαιρετικά περιορισμένο. Σας καλούμε να υποστηρίξετε την προσπάθειά μας, προκειμένου να καλύψουμε:- την ολοκλήρωση της κατασκευής του χώρου- τα πάγια έξοδα του χώρου (ενοίκια πρώτου καιρού λειτουργίας, λογαριασμοί)- τον υλικοτεχνικό εξοπλισμό (χρώματα, εργαλεία, φυτά, χαρτικά, ηχητικός εξοπλισμός)- τα μεταφορικά έξοδα (αγορά ή επινοικίαση βαν για τις ανάγκες μεταφοράς και αποθήκευσης υλικών και πρώτων υλών)- τον σχεδιασμό ιστοσελίδας και εντύπων παρουσίασης- τα λειτουργικά έξοδα του συνεταιρισμού μας (ΚΟΙΝ.Σ.ΕΠ.) (δικηγόρος-λογιστής κλπ)Ελάτε λοιπόν να ξαναδημιουργήσουμε τους χωρο-χρόνους φαντασίας και ελευθερίας που μας έχουν κλέψει! Στηρίξτε την προσπάθειά μας για μια φαντασιακή-δημιουργική εκπαίδευση! Ως οι μοναδικοί χορηγοί επικοινωνίας μας, σας προσκαλούμε να διαδόσετε το νέο αυτό εγχείρημα σαν σήματα καπνού, σε όποιον νομίζετε ότι θα ενδιαφέρεται.
Με εκτίμηση και προσμονή,
Η ομάδα Fat Cut UpcyclingΣωτήρης, Νούχα, Τάκης, Βιβή, Δημήτρης, Bανή.
Αθήνα, Φεβρουάριος 2015

ΣΥΝΔΕΣΜΟΙ ΕΠΙΚΟΙΝΩΝΙΑΣ:
Cado Paradiso Upcycled Playground
Fat Cut Upcycling
Mystic Blue EcoSailing & Diving
The Trashformers Comics | official website | facebook

story:
Bruno Mital packed a life full of love, family, intense friendships, and good deeds in his 49 and a half years. Bruno was taken from us too soon on July 20, he had a lot left to give. So we are giving you a chance to give something back in Bruno’s name.
 
Besides his family, friends and colleagues, Bruno loved and believed in the power of education. He loved the opportunities it afforded young and old, the dignity and hope it represented to young people who may have lost their way, the doors it opened, as it had for him.

Bruno loved Dawson College and the program he graduated from because he said it saved his life and made him a better person.
 
Dawson College with the help of Bruno’s family, friends and colleagues will establish the Bruno Mital Education Fund to help students find their way. It may come in the form of scholarships, activities or equipment. Depending on the level of funds we raise, It will be up to all of us to decide.

Donate what you can and make a difference in Bruno’s memory. Let's meet and beat this goal.

You know he would have loved this!

He loved the opportunities it afforded young and old, the dignity and hope it represented to young people who may have lost their way, the doors it opened, as it had for him. Bruno loved Dawson College and the program he graduated from because he said it saved his life and made him a better person. Dawson College with the help of Bruno’s family, friends and colleagues will establish the Bruno Mital Education Fund to help students find their way. It may come in the form of scholarships, activities or equipment. Depending on the level of funds we raise, It will be up to all of us to decide. Donate what you can and make a difference in Bruno’s memory. Let's meet and beat this goal. You know he would have loved this!

story:
"Education is the most powerful weapon

which you can use to change the world."

- Nelson Mandela


That, in a nutshell, is what this campaign is all about. Alongside improving healthcare, improving education is a key force that drives a society forward, and drags it out of the darkness and into the light.

In a perfect world, every child would have access to top quality teachers, the best learning materials, and a well-equipped school. They would have the time, space and resources to continue their education at home. In short, they would have a fighting chance of getting a decent education. Of course, we don't live in a perfect world, and many children get only the most basic of educations, if they get one at all.

There are many wonderful charities and organisations doing everything they can to improve matters on the ground - building schools, training teachers, and so on. But these efforts can only bear fruit if they get the support they need to deliver on their potential. Without the right resources, schools and their pupils struggle, and eventually fail.

And that is where you can come in.

We are establishing a charity whose sole function in life is to create world-class learning resources, in a range of languages, and make those resources available to education organisations, schools, teachers (and most importantly, their pupils) for free.

If you speak English, there are plenty of resources out there (albeit of highly variable quality), but if you speak any other language, the choice of good materials drops dramatically. It doesn't need to be this way. If you want materials in the same professional, easy-to-use style across an entire syllabus, you will be out of luck. It doesn't have to be this way. If you are looking for materials for children with special needs, it can be a real nightmare. It doesn't need to be this way.

This is a long-haul project; we are talking tens of thousands of resources spread across a wide range of ages and subjects. Today though, we are just looking for your help to get us started - to get the charity set up and to create and make available our first thousand or so resources. This is enough to demonstrate what can be achieved, and make a viable case for funding by governments and international organisations.

With your help, this can be the beginning of a truly fantastic journey. Educating the next generation has to be about the most important endeavour that we as a race can undertake. We are going to help countless thousands of children reach out for a better life.

Why not help us make it happen?

story:
The Child Angel concept evolved from the personal experience of the founder of Child Angel, Andrew Purcell, after losing his young son in a shopping centre, after turning his back for only a few seconds. Three years of research and development later, Child Angel pushes the boundaries of technology to create a revolutionary product that makes a genuine difference.

Built from the ground up by some of the UK’s leading product and electronic design engineers , Child Angel is one of the smallest, mobile-connected GPS tracking devices in the world that comes in a design that kids love. 

We at Child Angel have created a device which is designed to be worn by children of 3 years and above.  We envisage that this product will be used by families to give information to Parents or carers concerning the constant location of their children as well as providing the reassurance that in an emergency the Parent will be alerted straight away via an App on their Smartphone or Tablet.

Child Angel is one of the smallest and most advanced child tracking devices available in the world today. The product of extensive research and development, Child Angel provides safe and stable location monitoring by combining GPS, GSM and Wi-Fi hot-spot triangulation technologies. 


What is different about Child Angel from other tracking devices.

Plenty of other devices can work out their position from GPS and Wi-Fi, and report this back to a monitor using the mobile phone networks. Child AngelTM is the first device that is optimised so that it can be strapped to a child, and allow simple “contact us” commands to be sent, and alarm reporting to be received (e.g. strap undone).

Portable, lightweight and splash proof design.

Alarmed Strap

The Child Angel design includes an alarmed strap that is designed to give parents extra peace of mind knowing their child can contact them in an emergency. Should the strap be undone, Child Angel sends an alert to a paired smartphone device to advise it that the strap has been released.


Child Angel App

Child’s play to use and complete with a variety of intuitive features

Create your own safe zones with the Child Angel App Geo-fence feature to trigger receive alerts whenever the Child Angel GPS Tracker enters or exits those areas. Open the App to see at a glance the location of where your loved one is. Should your child undo the Child Angel alarmed strap- the App will notify you that the device has been removed and provide a last known location.



GPS v Bluetooth and why we need data roaming

A GPS tracking unit is a device that uses the Global Positioning System to determine the precise location of your child to which it is attached and to record the position of your child at regular intervals.

Locating several Bluetooth users with a typical mobile phone is relatively simple: You just turn on your phone and search for every discoverable device. But you could only monitor the people moving in and out of your Bluetooth's range, which is most likely a 10-meter (33-foot) circle around you. If you wanted to track your child, you'd have to visually locate your childs physical device and follow them around all day.

Data roaming is when your phone connects to the Internet when you’re out and about to keep certain applications up-to-date or provide access to some of your apps. This enables Child Angel to track your child without limitation and should a GPS signal not be available, you have the additional security of WiFi & GSM to report the location of your child. Child Angel have secured a very low monthly roaming fee for our inbuilt micro sim so we know our little angels are safe and know where they are! We expect this to be in the region of 40 cents (25 pence) per day.

What our surveys said?

K Hardwill "Great idea to know where your kids are and looks really trendy, my kids will love wearing it!"

V Hale "I really like the fact i can have both of my children's Child Angel's on one phone or tablet at the same time and they can personalise them, wow, what a great idea!"

R Fowler "As a teacher it will be great to have all the class wearing one on a school trip and all on my tablet, brilliant"


Why Child Angel needs your help

We now have a working prototype from our manufacturer and  need at least $100,000 to pay for the costs of everything that's needed to put 'Child Angel' into production. Your donations will be used to fund tooling, production and additional software. Every penny will be used to make 'Child Angel' a reality.

Be an Angel and pledge ...in return you will be one of the first in the world to own a truly unique, secure and trendy child location device. Your little angels have been at the centre of our development programme and we have designed a personalisation feature...the clip on faceplate, that they can interchange and make their Child Angel special to them.

So why should you support us?

  • We are passionate about are journey in helping parents monitor their childrens whereabouts but without restricting the freedom a child needs to develop.
  • You have personally experienced one of those anxious moments like myself and understand how Child Angel can make a difference.
  • Be one of the first to own a Child Angel with the total satisfaction that your contribution helped turn this into a reality.

The Impact

We are a small but passionate company and we need your help to make the final steps. Every donation matters to us, as this campaign determines whether or not we can continue working on Child Angel or not.  With your contributions, we can bring Child Angel into the world and you could have an angel looking over your loved ones.

Challenges


We have been working for the last three years developing Child Angel, listening to feed back from our parent and child surveys so we can deliver a product that truly enhances your ability to monitor your child's whereabouts and is also fun to wear.
Manufacturing
We need to have the tooling to manufacture the various components of Child Angel and due to the complex nature of this process it will take time and money to get it right. We have selected partners to work with through this process so if complications do arise the impact on bringing Child Angel to market will be minimised.
Software
The software and app are functional, however there is still some final work that is needed to build all the features that we want in Child Angel. We have a fantastic team working with us, however software development can sometimes be tricky so we want to reassure you that if needed we will look for additional support to solve any problems that emerge.
We will undoubtedly encounter some problems along the way, however we are prepared for this and have the team available to tackle any challenges as we have done over the last three years. We aim to deliver Child Angel on time, however we wont compromise on the quality of our product and therefore some delays may be experienced if we meet the unexpected.
Colour Options
The more pledges we receive the more colours we will be able to offer.

Meet the team

Andrew Purcell - CEO & Founder
Andrew has run a Wealth Management company for 25 years and is the Founder of Child Angel. He is at the forefront of the company and strives to achieve his heart’s desire of having an Angel look over your Child.

Clare Purcell - Company Director

Claire’s sales experience and organisational skills help to steer the Child Angel family and being a Mum she adds that real hands on protective instinct that is paramount to our focus.

David Wild - Marketing Manager

David adds over 25 years of financial advice, negotiation and experience at all levels and has a very level approach to resource and is a real asset to our team.

Graham Williams - Sales Manager

Graham brings over 30 years experience to Child Angel at Senior Management, HR and Director level and adds enormous value to our team.

Jenny Williams - Sales Executive

Jenny has had many years in office management and as a personal assistant to senior management and is the analyst and researcher that dots every ‘I’ and crosses all our ‘T’s’


Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways to contribute! Even if you don't have the money right now, you can help us turn Child Angel into a reality by sharing this Indiegogo campaign with your friends. Just click on any of the Facebook, Twitter, and other sharing buttons let the world know about Child Angel and help us make a difference.

   

Thank you

Gabriel & Angelica

XXXXX


Look How Far We Have Come



Kidzpod

See photo gallery


Questions & Answers

Q - Is there a danger with these devices that they are relied on too heavily – should parents rely solely on Child Angel™  to look after their children?

A- No, our product is aimed to create that little extra feeling of knowing where our little ones are and it is not designed to replace Parental Responsibility, merely to enhance it.

Parents should make sure that their children understand the importance of being aware of the dangers around them, particularly ‘stranger danger’, and Child Angel™  in no way detracts from that message.

Q - Do you think that children should have more independence and not be able to be traced as part of their daily lives?  Do you think that this device may detract from their own coping strategies?

A- Child Angel™ brings a little more comfort to parents in the thought that out of sight does not mean children are non-visible.  Children still need to develop their own strengths and weaknesses to be able to feel confident in the real world but at the same time, parents like to know where they are.

Q-  How can you assure parents that the data concerning their child’s location will be treated in a secure manner?

A- Child Angel™ has been developed so that only the parent/carer will ever have access to the child’s location.  With our product the parent is in control: it is not a ‘phone or a text-enabled device’ and the pairing is via a unique PIN recognition system that recycles every time the Child Angel™  is reconnected, reducing the risk of unwanted tracking.  This is also essential when used by the likes of theme parks, sports clubs, shopping centres etc, to hire out on a daily basis.

Child Angel™  is designed so that the position of the child can be securely reported back to a specific parent’s phone or tablet. The device and service are optimised to provide position reporting with a good balance of coverage performance, battery life, and size/weight.

         Any additional questions please email us at hello@child-angel.com
