story:
>>>Натиснете тук за български език!

Greetings from Hamalogika!

With your help we are building a creative community hub in Burgas, Bulgaria.
Our crowdfunding campaign has ended, but if you wish to support us, you can make a donation to the following bank account:

IBAN: BG57UNCR70001522407739
BIC: UNCRBGSF
Chitalishte Hamalogika

For the past 3 years our team have  been working on cultural, educational and social innovation projects in Bulgaria (see our work here). The objective we have set ourselves is to establish the role of culture as a driving force in the processes of sustainable development of our society.

Now we’ve reached the point where we need our own place, where we can freely experiment with visionаry ideas for social change. We believe that change depends on each and every one of us and starts with where you live. So we start from Burgas with a creative community hub - a place where people can be educated, inspired, entertained, and brought together in new ways.

We chose the widely spread and extremely effective model of “a creative hub”, because it really helps the interactions between artists, NGOs and the business sector in order to stimulate а positive impact. A hub that generates ideas for the well being of the members of different communities.


Why do we need your help?

Despite our efforts to open the hub at the end of the summer, it just didn’t happen. Thanks to the help of our local community, we have managed to secure a space and finish a great part of the construction works.

However, we are still far from done! To make the place fully functional and truly inspirational for students, artists and entrepreneurs, we have to be sure it meets their expectations.

In order to do that we really need your help! We believe that the most sustainable and meaningful support is by the people for the people, that’s why we chose the Crowdfunding method. By pledging to the campaign, you are directly supporting the hub and helping us open as soon as possible. We are hoping to reach the goal of € 6,000 to ensure we have the budget to renovate, furnish and equip the space; to purchase books for the library and organize our first events.

We are truly grateful to everyone who can support us!

What have we done so far?

This campaign is the last part of a long process, in which we’ve already managed to:

  • find and rent a 140 sq.m. space in downtown Burgas, that was deserted for about a decade


  • demolish a few unnecessary walls and take down the very old suspended ceiling


We've also provided:
  • laminated flooring;
  • railing for amphitheatеr stairs;
  • wooden material for the covering of the stairs, the bookshelves and the working spaces;
  • 2 air conditioners;
  • tiling;
  • the rising support of new members.


What's next?

We still have a long way to go. Here’s a list of materials and services we need before launching:
  • office furnishing
  • electrical wiring and installation
  • professional sound system and lighting, dance floor
  • walls (movable and massive), doors and curtains
  • wall installation for exhibitions;
  • multimedia - projector, screen, laptops, microphones, etc.
  • library, audio and video fund
  • kitchen and WC appliances;
  • specific services for the things we cannot carry out ourselves
If you like to donate materials, services or directly purchase some of the stuff  (instead of or alongside a pledge), please  email or call us. We’d love to have a chat!


Other ways to help

Let the world know about our campaign! Share, tweet, post and email your friends near and far! The more the people support us, the sooner we’ll open our doors for a lovely crowd of innovators and creators!

We know that by asking for your help, we are asking for your trust. Here you can find more detailed information about Hamalogika Hub and our long term plans.


The Hub: what should you expect?

In our work we are always looking for opportunities to mix art with science, architecture, design, technology, education, ecology, etc. Through innovative approaches we will introduce non-conventional cultural products, art works and world practices.

We imagine Hamalogika Hub to be:

  • Shared space: a place for work, fun and creativity, inspiration and education;
  • Culture Hub: gathering place for people, organizations and artists; a meet-up space for discussions, study and analysis, ideas and creation;
  • Info point for the most interesting initiatives in Burgas.



What do we offer?

Here’s an example of what a regular week might include:

  • lectures, seminars and training sessions, presentations;
  • team building events and group sessions;
  • professional consultations in the field of culture, art, modern education and social innovations;
  • workshops and educational courses for kids and adults;
  • festivals, forums, conferences and business events;
  • music and literature events, movie nights, game nights etc.
  • international art residencies and cultural exchange -  visiting artists who will import/export creative potential to and from the city and will stimulate  intercultural dialogue.
Visit our webpage to see examples of projects and workshops we have already completed.

Impact: Why does it matter?

We believe culture is not only a communal good, but also an active tool, contributing to the economic growth of cities, to the creation of new jobs and to the sоcial closeness. One of the main challenges and a big wish for us is to stimulate participation of all stakeholders in the sustainable development of the city through culture.

Providing an inspiring work environment for young people from Bulgaria and abroad, we hope to discover new opportunities, so that Burgas can become a desired destination for the creative minds. We also aim to encourage local residents to take action and bring about positive social change that make use of established and very successful practices abroad. Inspired by social innovation movements and visionаries, we want to speed up the process and build an ideas playground that yields meaningful changes by offering solutions to some of the social issues we encounter daily. This dream of ours is shared by every member of our growing community.
We hope that by making the first step and creating an amazing space, where everyone feels comfortable to learn, think and exchange ideas, we will move forward faster. Support us and make change happen now!

Hamalogika - our work

Hamalogika is a non-profit organization focused on the cultural agenda, education and social change. We collaborate with different  organization to develop sustainable social initiatives and cultural products. So far we have finalized 20 projects, 10 of which in partnership with state institutions, NGOs, schools and the business sector. Since 2013 we've been working as consultants on European Capital of Culture 2019 - first on the candidacy of Burgas, and later on  with Plovdiv - the Bulgarian winner of the title.

hamalogika.com


Thank you for your support!

It means the world to us!  






Здравейте! Ние сме Хамалогика :)

С ваша помощ създаваме ново, по-различно читалище в Бургас!
Нашата кампания в Indiegogo завърши, но продължаваме да събираме средства на :

IBAN: BG57UNCR70001522407739
BIC: UNCRBGSF
Chitalishte Hamalogika

От 2012 г. екипът ни работи по проекти (вж. тук) в областта на културните и творческите индустрии, социалните иновации и образованието. През 2014 г. регистрирахме Народно читалище “Хамалогика”, което ще функционира като културен и социален център. Смятаме, че читалищата в наши дни не развиват напълно потенциала си да откликват на съвременните потребностите за култура и образование и да укрепват гражданското общество.

Затова си поставяме задачата да направим съвременен прочит на тази остаряла институция и да я популяризираме в обществото с помощта на новаторски практики. Подходът, който избрахме, ползва модела на успешните по цял свят “хъбове”*, които създават поле за взаимодействие между артисти, организации и бизнес сектора с цел насърчаване на креативна социална промяна.

_______________________________

* Хъб (hub, англ.) означава ядро, център, точка на много начала.


Защо ви молим за помощ?

Въпреки досегашните ни усилия да отворим врати още през лятото, това не се случи. С помощта на събраните от нашата общност средства успяхме да приключим с по-голямата част от строително-ремонтните дейности .

За да изминем последните метри до финала, имаме спешна нужда от вашата помощ! Вярваме, че най-устойчивата и смислена подкрепа идва от хората за хората, затова и се спряхме именно на "Crowdfunding" метода (Crowdfunding или Групово финансиране е съвременен начин за набавяне на финансови средства от потребител или доброжелател, където много хора дават по малко, за да се осъществи нещо голямо/една голяма кауза).

Чрез закупуването на всяко едно "дарение" вие пряко влияете върху това читалище “Хамалогика” да отвори врати час по-скоро. При реализирането на сумата от € 6,000 ние ще можем да закупим тази критична база от материални и нематериални ресурси (майсторски услуги), без която не можем.


Докъде стигнахме:

Кампанията, от която Вие сте част, е последният етап от един дълъг процес, в който успяхме:

  • да открием и наемем помещение с размер 140 кв.м. в самия център на Бургас (до Операта); 


  • да съборим няколко ненужни стени и стария окачен таван;


  • благодарение на подкрепа на много приятели и фирми от цяла България вече можем да се похвалим с:

    • материал за пода - ламинат

    • метално скеле за амфитеатрални стълби

    • дървен материал за облицовка на стълбите и обзавеждане

    • климатици

    • плочки за санитарното помещение

    • нарастваща подкрепа от нови членове

Какво следва?


Листът от материали и услуги, от които все още имаме нужда, никък не е малък:

  • офис обзавеждане и обурудване

  • електрическа инсталация

  • осветление

  • стени - подвижни и стационарни, плъзгаща се врата

  • завеси и паравани

  • система за окачване на изложби

  • мултимедия

  • както и специфичният квалифициран труд, без който не можем да се справим


За повече информация и при желание да помогнете за набавянето на някои от посочените материали, oбадете ни се и с удоволствие ще поговорим с вас!

Други начини за помощ

Ако предпочитате да дарите чрез банков превод, сметката ни е:

IBAN: BG57UNCR70001522407739
BIC: UNCRBGSF                                                                                                               Читалище Хамалогика

Помощта ви ще е също толкова оценена, ако споделите тази кампания на Фейсбук страница си, в Туитър или изпратите писмо до приятел. Всяка дума достигнала до повече хора повишава шансовете ни час по-скоро да заработим с пълна пара!


Знаем, че молейки ви за помощ, всъщност ви молим за доверие. Тук може да намерите по-детайлна информация за читалище “Хамалогика” и дългострочните ни цели.


Читалище - какво да очаквате?  

Когато чуете читалище, си мислите за библиотека, нали? Но всъщност е много повече от това.

  • Споделено пространство: място за работа, забавление и творчество, вдъхновение и образование;

  • Културен хъб: събирателна точка за неправителствени организации и артисти; място за срещи, дискусии, развиване на идеи и представяне на проекти;

  • Инфо пункт за най-интересните инциативи в Бургас.


Какво предлагаме?

Читалището ще има ежедневна културна програма с участието на артисти и публика от страната и чужбина.

Ето какво би могла да съдържа тя:

  • лекции, семинари, обучения, беседи, презентации;

  • организирани тиймбилдинг събития и групови занимания;

  • работилници/кръжоци за деца и възрастни;

  • фестивали, професионални форуми и конференции;

  • музикални, игрови, литературни, кино и други тематични вечери;

  • международни творчески обмени (резиденции) - с участието на ученици, студенти, артисти.

  • професионални консултации в сферата на културата и изкуствата, съвременното образование и социалните иновации.

Примери за подобни реализирани проекти, може да откриете на интернет страницата ни в категориите Новини и Проекти.


Въздействие - защо това е важно?

Вярваме, че културата не е само общо благо, но и активно средство, което допринася за икономическия растеж на градовете и води до създаването на нови работни места. Една от важните задачи, които си поставяме, е да работим с  всички заинтересовани  за устойчивото развитие на Бургас чрез култура.

Като осигурим вдъхновяваща работна среда, ще привлечем още повече съмишленици и творчески умове към нашата кауза. Ще насърчим бургазлии да бъдат по-предприемчиви и обществено ангажирани. С помощта на културата и изкуството, ще популяризираме социалните иновации на местно ниво - това са нови решения (идеи, продукти, услуги, процеси),  които отговарят на различни обществени потребности по-ефективно от досегашните. 

Крайната ни цел е в читалище Хамалогика да създаваме преживявания, които правят хората по-знаещи, осъзнати и щастливи. Ако цените подобни места, тогава с чисто сърце може да подкрепите тази инициатива!


Хамалогика - нашата работа

Хамалогика е сдружение с нестопанска цел с основна дейност, насочена към създаване, продуциране, промотиране и участие в проекти в областта на културата, изкуството, образованието и техните гранични форми. До този момент сдружението има 20 реализирани проекта, от които 10 в партньорство с държавни и общински институции, неправителствени организации, училища и фирми. От 2013 г. работим и като консултатнти на два от българските градове кандидати за Европейска столица на културата през 2019 - първо на Бургас, а след отпадането от му от надпреварата и на Пловдив, който спечели титлата.

Ако искате да работим заедно, потърсете ни за алтернативна култура, оригинални събития, весели тиймбилдинги и всякакви щури идеи - hamalogika.com

Благодарим ви за подкрепата! Тя е всичко за нас!
story_txt:
>>>Натиснете тук за български език!
 
Greetings from Hamalogika!With your help we are building a creative community hub in Burgas, Bulgaria.Our crowdfunding campaign has ended, but if you wish to support us, you can make a donation to the following bank account:
IBAN: BG57UNCR70001522407739BIC: UNCRBGSFChitalishte Hamalogika For the past 3 years our team have  been working on cultural, educational and social innovation projects in Bulgaria (see our work here). The objective we have set ourselves is to establish the role of culture as a driving force in the processes of sustainable development of our society.Now we’ve reached the point where we need our own place, where we can freely experiment with visionаry ideas for social change. We believe that change depends on each and every one of us and starts with where you live. So we start from Burgas with a creative community hub - a place where people can be educated, inspired, entertained, and brought together in new ways. We chose the widely spread and extremely effective model of “a creative hub”, because it 
really helps the interactions between artists, NGOs and the business 
sector in order to stimulate а positive impact. A hub that generates ideas for the well being of the members of different communities. 
Why do we need your help?
Despite our efforts to open the hub at the end of the summer, it just didn’t happen. Thanks to the help of our local community, we have managed to secure a space and finish a great part of the construction works. However, we are still far from done! To make the place fully functional and truly inspirational for students, artists and entrepreneurs, we have to be sure it meets their expectations.In order to do that we really need your help! We believe that the most sustainable and meaningful support is by the people for the people, that’s why we chose the Crowdfunding method. By pledging to the campaign, you are directly supporting the hub and helping us open as soon as possible. We are hoping to reach the goal of € 6,000 to ensure we have the budget to renovate, furnish and equip the space; to purchase books for the library and organize our first events.We are truly grateful to everyone who can support us!
What have we done so far?
This campaign is the last part of a long process, in which we’ve already managed to:

find and rent a 140 sq.m. space in downtown Burgas, that was deserted for about a decade 




demolish a few unnecessary walls and take down the very old suspended ceiling 




We've also provided: 
laminated flooring; 

railing for amphitheatеr stairs; 

wooden material for the covering of the stairs, the bookshelves and the working spaces; 

2 air conditioners; 

tiling; 

the rising support of new members.




What's next?




We still have a long way to go. Here’s a list of materials and services we need before launching:



office
furnishing


electrical wiring
and installation

professional
sound system and lighting, dance floor

walls (movable
and massive), doors and curtains


wall installation
for exhibitions;

multimedia
- projector, screen, laptops, microphones, etc.


library, audio
and video fund
kitchen and WC appliances;


specific services for the things we cannot carry out ourselves
If you like to donate materials, services or directly purchase some of the stuff  (instead of or alongside a pledge), please  email or call us. We’d love to have a chat!




Other ways to help 




Let the world know about our campaign! Share, tweet, post and email your friends near and far! The more the people support us, the sooner we’ll open our doors for a lovely crowd of innovators and creators!
We know that by asking for your help, we are asking for your trust. Here you can find more detailed information about Hamalogika Hub and our long term plans.






The Hub: what should you expect?



In our work we are always looking for opportunities to mix art with science, 
architecture, design, technology, education, ecology, etc. Through innovative approaches we will introduce non-conventional 
cultural products, art works and world practices.We imagine Hamalogika Hub to be:

Shared space: a place for work, fun and creativity, inspiration and education;


Culture Hub: gathering place for people, organizations and artists; a meet-up space for discussions, study and analysis, ideas and creation; 


Info point for the most interesting initiatives in Burgas.


What do we offer?

Here’s an example of what a regular week might include:

lectures, seminars and training sessions, presentations;
team building events and group sessions;
professional consultations in the field of culture, art, modern education and social innovations;

workshops and educational courses for kids and adults;
festivals, forums, conferences and business events;
music and literature events, movie nights, game nights etc.
international art residencies and cultural exchange -  visiting artists who will import/export creative potential to and from the city and will stimulate  intercultural dialogue.


Visit our webpage to see examples of projects and workshops we have already completed.


Impact: Why does it matter?
We believe culture is not only a communal good, but also an 
active tool, contributing to the economic growth of cities, to the 
creation of new jobs and to the sоcial closeness. One of the main challenges and a big wish for us is to stimulate participation of all stakeholders in the sustainable development of the city through culture. Providing an inspiring work environment for young people from Bulgaria and abroad, we hope to discover new opportunities, so that Burgas can become a desired destination for the creative minds. We also aim to encourage local residents to take action and bring about positive social change that make use of established and very successful practices abroad. Inspired by social innovation movements and visionаries, we want to speed up the process and build an ideas playground that yields meaningful changes by offering solutions to some of the social issues we encounter daily. This dream of ours is shared 
by every member of our growing community.We hope that by making the first step and creating an amazing space, where everyone feels comfortable to learn, think and exchange ideas, we will move forward faster. Support us and make change happen now! Hamalogika - our work




Hamalogika is a non-profit organization focused on the cultural agenda, education and social change. We collaborate with different  organization to develop sustainable social initiatives and cultural products. So far we have finalized 20 projects, 10 of which in partnership with state institutions, NGOs, schools and the business sector. Since 2013 we've been working as consultants on European Capital of Culture 2019 - first on the candidacy of Burgas, and later on  with Plovdiv - the Bulgarian winner of the title. 
hamalogika.com





Thank you for your support! It means the world to us!  



Здравейте! Ние сме Хамалогика :)
С ваша помощ създаваме ново, по-различно читалище в Бургас!Нашата кампания в Indiegogo завърши, но продължаваме да събираме средства на :IBAN: BG57UNCR70001522407739BIC: UNCRBGSFChitalishte Hamalogika От 2012 г. екипът ни работи по проекти (вж. тук)  в областта на културните и творческите индустрии, социалните иновации и образованието. През 2014 
г. регистрирахме Народно читалище “Хамалогика”, което ще функционира като културен и социален център. Смятаме, че читалищата в наши дни не развиват напълно потенциала си да откликват на съвременните потребностите за култура и образование и да укрепват гражданското общество.
Затова си поставяме задачата да направим съвременен прочит на тази остаряла институция и да я популяризираме в обществото с помощта на новаторски практики. Подходът, който избрахме, ползва модела на успешните по цял свят “хъбове”*, които създават поле за взаимодействие между артисти, организации и бизнес сектора с цел насърчаване на креативна социална промяна. 
_______________________________
 * Хъб (hub, англ.) означава ядро, център, точка на много начала.




Защо ви молим за помощ?

Въпреки досегашните ни усилия да отворим врати още през лятото, това не се случи. С помощта на събраните от нашата общност средства успяхме да приключим с по-голямата част от строително-ремонтните дейности . 
За да изминем последните метри до финала, имаме спешна нужда от вашата помощ! Вярваме, че най-устойчивата и смислена подкрепа идва от хората за хората, затова и се спряхме именно на "Crowdfunding" метода (Crowdfunding или Групово финансиране е съвременен начин за набавяне на финансови средства от потребител или доброжелател, където много хора дават по малко, за да се осъществи нещо голямо/една голяма кауза).Чрез закупуването на всяко едно "дарение" вие пряко влияете върху това читалище “Хамалогика” да отвори врати час по-скоро. При реализирането на сумата от € 6,000 ние ще можем да закупим тази критична база от материални и нематериални ресурси (майсторски услуги), без която не можем.



 Докъде стигнахме:

Кампанията, от която Вие сте част, е последният етап от един дълъг процес, в който успяхме:

да открием и наемем помещение с размер 140 кв.м. в самия център на Бургас (до Операта); 




да съборим няколко ненужни стени и стария окачен таван;






благодарение на подкрепа на много приятели и фирми от цяла България вече можем да се похвалим с:

материал за пода - ламинат
метално скеле за амфитеатрални стълби

дървен материал за облицовка на стълбите и обзавеждане
климатици
плочки за санитарното помещение
нарастваща подкрепа от нови членове





Какво следва?



Листът от материали и услуги, от които все още имаме нужда, никък не е малък:

офис обзавеждане и обурудване
електрическа инсталация
осветление
стени - подвижни и стационарни, плъзгаща се врата
завеси и паравани
система за окачване на изложби
мултимедия
както и специфичният квалифициран труд, без който не можем да се справим 

За повече информация и при желание да помогнете за набавянето на някои от посочените материали, oбадете ни се и с удоволствие ще поговорим с вас! 




 Други начини за помощ



Ако предпочитате да дарите чрез банков превод, сметката ни е:
IBAN: BG57UNCR70001522407739BIC: UNCRBGSF                                                                                                               Читалище Хамалогика
Помощта ви ще е също толкова оценена, ако споделите тази кампания на Фейсбук страница си, в Туитър или изпратите писмо до приятел. Всяка дума достигнала до повече хора повишава шансовете ни час по-скоро да заработим с пълна пара!





Знаем, че молейки ви за помощ, всъщност ви молим за доверие. Тук може да намерите по-детайлна информация за читалище “Хамалогика” и дългострочните ни цели.




Читалище - какво да очаквате?  

Когато чуете читалище, си мислите за библиотека, нали? Но всъщност е много повече от това.



Споделено пространство: място за работа, забавление и творчество, вдъхновение и образование; 
Културен хъб: събирателна точка за неправителствени организации и артисти; място за срещи, дискусии, развиване на идеи и представяне на проекти;
Инфо пункт за най-интересните инциативи в Бургас.

Какво предлагаме?
Читалището ще има ежедневна културна програма с участието на артисти и публика от страната и чужбина. 
Ето какво би могла да съдържа тя:

лекции, семинари, обучения, беседи, презентации;
организирани тиймбилдинг събития и групови занимания;
работилници/кръжоци за деца и възрастни;
фестивали, професионални форуми и конференции;
музикални, игрови, литературни, кино и други тематични вечери;
международни творчески обмени (резиденции) - с участието на ученици, студенти, артисти.
професионални консултации в сферата на културата и изкуствата, съвременното образование и социалните иновации.


Примери за подобни реализирани проекти, може да откриете на интернет страницата ни в категориите Новини и Проекти.

Вярваме, че културата не е само общо благо, но и активно 
средство, което допринася за икономическия растеж на градовете и води до

Като осигурим
 вдъхновяваща работна среда, ще привлечем още повече съмишленици и творчески умове към нашата кауза. Ще насърчим бургазлии да бъдат по-предприемчиви и обществено ангажирани. С помощта на културата и изкуството, ще популяризираме социалните иновации на местно ниво - това са нови решения (идеи, продукти, услуги, процеси),  които отговарят на различни обществени потребности по-ефективно от 
досегашните.

Хамалогика - нашата работа 

Хамалогика е сдружение с нестопанска цел с основна дейност, насочена към създаване, продуциране, промотиране и участие в проекти в областта на културата, изкуството, образованието и техните гранични форми. story:
Le projet MDRS Supaéro Crew

MDRS Supaéro Crew est un projet scientifique mené par sept étudiants ingénieurs de l’école Supaéro de Toulouse. Leur objectif est de pouvoir mener une série d’expériences et de simuler durant quinze jours le quotidien d’une équipe d’astronautes sur la planète Mars.

Après une première mission couronnée de succès et fortement médiatisée, sept étudiants se préparent à partir en février 2016, en préparant des expériences innovantes, aussi bien technologiques, scientifiques et humaines.


Qu’est-ce que la Mars Desert Research Station ?

La Mars Desert Research Station (MDRS), implantée dans le désert de l’Utah, a été installée par Mars Society pour servir de cadre à des simulations de missions martiennes. De septembre à avril, des équipages de six personnes venant du monde entier se relaient au cours de rotations de deux semaines pour y effectuer des expériences dans des conditions géologiques et thermiques proches de celles rencontrées sur la planète rouge.

Chaque équipe teste à son tour les différents aspects de ce que les astronautes auront à vivre : ergonomie de l’habitat, vie en communauté, difficultés techniques, alimentation lyophilisée, etc. Ces expériences seront rapportées et utilisées afin d’améliorer ces aspects. Ce projet a donc une réelle portée pratique et concrète étant donné que nos résultats seront utilisés par les agences spatiales pour préparer une véritable mission sur Mars !


Quel est le but de ces missions ?

Ces missions permettent à des scientifiques, des étudiants et des ingénieurs de tester du matériel destiné à l’industrie aérospatiale : drones, robots, prototypes de scaphandres, etc. Lors des rotations, Mars Society tient tout particulièrement à l’aspect réaliste de ces simulations. L’intérêt est en effet de plonger les équipages dans les mêmes conditions, de les confronter aux mêmes difficultés que celles auxquelles des astronautes effectivement implantés sur Mars devront faire face.

Ainsi, les sorties pour effectuer des expériences hors de la base ne peuvent être effectuées qu’en scaphandre ; les communications avec les personnes restées sur « Terre » subissent un délai de plusieurs minutes, pour simuler les effets d’un éloignement de 400 millions de kilomètres.


Prochain objectif : la mission MDRS 164

Fort des succès rencontrés par les deux membres fondateurs de notre équipe lors de la mission MDRS 151, qui s’est déroulée du 14 au 29 mars dans le désert de l’Utah, l’équipage MDRS Supaéro est fier d’avoir été sélectionné pour participer l’année prochaine à la mission MDRS 164, qui se déroulera du 20 février au 6 mars 2016.

L’expérience acquise par les membres de l’équipage 151, et la grande réussite de la mission dans sa totalité, aussi bien en terme de simulation que des résultats expérimentaux qui ont été obtenus sur place, a poussé une nouvelle fois la Mars Society à nous accorder sa confiance, en attribuant à l’intégralité de l’équipage Supaéro le privilège de participer à un rotation l’année prochaine.


Les expériences que nous allons mener


•  Application de l’oculométrie à la détection de la dérive attentionnelle et à la mesure de l’état psychologique d’un astronaute

•  Utilisation de lunettes à réalité augmentée en condition de sortie extra-véhiculaire : les Google Glass made in France prêtée par la société Optinvent seront testées lors de sorties en scaphandre

•  Utilisation d’un drone quadricoptère (cf. ci-contre) comme relais radio et outil de localisation pour communiquer avec la base et se repérer dans le désert martien

•  Développement d’un outil de mesure de l’opacité de l’atmosphère


Financement de la mission

Le budget de la mission MDRS 164 se répartit comme suit

·  Avion et transport des expériences : 5 600 euros

·  Transport jusqu’à la station : 2 100 euros

·  Location de la station : 2 640euros

·  Combinaisons et badges : 450 euros

·  Supports de communication : 250 euros

·  Matériel technique : 260 euros

Notre budget pour la prochaine mission (sept membres) est de 11 300euros. 

Nous avons choisi de fixer l'objectif de notre campagne à 2000 euros. Si l'objectif est atteint, cette somme sera répartie comme suit :

· 1 000 euros pour couvrir une partie de la location de la station

· 400 euros pour le transport des expériences en avion jusqu'aux Etats-Unis

· le reste nous permettra de couvrir en partie les frais du déplacement de sept personnes et du matériel depuis l'aéroport d'arrivée jusqu'à la station, située à plusieurs centaines de kilomètres dans le désert.

A titre indicatif, le budget de la mission précédente (deux personnes) était de 2500 euros, financé à 80% par l’ISAE-Supaéro et à 20% par l’association Planète Mars.


Les retombées médiatiques de la précédente mission :

•  Télévision (France 3, TLT, France Live)

•  Radio (RTL)

•  Presse (Dépêche du midi, Le Figaro, 20minutes, …)

•  Magazines (Society)

•  Sites web (Studyrama, Coté Toulouse, Toulouse Bouge, Infos niooz, …)

•  Presse étrangère (La Province en Belgique)

projet MDRS Supaéro Crew
MDRS
Supaéro Crew est un projet scientifique mené par sept étudiants
ingénieurs de l’école Supaéro de Toulouse. Leur objectif est de pouvoir
mener une série d’expériences et de simuler durant quinze jours le quotidien
d’une équipe d’astronautes sur la planète Mars.
Après une première mission couronnée de
succès et fortement médiatisée, sept étudiants se préparent à partir en
février 2016, en préparant des expériences innovantes, aussi bien
technologiques, scientifiques et humaines.

Qu’est-ce que la Mars Desert Research
Station ?

La Mars
Desert Research Station (MDRS), implantée dans le désert de l’Utah, a été
installée par Mars Society pour servir de cadre à des simulations de
missions martiennes. De septembre à avril, des équipages de six
personnes venant du monde entier se relaient au cours de rotations de
deux semaines pour y effectuer des expériences dans des conditions
géologiques et thermiques proches de celles rencontrées sur la planète rouge.
Chaque équipe teste à son tour les
différents aspects de ce que les astronautes auront à vivre : ergonomie de
l’habitat, vie en communauté, difficultés techniques, alimentation lyophilisée,
etc. Ces expériences seront rapportées et utilisées afin d’améliorer ces
aspects. Ce projet a donc une réelle portée pratique et concrète étant donné
que nos résultats seront utilisés par les agences spatiales pour préparer une
véritable mission sur Mars ! 

Quel est le but de ces
missions ?

Ces
missions permettent à des scientifiques, des étudiants et des ingénieurs de
tester du matériel destiné à l’industrie aérospatiale : drones, robots,
prototypes de scaphandres, etc. Lors des rotations, Mars Society tient tout
particulièrement à l’aspect réaliste de ces simulations. L’intérêt est en
effet de plonger les équipages dans les mêmes conditions, de les confronter aux
mêmes difficultés que celles auxquelles des astronautes effectivement
implantés sur Mars devront faire face. 
Ainsi,
les sorties pour effectuer des expériences hors de la base ne peuvent
être effectuées qu’en scaphandre ; les communications avec les
personnes restées sur « Terre » subissent un délai de plusieurs
minutes, pour simuler les effets d’un éloignement de 400 millions de
kilomètres.
Prochain objectif : la mission MDRS
164
Fort
des succès rencontrés par les deux membres fondateurs de notre équipe lors de
la mission MDRS 151, qui s’est déroulée du 14 au 29 mars dans le désert
de l’Utah, l’équipage MDRS Supaéro est fier d’avoir été sélectionné pour
participer l’année prochaine à la mission MDRS 164, qui se déroulera
du 20 février au 6 mars 2016.
L’expérience
acquise par les membres de l’équipage 151, et la grande réussite de la mission
dans sa totalité, aussi bien en terme de simulation que des résultats
expérimentaux qui ont été obtenus sur place, a poussé une nouvelle fois la Mars
Society à nous accorder sa confiance, en attribuant à l’intégralité de
l’équipage Supaéro le privilège de participer à un rotation l’année prochaine.
Les expériences que nous allons mener

• 
Application de l’oculométrie à la détection de la dérive attentionnelle et à la mesure de l’état
psychologique d’un astronaute
• 
Utilisation de lunettes à réalité augmentée en condition de sortie
extra-véhiculaire :
les Google Glass made in France prêtée par la société Optinvent seront
testées lors de sorties en scaphandre
• 
Utilisation d’un drone quadricoptère (cf. ci-contre) comme relais radio et outil de
localisation pour communiquer avec la base et se repérer dans le désert martien
• 
Développement d’un outil de mesure de l’opacité de l’atmosphère
Financement de la mission
Le
budget de la mission MDRS 164 se répartit comme suit 
· 
Avion et transport des expériences : 5 600 euros
· 
Transport jusqu’à la station : 2 100 euros
· 
Location de la station : 2 640euros
· 
Combinaisons et badges : 450 euros·  Supports de communication : 250 euros·  Matériel technique : 260 euros
Notre budget pour la prochaine mission (sept membres) est de 11 300euros. Nous avons choisi de fixer l'objectif de notre campagne à 2000 euros. Si l'objectif est atteint, cette somme sera répartie comme suit :· 1 000 euros pour couvrir une partie de la location de la station· 400 euros pour le transport des expériences en avion jusqu'aux Etats-Unis· le reste nous permettra de couvrir en partie les frais du déplacement de sept personnes et du matériel depuis l'aéroport d'arrivée jusqu'à la station, située à plusieurs centaines de kilomètres dans le désert.A titre indicatif, le budget de la mission précédente (deux personnes) était de 2500 euros, financé à 80% par l’ISAE-Supaéro et à 20%
par l’association Planète Mars.
Les retombées médiatiques de la précédente
mission :
• 
Télévision (France
3, TLT, France Live)
• 
Radio (RTL)
• 
Presse (Dépêche
du midi, Le Figaro, 20minutes, …)
• 
Magazines (Society)
• 
Sites web (Studyrama, Coté Toulouse,
Toulouse Bouge, Infos niooz, …)
• 
Presse étrangère (La Province en
Belgique)

story:
When Will Kiefer was a senior at Franklin & Marshall College, he volunteered as a mentor and personal trainer for Lancaster's at-risk youth and learned about the severity of the vicious cycle that was trapping these kids in jails and court rooms.

Following graduation, Will dedicated himself to advancing the lives of these at-risk youth. He couldn't walk away from his students  nor could he watch from the sidelines. These young men desperately needed support and guidance; thus, Bench Mark Program was born.

Bench Mark Program was born out of necessity. At-risk youth typically don't respond well to traditional therapy or parole meetings. Put simply, they don't want to talk about their feelings to people they can't trust. Bench Mark Program provides a more effective outlet for them -- one where they can just be themselves while receiving unconditional and long-term support.

Bench Mark Program is a nonprofit that advances the lives of at-risk youth in Lancaster, PA. The streets sell a lifestyle rooted in brotherhood, protection, and opportunity – but with the potential for great personal costs. Bench Mark Program invests in our at-risk youth, providing these perceived street benefits without risk. We are a strength-based family of mentors who use exercise, academic counseling, and goal-achievement as the means to a successful future. While life on the streets is temporary, Bench Mark Program commits to our students’ well-being and happiness for as long as they need.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Bench Mark Program’s intent is to relocate its facility directly within the neighborhoods where its students live, attend school, and spend free time. The new facility will allow Bench Mark Program to accommodate more students as well as expand its emphasis on academic and employment related services. To better serve the target population, the new Bench Mark Program facility will serve as a positive safe house within the community that is easily accessible to youth as well as other support providers.

Fundraising Goal: $25,000

Breakdown:

1.  $12,000: base rent for 2,400 square feet warehouse space ($1,000/month)

2.  $5,000: insurance package needed to cover students, coaches, and directors

3.  $2,500: internet installation and operation at location for academic use (Comcast Deluxe 50 package)

4.  $2,000: minor renovations to bathroom, heating fixtures, etc.

5.  $3,500: special education fund created to serve students enrolling in college with the purchase of necessary school equipment such as laptops, books, etc. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Our facility serves as a safe house for 50 students and counting, many of whom have achieved some noteworthy milestones since enrolling in our program. Some of their achievements are listed below:

  • Noel: high school gradate, college bound in fall '15, two part-time jobs
  • Tyler: high school graduate, college bound in fall '15, two part-time jobs, lost 15 pounds in three months
  • Manny: high school graduate, getting off probation, searching for employment
  • Reggie: high school gradate, full-time employment, provides for his daughter and family
  • Darius: high school graduate, college bound in fall '15, part-time job
  • Tyrese & Kindu: completed mandatory community service hours, searching for employment

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

In short, we need the space to accommodate more young men and empower them to achieve their goals. We refuse to say no to those who need our help; everyone deserves to be at-risk for excellence! 

Thank you very much for your contribution. Every dollar counts towards reaching our fundraising goal!

story:
“Damn everything but the circus! ...damn everything that is grim, dull, motionless, unrisking...That won't throw it's heart into the tension, surprise, fear and delight”

E. E. Cummings


About Me

In brief, I am a burlesquer, cabaret artist and performer from Scotland who has spent the last five years of my life pursuing the seemingly unattainable goal of becoming a professional circus artist.

I am 31 years old, not a gymnast, nor a professionally trained dancer, but I did fall in love with the beauty and expressive potential of circus, and on June 28th 2013 after years of training hard at Aerial Edge (Glasgow) and at Circus Warehouse (New York), I was offered a place to study on the degree programme at the National Centre for Circus Arts (formerly The Circus Space) in London!

I could hardly believe it was true! The NCCA is one of only a handful of institutions in the world that offers degree level training in Circus Arts, it is internationally renowned and receives many hundreds of applications every year; it felt like being accepted to Oxford or Harvard!

Being accepted onto the course really is a once in a lifetime opportunity  to make a wild and passionate leap of faith towards the future; to push my body and my creativity not only to the next level, but to the very brink, and to learn the skills required to produce meaningful work in contemporary circus.

Contemporary Circus is more than just big tops and touring shows. It has moved on to encompass aspects of physical theatre, contemporary movement theory, and expressive narrative. It has established itself as a respected discipline, while still retaining the magic and spectacle of its heritage. It is a medium that deals essentially with movement and the human form, and so it has a special ability to transcend barriers of language and culture to really connect and resonate with audiences of all types.


My Circus Story So Far....


After a frantic few weeks of packing and selling almost everything I owned, I said goodbye to my friends, my family and my home and set off for London with no fixed address to go to, but high hopes of what I could achieve. However, during my first term on the course SAAS, the government agency that deals with Scottish student funding, decided not to offer me any support to pay my tuition fees as I am classed as an Independent Student who already holds qualifications. Despite many months of appeals from myself, the NCCA and various mental health charities, SAAS refused to change their decision. 

The National Centre kindly allowed me to continue on with the course while I looked for alternative sources of funding, but despite the desperate state of both my finances and my mental health, I couldn't find anywhere that was able to give me any support - I just didn't meet their requirements; whether it was age, nationality, background, what I was studying, or where I had come from, nowhere was prepared to offer me financial assistance. 

After nearly a year of couch surfing, earning, saving, and writing to countless organisations and institutions while still training full time, I sadly came up empty handed, and had to leave the course in July 2014 after completing the first year of the degree.

So, after only one year on the most incredible course I could have imagined, I had to return home, broke, depressed, disheartened, and owing the NCCA more than £6000 in unpaid fees.


...Since then....

After a long period of soul searching, continuing to train and more than a little TLC from my amazing friends, I managed to pay off what I owed to the NCCA, and gather myself together to look towards returning.

It would be easy to see this year out as wasted time, but I have tried to see it as an important development, both personally and professionally: I have learned flying trapeze, aerial cradle and straps, taught Tightwire, co-directed an ensemble circus show, and, for the first time ever, done more work in circus than in any other art form. 

It has been a hard but fruitful year, and after a successful re-audition, the NCCA have allowed me to return to the degree programme this September!


About The National Centre for Circus Arts 

The tuition fees for the NCCA are set at £9000 per year.

This is on-par with the most prestigious degrees in Dance, Drama, Music and Fine Art available in the UK at the moment. It is a large amount of money, but it has every right to be, as this is one of the most demanding and selective of courses, and is accredited by the London Conservatoire for Dance and Drama. 

The programme is very physically intensive, and classes are full time Monday to Friday, with some of the best teachers in the industry. Former graduates have gone on work internationally, to found their own award winning companies. and to work for Cirque du Soleil!

Learn more about the NCCA and the CDD here:

https://www.nationalcircus.org.uk/

http;//www.cdd.ac.uk


Money!

When I left the NCCA in June 2014 I owed them over £6000 in unpaid fees. After a great deal of hard work (and an amazing first Crowdfunding campaign!) I was able to pay them back, and even managed to raise the first instalment of tuition fees needed to return this September (2015). 

This Campaign is to raise the last £3000 I need to complete the Second year of training and gain my Foundation Degree in Circus Arts!


The Perks

The world of 'The Circus' can seem like an almost mystical place, far removed from the majority of people's lives. The Perks I have on offer for this campaign show something of what it is I do, allow people to experience some of the magic of the modern Circus, and see first-hand how their donations are helping me to progress. 

I am so very humbled by any and all donations that people choose to make, and I am hoping to deliver many of the Perks as shortly after the campaign ends as possible, though some, such as "Starter for Ten", "Circus - Live!" and  "Circus VIP" will take a little longer to deliver.

 

The Impact

By donating, you will be helping me to return to my place on the Foundation Degree at the National Centre for Circus Arts, and train at one of the most prestigious schools in the world. I will not only be learning some of the best circus technique, but will also be given classes in dance, theatre, performance and production planning. 

These skills will not only help me to develop as an individual, but also give me the opportunity to make a contribute to the wider performing arts industry. After graduating I am intending to make my own work, and also help support the work and developments of others, and pass on the unique skills I have gained to the next generation artists. 

I believe that circus is elemental, astounding and sincere, because it uses as its medium the one thing that we all still share and have in common: the human body, with all of its incredible potential, and devastating vulnerability. 

I hope that people have enjoyed the work I've made so far, and dare to hope they may be interested to see what I could do in the future if I reach my goal. 


Other Ways You Can Help

All help and support are hugely welcome, and if you aren't able to contribute, please help me to reach as many people as possible! 

Share my campaign using the Indiegogo share tools.

Tweet, facebook or email about it, and please also visit my blog:

http://damneverythingbutthecircus.com/

story:
Firstly thank you to all of you that have supported me over the past two years!

This year I am moving out of my mothers home to central London rented accommodation and the finances are tight!

I needed to move out to be closer to RADA in order to shorten the commute of 1hr from home, so I can be close to RADA to do the performances and get home easily.

My hours will be later at night so it didn't seem possible to travel an hour to get home in this situation.

The money raised will help me with my living costs as my student maintanance only covers my rent!

Any help will be very gratefully received!

Thank you,

Skye Hallam-Hankin

My hours will be later at night so it didn't seem possible to travel an hour to get home in this situation. The money raised will help me with my living costs as my student maintanance only covers my rent! Any help will be very gratefully received!Thank you,Skye Hallam-Hankin

story:
RESTORE EBENEZER ACADEMY

How would you feel if you did not have parents to provide for you and to guide you into adulthood? Or if having the basic necessities of life was nothing short of a luxury? Or if you had to learn in a classroom with a structure that exposed you to the elements, with a floor of just dirt, with minimal teaching materials?

How would you feel to know that your oasis in the desert—your school—had to close because it did not meet the minimum educational standards?

This is the story of the students of Ebenezer Academy Primary School in Rwebikona, Ruhinda Sub County, Rujumbura County, Rukungiri District in Uganda. Founded in 2009 by Pastor Godwin Mwesigye  Batwaza and his wife, Jackie. The school was born out of the need to provide a base for a solid education for children of the community who were orphaned, and who were impoverished.

The name Ebenezer means Stone of Help and indeed it aims to be a solid place where those in need can find relief. However in February 2014, the school was closed by the Local Government Services Directorate because of the school’s inability to meet the required standards. Since then the over 100 students have been forced to either stay at home or receive substandard education elsewhere within the villages.

Ebenezer Academy was adopted in August 2014 by Faith Chapel, Faith Apostolic Ministries, based in Kingston Jamaica. The Ministry has been liaising with the school administrators to organize resources to prepare for the school’s reopening, but we cannot do it alone. We need your help.

What We Need & What You Get

Ebenezer Academy catered to approximately 150 enthusiastic students, for whom they provided an education and a hot meal daily. The requirements to keep the school operational include having

-  Building plans, lease agreement, land title

-  Building inspection and approval

-  Adequate provisions for pupils’ physical, health and moral welfare

-  A conducive learning environment

In order to raise the standard and have Ebenezer Academy reopened, funding totalling Ugandan Shilling (USH) 126.45 Million is needed. Using a currency conversion rate of  USD1: USH 2,500, this converts to US$50,580. The break down is as follows:


ITEM

USH

US$

Land Purchase

15,000,000

6,000

Building Material and Fixtures

49,350,000

19,740

Labour (construction)

7,000,000

2,800

Furniture

11,000,000

4,400

Text books and teaching aids

1,500,000

600

Recreation (Swings)

3,000,000

1,200

Food (150 students daily for 1 year)

39,600,000

15,840

GRAND TOTAL

126,450,000

50,580

We are fully aware that any contribution made is a sacrifice on the part of the contributor, and at times despite our best efforts, we may not quite hit the desired target. We do hope that this will not be the case in this instance, but should we fall short in our target, the first order of priority will be to purchase the land for expansion and to acquire the building materials and fixtures.

As partners together in helping to provide a brighter future for some of Uganda’s children, we would like to send you personalised electronic notes, cards etc for your invaluable contributions.

The Impact

In helping Ebenezer Academy to reopen, you will be giving hope to over 100 children living in impoverished conditions. Your assistance will help the community to positively impact the country by taking these children beyond their current horizons by virtue of equipping them with a solid education, and by helping them to grow physically through providing for their nutritional needs.

You will be helping these children for a lifetime as they are directed to accomplish their purpose in this world and strive to be productive citizens contributing to their nation's welfare.

Risks & Challenges

A potential challenge to accomplishing this goal of restoring the Academy is the possible devaluation of the Ugandan currency, which could prompt increases in the budgeted line items. Through our contact in Uganda, we will aim to establish preferential trade agreements with suppliers in order to get the best rates possible for goods and services, particularly if we order in bulk. To mitigate against price increases, we hope to make the necessary purchases within two days after receiving funding.

Other Ways You Can Help

You may have read the description and sincerely desire to help, but you don’t have the funds required. The good news is that you CAN still assist. “How?” you may wonder…

You can assist by donating clothes, shoes, non-perishable food items, school supplies and stationery, learning aids, etc  (contact us via our email address - fammissionkenya@gmail.com for further details on how to donate tangibles).

It can be a church, group, or community effort. Please spread the word. Share this link and information with your friends, family, colleagues…share with everyone, and let us join forces to accomplish this goal. Your sacrifice for God and His people will not go unrewarded.

This project is too important and the lives of the children too valuable not to have us reach the target in the shortest possible time.

Each dollar, each item goes a far way

Play your part…Lend a hand…

Help the school fulfil its purpose of being the Stone of Help. It will mean the world of difference to these needy, orphaned children.Don’t let their bright stars dim into obscurity.

Restore Ebenezer Academy.

Build a child…build a community…build a nation…build the world.

Thank you for caring…

Contact us at fammissionkenya@gmail.com

Thank you.

Restore Ebenezer Academy is endorsed and supported by Faith Chapel, Faith Apostolic Ministries
story_txt:
RESTORE
EBENEZER ACADEMY 

How would you feel if you did
not have parents to provide for you and to guide you into adulthood? Or if having the
basic necessities of life was nothing short of a luxury? Or if you had to learn in a classroom with a structure that exposed you to the elements, with a
floor of just dirt, with minimal teaching materials?
How would you feel to know that
your oasis in the desert—your school—had to close because it did not meet the
minimum educational standards?
This is the story of the students of Ebenezer Academy Primary
School in Rwebikona, Ruhinda Sub County, Rujumbura County,
Rukungiri District in Uganda.
Founded in 2009 by Pastor Godwin Mwesigye 
Batwaza and his wife, Jackie. The school was born out of
the need to provide a base for a solid education for children of the community
who were orphaned, and who were impoverished. The name Ebenezer means Stone of Help and indeed it aims to be a
solid place where those in need can find relief. However in February 2014, the
school was closed by the Local Government Services Directorate because of the
school’s inability to meet the required standards. Since then the over 100 students have been
forced to either stay at home or receive substandard education elsewhere within
the villages.
Ebenezer Academy was adopted in August 2014 by Faith Chapel,
Faith Apostolic Ministries, based in Kingston Jamaica. The Ministry has been
liaising with the school administrators to organize resources to prepare for
the school’s reopening, but we cannot do it alone. We need your help.

What We Need & What You Get
Ebenezer
Academy catered to approximately 150 enthusiastic students, for whom they
provided an education and a hot meal daily. The requirements to keep the school
operational include having
- 
Building plans, lease agreement, land
title
- 
Building inspection and approval
- 
Adequate provisions for pupils’ physical,
health and moral welfare
- 
A conducive learning environment
In
order to raise the standard and have Ebenezer Academy reopened, funding totalling
Ugandan Shilling (USH) 126.45 Million is needed. Using a currency conversion rate of  USD1: USH 2,500, this converts to US$50,580. The break down is as follows:


ITEM


USH


US$




Land Purchase


15,000,000


6,000




Building Material and Fixtures


49,350,000


19,740




Labour (construction)


7,000,000


2,800




Furniture


11,000,000


4,400




Text books and teaching aids


1,500,000


600




Recreation (Swings)


3,000,000


1,200




Food (150 students daily for 1 year)


39,600,000


15,840




GRAND
  TOTAL


126,450,000


50,580


We are fully aware that any
contribution made is a sacrifice on the part of the contributor, and at times
despite our best efforts, we may not quite hit the desired target. We do hope
that this will not be the case in this instance, but should we fall short in
our target, the first order of priority will be to purchase the land for
expansion and to acquire the building materials and fixtures.As partners together in helping
to provide a brighter future for some of Uganda’s children, we would like to send you personalised electronic notes, cards etc for your invaluable contributions. 
The Impact
In helping Ebenezer Academy to
reopen, you will be giving hope to over 100 children living in impoverished conditions.
Your assistance will help the
community to positively impact the country by taking these children beyond their current horizons by virtue of equipping them
with a solid education, and by helping them to grow physically through providing for their nutritional needs. You will be helping these children for a lifetime
as they are directed to accomplish their purpose in this world and strive to be productive citizens contributing to their nation's welfare. 
Risks &
Challenges
A potential challenge to
accomplishing this goal of restoring the Academy is the possible devaluation of the Ugandan currency,
which could prompt increases in the budgeted line items. Through our contact in
Uganda, we will aim to establish preferential trade agreements with suppliers
in order to get the best rates possible for goods and services, particularly if
we order in bulk. To mitigate against price increases, we hope to make the
necessary purchases within two days after receiving funding.
Other Ways You Can Help
You may have read the
description and sincerely desire to help, but you don’t have the funds
required. The good news is that you CAN still assist. “How?” you may wonder…
You can assist by donating
clothes, shoes, non-perishable food items, school supplies and stationery,
learning aids, etc  (contact us via our email address - fammissionkenya@gmail.com for further details on how to donate tangibles).It can be a church, group, or community effort. Please
spread the word. Share this link and information with your friends, family,
colleagues…share with everyone, and let us join forces to accomplish this goal.
Your sacrifice for God and His people will not go unrewarded.
This project is too important
and the lives of the children too valuable not to have us reach the target in
the shortest possible time. 
Each dollar, each item goes a far way
Play
your part…Lend
a hand…
Help the school fulfil its purpose of
being the Stone of Help. It will mean the world of difference to
these needy, orphaned children.Don’t
let their bright stars dim into obscurity.
Restore Ebenezer Academy.
Build a child…build a community…build a
nation…build the world.
Thank you for caring…


Contact us at fammissionkenya@gmail.com 
Thank you.
Restore Ebenezer Academy is endorsed and
supported by Faith Chapel, Faith Apostolic Ministries

story:
Hello, my name is Colleen Williams; I am a junior at Clarion University of Pennsylvania studying to obtain my Bachelor of Science in biology. I have always had an affinity for animals, primarily lions, and realized at a young age that I wanted nothing more than to work with them. I am currently trying to raise money for my dream internship in Africa that will not only better my education and help me gain a fuller understanding of my line of work, but also prepare me to enter the field as soon as I graduate. This internship is one of the best out there and will help me be extremely marketable in such a competitive field. However, before I can achieve this dream I have to ask for help. In order to attend this internship, I will be required to provide approximately $9,000. This will be one of my biggest obstacles to overcome, though it is not one that I am willing to let stand in the way of my dreams. Before I ask for any donations, I would like to tell you about the trip I will be taking.

For six months I will be stationed in an African Savannah on a very secluded base where I will spend my first three months studying under a mentor and attending lectures on what being a conservationist entails. For my final three months, I will be considered an unpaid staff member and will be assisting in the training of volunteers. I will also be given my own projects to undertake. My duties will include a wide range of experiences, from analyzing paper data to being meters from a live lion and noting down observations on their mannerisms.

I am asking that you graciously help me raise money so that I can receive this training, which is a true once-in-a-lifetime experience. Helping me raise money does not require your donation, though that would be highly appreciated, but can also involve spreading word. I have a long way to go before I can achieve this goal, and it is not something I can do myself. Please help me by donating anything as little as $5 and/or passing on to your friends, family, and coworkers what I am trying to accomplish and the goals I have set. I can make a huge difference in the world, and I will. This internship gives me the ability to do so, as does your gratuity.

Thank you very much,

Colleen N Williams

story:
UPDATES: 

  • 6/6: Fuse!box does a little fantrucking - if that's even possible - after a shout out from one of our favorite makers, Mythbuster Adam Savage!
  • 6/5: Fuse!box is featured by SparkTruck, one of our biggest inspirations for the mobile hackerspace concept. Woot!
  • 6/3: We're on the MIT Admissions blog, thanks to the awesome Allan Ko.
  • 5/18: Fuse!box is featured by Ayah Bdeir, founder of LittleBits! Thanks for the shoutout, Ayah!
  • 5/17 and 5/18: Fuse!box takes on the Bay Area MakerFaire! We had a fantastic time in the MakerShed manning an enormous LED sign, learning what everyone would build (if they could build anything), and spreading the word about mobile hackerspaces! Check out our photos from MakerFaire in the gallery.

Our Story

Fuse!box is a Stanford-student-led education initiative aimed at bringing free classes on electronics and coding directly to local low income students in the Bay Area.

We're building a mobile hackerspace - think an ice cream truck, but stuffed with electronics equipment and excited engineering students, so that we can set up shop and bring the experience of an electronics lab and programming class to students whose communities don't have the spaces, let alone the resources, to build.

Our project was sparked by frustration – after working with students struggling to understand where classroom lessons spilled over into the real world, we wanted to bring the tangible thrill of building directly back to them. Inspired by the Stanford d.school's SparkTruck model, we hope to expand the concept of mobile hackerspaces, untethered to any specific location, to provide accessible and ongoing classes to students across multiple locations each month. 

We've already taught 50 students how to build with Arduinos, and we've seen up close how fantastically empowering it is to know, even a little bit, what tools you can use to start making your ideas happen. Our goal is to expand on that, and this time, to bring the classes to students who need them most.

What We Need & What You Get

We've already got the materials for our first classes - we've got 30 Arduinos (shout out to SparkFun and theMake Education team for getting us kickstarted!), motors, sensors, and a heck of a lot of LEDs. We're fundraising, however, to put the "mobile" in mobile hackerspace, so here's what your money can make happen:

  • A truck! For $15,000, we'll be able to cover the costs of a small delivery truck, so that we can take Fuse!box all over the Bay Area. 
  • Gadgets and gizmos galore: For $5000, we'll get more (and fancier) tools to teach kids making, possibly including a 3D printer, additional Arduinos, Raspberry Pi computers, and more.
  • Parts for everyone: the remaining funding will go towards enough additional parts - sensors, lights, and other electronic components - to reach as many students as possible.

Our Team

We are a team of makers and teachers. Collectively, we have worked with students in schools ranging from a Chinese orphanage to schools across the US. We will be bringing research experience spanning fields from chemistry to CS - our team includes members who have optimized fuel cells, built better search-and-rescue algorithms, turned hydrogels into drug delivery systems, and hacked mobile phones to transmit heartbeats – as well as outreach work for teams including Code The Change and ACM. And we’re unbelievably excited to make this happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

We get it - sometimes, you just can't contribute, but there are still ways to help! Spread the word and let the world (your world) know that Fuse!box is here. Make some noise! Noise is great. You can share our short link, igg.me/at/fuseboxhackerspace. And we'll be happy.

The Word So Far

  • It's  "a magic school truck full of engineering toys" - Allan Ko, for the MIT Admissions blog
  • Fuse!box can "reignite the excitement of learning in students who might otherwise be struggling by giving them access to the tools to build and make" - Google SolveForX: Moonshot Meetup with Ayah Bdeir and Limor Fried of Adafruit Industries
  • "@fusebox launches @indiegogo campaign to make mobile #makerspace" - Ayah Bdeir, Founder of LittleBits

story:
I grew up in a single parent household. Over the course of high school, my mother became increasingly emotionally abusive and I looked forward to going away to college as finally getting an out. I was accepted to Fordham University on a full scholarship, but during my second semester suffered various health issues - both physical and mental - that resulted in me losing about half my scholarship. My mother has spent the past four months incessantly torturing me about this fact, and using my new increased financial independence on her as a means through which to make my life miserable. Part of my "punishment" includes coming home from school every night, even though I am technically a resident on campus. She no longer allows me to participate in any of the extra curriculars that I love, like our school's Theatrical Outreach Program, which gives back to the Bronx community through the art of theatre. 

Recently, my mother has informed me that she refuses to pay for my schooling for the rest of the year, and that she intends to pull me out of Fordham altogether after this first semester, and "if I'm lucky", she says, I can go to our local Community College. I am in the process of getting my real estate license in hopes that I will soon be able to financially support myself, but until then (the beginning of December), I need to make the next two payments for my tuition myself. She shut down my credit cards and emptied my bank account because it was still linked to hers. 

Any help would be so incredibly appreciated - not only would you be helping me stay in school, a place I love and feel I so hugely belong, but you would be helping me to finally crawl out from underneath my mother's oppressive thumb. Thank you in advance for any help, and I appreciate the part you might play in my being able to breathe freely again.

story:
I’m Kate Dodd, and I’m an AP Art History teacher at Columbia High School in Maplewood NJ.  I’ve been teaching this course for quite awhile – more than ten years.  That means I have led over 400 students thru 30,000 years of art history annually – maybe even you, or your son or daughter!  I love teaching this class, and yet I’ve never been to Rome, the place I probably talk about the most all year long. 

This coming year the entire AP art history curriculum is being changed by the College Board, and I am hoping to attend a professional development AP institute at John Cabot University in Rome to learn about all of these changes.  While I can pay for the tuition for this program through district funds and grants, I need to pay for my own airfare.  That’s where you come in!  Many small donations will add up to making this trip possible for me!  Especially if you or your kids had me as a teacher in the past, I hope you will consider helping out.  If I had $5 for every student who’s taken this course with me, I would have much more than enough to make this a reality! 

Attending this institute will give me the knowledge and motivation to deal with the large scale changes in coverage and curriculum that are going to be required next year. On my return I will be rewriting the entire curriculum and presenting professional development lectures in our district. 
Even if you can't donate, you can help by sharing this campaign with anyone you think might be interested, including using the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Une maison à reconstruire, des vies à sauver.

 

Le tremblement de terre du 25 avril dernier a affecté et changé la vie drastiquement de la communauté népalaise. Ayant moi-même habité et travaillé à Katmandou en 2012, je connais les népalais, ces gens incroyables, souriants, aidants, optimistes, généreux, remplis de vivacité et de curiosité, et qui n'avaient déjà pas, avant la catastrophe, d'acquis matériel. 

   Leurs maisons, ce sont eux qui les construisent eux-mêmes, souvent par étapes (faute de moyens) et durant une très longue période. Une maison là-bas, c'est un trésor qui se partage en famille. Dans un pays où on n'a pas grands choses, et après un événement comme celui-ci, un toit c'est l'essentiel, de la nourriture et des vêtements chauds.

                                                       


 Les miracles se font à petite échelle.

 Cette semaine, j'étais connecté sur Skype 24h sur 24. 

  J'attendais des nouvelles d'amis népalais et surtout des enfants de l'orphelinat Mary Home Child Center où j'ai travaillé durant quelques mois. J'ai enfin eu des nouvelles hier soir: les enfants sont tous sains et saufs... mais sans abris, manquant d'eau et de nourriture, et demandant une aide qu'il est difficile d'apporter concrètement quand on habite à l'autre bout de la planète.


C'est ici que j'ai besoin de vous. 

Car c'est totalement faux que l'on est  impuissant face à ça. Non, c'est vrai, on ne pourra pas sauver le monde entier d'un coup, mais on peut aider à petit échelle, concrètement, une communauté dans le besoin.

               

Je me propose comme lien direct pour déposer les fonds à Kopila Kunwar, une femme formidable, maman et directrice de l'orphelinat. ***TOUS les fonds iront ENTIÈREMENT pour aider l'orphelinat à se reconstruire, avoir de la nourriture pour les 16 enfants, des couvertures et du linge chaud, et ira directement dans le compte en banque de l'orphelinat.


Gang, on peut vraiment faire une différence!!! Même un 2$ canadien au Népal a de la valeur.
Merci tellement pour votre aide! 
Je vous aime.
Rosalie Bea
rosalie.tremblay@hotmail.com


Photos des petits poupous.

story:
Short Summary

Who we are: 

Carely Rae

Passionate about assisting today’s youth in establishing self-sufficient, sustainable lifescapes, Carley Rae believes in fostering dynamic and progressive environments that grant challenging opportunities for individuals to excel in all aspects of whole being growth.

Zach Morris 

Creating opportunities for interactive education, Zach believes in student-centered learning through inquiry driven, project-based exploration. His practice is steeped in sustainable educational models from cross-cultural philosophies, and his main focus is helping students uncover the learning process using creative and critical problem-solving skills. Motivated in developing a holistic perspective through continuous education and the evolution of quality interpersonal engagement, Zach values exploration, communication, and reflection.

As the directors of Conscious Pursuits, we are committed to shifting the paradigm of education into an ecologically sound system allowing children and young adults to thrive.

Our campaign is focused on providing one-year tuition scholarships for two students attending GROW, a supportive educational life-skills opportunity with a private residential experience. This opportunity is for young women ages 18-24 who are seeking support as they build sustainable, self-sufficient lifescapes.

As a contributor to this project, you will be extending this educational opportunity to young-women who do not have the financial support or independence to afford tuition. You will be providing two students the opportunity to learn, heal, and grow, in a supportive environment that promotes whole-person education.

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign will provide one-year tuition for two students. At $42,000, Conscious Pursuits will be able to provide two students with the following opportunity: room and board, case-management, 24-hour a day on-call crisis management, and an individualized need-specific curriculum in life skills.

Contributors of $100 or more will receive Pursue Consciously MT logo wear designed by the student you support.

If this campaign does not reach its intended goal, all funds collected will be used solely for tuition scholarships awarded to students attending opportunities with Conscious Pursuits. Serving a wide demographic of students between the ages of 4-24, Conscious Pursuits provides various plans, representing various tuition costs. Regardless of how much money is raised, all money will go towards student tuition scholarships.

The Impact

GROW by Conscious Pursuits impacts transitional and at risk young adults, and aims to offer participants a diverse community experience based on acceptance, cooperation, and empathy. Today one in four students age 18-25 report feelings of hopelessness and depression. Donations support promising young adults who are of bright intelligence with average to superior IQ, and a desire to succeed as individuals contributing to their communities so that all thrive harmoniously. Many are artistic, highly personable, and struggled to learn in traditional, academic settings. These young adults may have gaps in education. The Growth Process helps them master their own learning style, and explore their goals and ambitions. Many share similar experiences and are between the ages of 18-24. Some may have fallen behind, perhaps due to failure of school, drug and alcohol use, mental health problems, identity issues, body image issues, breakup, loss, or trauma. Their unfolding was interrupted somewhere along their developmental path. Our applicants frequently need help as they have no primary support system in place. With your donation young person who would otherwise be at risk for homelessness and morbidity can know success with commitment and effort in GROW’s Life skills classroom and safe, respectful, non-institutional, private residence.

A scholarship with Conscious Pursuits provides students with resources and opportunities to succeed.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help. Please visit our website at ConsciousPursuitsMT.com and click around to see what we offer. We ask you to tell everyone you know about this opportunity, get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Please promote our cause even if you cannot contribute a dollar amount, and use the Indiegogo share tools!

We look forward to the opportunity to help kids of all ages Learn Heal and Grow!

His practice is steeped in sustainable educational models from cross-cultural philosophies, and his main focus is helping students uncover the learning process using creative and critical problem-solving skills.
