story:
The Mythgard Academy

The Mythgard Insittute was founded in 2011 as a new online academic center dedicated to promoting the study of imaginative literature and making academic resources more available to fantasy and science fiction fans around the world.  In the last two years, we have established a Master's degree program in literature and language with a concentration in imaginative literature and Tolkien studies, building an innovative, interactive online classroom that has made it possible for hundreds of students to study with world-renowned scholars.

This summer, Mythgard is launching a new program, the Mythgard Academy, through which we hope to make in-depth discussion of people's favorite works of fantasy and science fiction literature free and open to everyone.  The Mythgard Academy program will feature live discussions with Mythgard Institute faculty to which all are invited, free of charge.  Recordings of our sessions will be freely available after class, and we will let our supporters decide what books we read.  

Our Campaign Goals

In order to make Mythgard Academy classes numerous, diverse, and free to everyone, we need your support!  Organizing, hosting, and running courses takes a lot of resources and a dedicated team of people, and we want the Mythgard Academy courses to be something that we can offer consistently for months and years to come. 

In the 2013-2014 academic year, we will offer a class session for every $500 that we raise in this campaign.  If we hit our $10,000 goal, we will be able to offer 20 class sessions, either in one long course or in a series of shorter courses (whatever our supporters decide).  If we raise $20,000, we can offer 40 class sessions, allowing for a series of courses throughout the year.  Would you like to walk through the Chronicles of Narnia in 21 in-depth class sessions?  Interested in embarking on a study of The History of Middle-earth together, in 10 class sessions per volume?  How about a 6-session class on Frank Herbert's Dune, or perhaps Richard Adams's Watership Down?  Maybe a 24-session journey through the Harry Potter series, or a 13-session trip through Jim Butcher's Dresden Files?  What about a 5-session reading of Tolkien's newly-released Fall of Arthur, or even a 20-session course in which we read the medieval Arthurian legends that inspired Tolkien?  The possibilities are infinite, and we will leave the choice entirely up to you, our supporters.

Power to the People

Everyone will be invited to participate in our Mythgard Academy courses, but the decisions about which courses we offer will be left to our funders.  Everyone who pledges at least $25 to our campaign will receive at least one vote when we hold the election for which courses will be offered next.  And the more you donate, the more often you can vote!  Those who pledge $100 or more will be appointed to the Council of the Wise, the group in charge of nominating and deciding on the slate of finalists brought to the funders as a whole for the vote.  Can't afford to donate?  Help us spread the word!  The more support we get, the more free classes we can run.

Promoting the Study of Fantasy and Science Fiction

Any money raised in this campaign that does not go directly to the funding of the Mythgard Academy courses will be used to support the Mythgard Institute's larger vision of creatiing an inclusive academic community for the serious study of imaginative literature.  In addition to continuing to build our Master's degree program, we will also use extra funds to expand Mythmoot, our new annual conference for fans and scholars.  With enough support, we can also move ahead on many other planned Mythgard initiatives, such as hosting scholarly journals, encouraging creative writing, and making more academic resources available to the public.  We would also love to launch a series of talks and discussions by well-known authors, artists, filmmakers, and scholars.  

Thanks for your support of the Mythgard Institute, and we look forward to seeing you in class!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Kaitlin Zardetto-Smith, I am currently a Junior History and Vocal Performance double-major at Nebraska Wesleyan University (NWU), aside from my busy class schedule (which regularly exceeds 18 credit hrs), I am a member of Alpha Gamma Delta Sorority, my university's Emmy-nominated Choir, a tuba player for my university's Symphonic Band, which last year was specifically asked to play for the D-Day Anniversary on Omaha Beach in France (which I participated in), History Club, volunteer for Nebraska History Days held at NWu, and I also act a NWU Peer Assistant (commonly known as RAs at other schools) and maintain safety and resident hall living standards while actively creating community. 

As I approach my senior year, with graduation quickly approaching behind it, in this economy an internship is a key necessity to enter any field successfully, or in hopes of having the upper-hand when it comes to Graduate School applications, so that is why I created this site! I was recently accepted into Jefferson's Monticello Archaeology Field School, this program is offered through the University of Virginia, which is a top 20 University in the U.S. currently. 

History is an ever changing and ever expanding field, the study of the past, is in turn the study of the future as well. The pattern which societies, rulers, regimes, countries, cities, villages all go through can be seen as a repeating occurence throughout the massive timeline of history! By supporting my internship, you will be actively supporting the future of American history and the active desire to discover more about one of America's greatest founder fathers, Thomas Jefferson!! How could you say no?! Jefferson was a very private man, he kept to himself and there is still so much that modern historians have to discover about him, and the way he lived during his time at Monticello- I want to be a part of this once in a lifetime opportunity more than words could begin to express. This is your chance to help!

What We Need & What You Get

Tuition for the program is $2,325 and includes housing expenses with the University, wonderful academic guest lectures from some of the best professors in their fields currently, and all the experience which I would gain in learning more about the field which I love! The program is, of course in Virginia, and I am from Nebraska, which is why my goal amount is higher than just the tuition cost, so that I am able to have the travel expense I will need in order to get from here to there. 

My passion for history can only be explained by telling you that I, Kaitlin, am a true history nerd. My favorite part of the history classes I get to take at NWU are the research papers. There is nothing I love more than packing my backpack for a full day of research at my university's library. I love discovering the story behind the story! Discovering all the different accounts of one event, reading about a person from history (like Jefferson) from a book, for me makes that person come alive. My imagination begins to reconstruct everything that person had experience and my mind easily runs through the different angles of how I, as a historian can best approach the topic which I am researching or studying. 

If I end up not reaching my goal to get the amount to pay for this wonderful internship entirely, I will still use any and all funds to pay for the program and my supplies, such as cargo pants (necessary for woodland field work), hand tools needed, travel expenses, and books for the actual course research section of the program. Any and all help is very gratefully appreciated beyond words!

Other Ways You Can Help

Believe me, with the way the current economy is going I understand that some people who may really want to contribute, just can't afford to financially right now. If you are one of those people who believe in this internship as much as I do, please spread the word to your co-workers, your boss, maybe a local philanthropist you know who does a lot for young scholars, or history, or anything similar, and please direct them to my page so that they can read and learn all about this fantastic chance to help one history major nerd's dreams come true!

If you would like to share this page, Indiegogo does have a "share" option link you can click in order to send it on to others, if you believe that you know someone who might  be interested in supporting my travels to Monticello, please share this with them. 

Thank you for taking the time to read all about this wonderful internship opportunity I have been offered and I hope you decide to donate any amount you can spare. It will be greatly appreciated!

story:
My Pledge

My life is dedicated to assisting others in the community and the world.  I am passionate about making a difference in the world and I need your help to make this happen.

My name is Troy Lum and I provide leadership development coaching to individuals and organizations.  I have a powerful story to tell about my life that will guide today's youth in making positive choices.  I need your help to make this story reach 1000's of youth and get this information to your community.

Throughout my life I have noticed the change in how high school youth communicate with their parents.  We need to bring families back to reality and change the behaviors of the youth by ending school bullying and school shootings.

With this campaign, I will perform motivational presentations to high school youth as well as a presentation for parents and teachers.  Each location will also receive programing materials to continue the program at their location.

This requires at least one parent for each youth to meet weekly and learn positive leadership skills along with their son or daughter.  Parents are required to participate each week!  They will also work on a monthly community project to impact others in their community.

This program is so important to me because with your help, we will be impacting the community and developing a program that will role out to many more communities around the world.

With $10,000 we will make a difference in 1000's of youth but with additional funding we will impact the world for many years to come.  You will have the privilege of saying you were one of the founding contributors to this life changing program.

What We Need & What You Get

The funding we receive will start the program and ensure the success for the future.  Once the funds are raised, this program I have set the basic needs to get the program started.

To get the program going, we need $10,000 minimum.

  • Development of program materials (CD's and publication)
  • Printing costs
  • Webpage fees and design
  • Meeting space rental

You will be a lifetime recognition as a founding contributor to this program and we will provide you with some great perks listed to the right.  As a top contributor, you will receive the first edition of the Lead the Change t-shirt!

If we do not reach out goal immediatly, we will still passionate to proceed with the program but will be unable to impacte as many youth and communities.  The more funding we get, the larger impact will be provided to the community!

The Impact

The impact of your contribution will be felt for many years as you will be impacting a family and a community.  

  • This will impact youth/parent communication.
  • This will help address and decrease youth depression.
  • This will provide peer leadership in the schools.
  • This will help fight bullying.
  • This will build a strong community network.
  • The program will create empowered youth leaders while they also give back to their community for many years.
  • And a lot more!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Please pass this information on to your friends, colleagues and social media network.
  • If you are not able to contribute financially but would like to make a difference, please contact me as a possible volunteer.

HELP US MAKE A DIFFERENCE IN THE COMMUNITY AND IN THE WORLD!

Thank you!

story: Hello, we are the new member class of Epsilon Zeta. We are a group of 8 college girls with the same goal to one day see a breast cancer free world. We are raising funds for one of our national organizations, breast cancer. We are asking you to please help us meet our goal. No woman or man should fear hearing the words "You have breast cancer". Breast cancer is a prevalent health issue that has touched many peoples lives. Please join us in the fight against breast cancer, any contributions help.

story:
$4 FOR THE FUTURE

We have only a few days left. The program has started and is doing wonderful things. Please check the many updates we added.

So far we raised enough for supplies, but I still need to be able to pay all of the artists. Any amount is appreciated. At this point I can forgo my artist's fees and a small stipend for program director. But please help us raise enough to pay the artists.  If we can get to $1,250 I will be very very happy!


Hello, my name is Pamela Marquis. Three years ago, I came home to New Orleans with a brand new Masters of Social Work in hand and a deep desire to make a positive difference in this charming yet challenged city.

 

I recently started the non-profit organization, Shine A Light Louisiana. Our first program is an arts program for detained youth in the New Orleans Youth Study Center. The center has the chartered responsibility of providing secure detention to youth ages 8-16 who have been arrested and are in pre-trial status. For many of these youth it will be the first time they will experience being locked up; we’d like to be a part of a strategy that makes it their last.

 

The program will expose the youth to some of the ways the arts can help them express their feelings.

 

The pilot program will connect the youth with professional artists: a spoken word artist, who will help them talk about their incarceration and create a poem/rap. Next, a visual artist will help them create images to complement their poems; then a drummer will come in to help them add the beat.  Our artists include: Luther Gray with Bamboula 2000, Chris Clark and Kataalyst Alcindor.

 

Professional journalists will also write strength profiles of each youth that will highlight his/her dreams, goals and successes. Each youth will also have a portrait taken by Thom Bennett, an award-winning photographer.

 

The finished project is professionally designed profiles on the youth and a video shot by the youth that includes the final performances of their work and interviews of the youth, by the youth, about their experience.


The Impact

Research shows time spent in confinement can increase the odds of negative adult outcomes for youth by jump-starting a spiral of failure that often becomes impossible to escape. Far too often, incarceration serves as a trip wire for long-term criminal involvement and future failure.

We know this is a critical time. Youth need the tools to help them articulate their fears, express their feelings and begin the dialogue they desperately need to begin. Will they choose to change their lives and how will they choose to do it?

Certainly their lives are complicated, and one thing will not provide the quick and final fix, but we believe, and the research supports the claim, that the arts can be tremendously helpful in changing lives in positive ways. 

Youth can begin to express themselves through the arts thus gaining a deeper understanding of the issues contributing to their crime and delinquency. The arts also provide rich opportunities for personal growth.

And if that weren't reason enough--research proves that offering arts programs significantly reduces violent incidents within the facility.


What We Need & What You Get

The $2000 will pay all the expenses of this two-week program. It will pay the professional artists, which include a spoken word artist, visual artist, drummer, photographer, videographer, editor and a graphic design artist. It will also allow us to purchase art and video supplies and offer a stipend to a program director.


This program already has great support and a number of people who want it to succeed. I am hoping this platform will make it easy for everyone who wants to be a part of this program to help the program take flight. This is our first step to offering this program on an ongoing basis at Y.S.C. and facilitating it at other institutions.


$4 FOR THE FUTURE

If every one of my Facebook friends gave just $4.00, we'd make our goal. I certainly know money is tight; most of my friends are artists or social workers. But $4.00 that's a cappuccino, a Big Mac or a glass of house wine. You can give $4 for the Future!

I truly believe in this project and the good that it will do.



Getting this project off the ground while doing our evaluation along the way will position us to turn this into an ongoing program that I know will have a positive impact on these youth.  


If you itemize deductions on your tax return, we will send you the necessary paperwork. Just mention you need it and we will get your address and send a letter your way.


If you wallet is as empty as mine, I truly understand, but please at least post this and send to people who you believe might donate.

need the tools to help them articulate their fears, express their feelings and
begin the dialogue they desperately need to begin. Will they choose to change
their lives and how will they choose to do it? 
Certainly
their lives are complicated, and one thing will not provide the quick and final
fix, but we believe, and the research supports the claim, that the arts can be
tremendously helpful in changing lives in positive ways.  
Youth
can begin to express themselves through the arts thus gaining a deeper
understanding of the issues contributing to their crime and delinquency. The
arts also provide rich opportunities for personal growth. 
And if that weren't
reason enough--research proves that offering arts programs significantly
reduces violent incidents within the facility.


What We Need & What You Get


The $2000 will pay all the expenses
of this two-week program. It will pay the professional artists, which include a
spoken word artist, visual artist, drummer, photographer, videographer, editor and a
graphic design artist. It will also allow us to purchase art and video
supplies and offer a stipend to a program director.

 This program already has great support and a number of people who
want it to succeed. I am hoping this platform will make it easy for everyone
who wants to be a part of this program to help the program take flight. This is our first step to offering this program on an ongoing basis at Y.S.C. and facilitating it at other institutions. 


$4 FOR THE FUTURE
If every one of my Facebook friends gave just $4.00, we'd make our
goal. I certainly know money is tight; most of my friends are artists or social
workers. But $4.00 that's a cappuccino, a Big Mac or a glass of house wine. You can give $4 for the Future!
I truly believe in this project and the good that it will do.


Getting
this project off the ground while doing our evaluation along the way will
position us to turn this into an ongoing program that I know will have a
positive impact on these youth.  

If
you itemize deductions on your tax return, we will send you the necessary
paperwork. Just mention you need it and we will get your address and send a
letter your way.

If
you wallet is as empty as mine, I truly understand, but please at least post this and
send to people who you believe might donate.

story:
The Opportunity

“By participating in the Show Me Costa Rica project, I see an opportunity to break the cycle in my family, giving me the chance to travel internationally, experience a different culture, study foreign ways of life, and strengthen my educational background.” – Septisha Riley, Show Me Costa Rica Participant 

The Show Me Costa Rica project aims to provide an international learning experience focused on biology-related excursions for twelve students.  Students enrolled in highest-need schools often have limited opportunities to reach beyond their situations. Despite this reality, our students have a once in a lifetime opportunity to step out of their comfort zone and challenge themselves to expand their worldview as a participant of this special project. Show Me Costa Rica offers students the opportunity to explore beyond their own community by gaining cross-cultural immersion and understanding. Additionally, students will study different forms of life first-hand that cannot be found in the United States. For a group of determined students, it is hard to imagine a more exciting opportunity to engage in experiential learning while developing a deeper understanding of themselves and their goals in an international landscape. 

 

The Students

The participants of Show Me Costa Rica include sophomores, juniors, and seniors in inner city St. Louis with big dreams who are limited with a lack of financial resources. Participant Brionne Harris writes, “My goal is to become a pediatric nurse...my job description will involve interacting with many people of different backgrounds and origins – I will gain exposure to people of a new culture and an extraordinary biology learning opportunity that will give me a meaningful experience to help prepare me for my future.” 

Please read the attached brochure to find out more information about the dreams and goals of each student!

 

The Fundraising Goal

The Projected Costs: $2,300 per student. Please help us raise $10,000 toward our total trip goal of $27,600!

We have an extensive fundraising plan and we would like to raise $10,000 of the total money through IndieGoGo. The $2,300 per student includes: Round trip flights (coach), three meals a day (does not include soda/dessert), on-tour transportation, full time tour director, all-inclusive insurance (lost bags/delayed flights), eight overnight stays in budget hotels, comprehensive sightseeing of natural attractions, entrance to Tortuguero canals boat ride, hot springs, Lake Arenal kayaking, La Fortuna Waterfall, and Rincon de la Vieja National Park.

The participants of Show Me Costa Rica are intelligent and hardworking student leaders who attend Vashon High School. The students were selected through an application and interview process. Based on their environment and social circumstances, these students are what the society considers “at-risk” – at-risk of having babies as teenagers; at-risk of never finishing high school or achieving their dreams; at-risk of never knowing the world beyond their neighborhood. We beg to differ! These twelve students are “at-promise” – at-promise of overcoming obstacles and achieving their dreams; at-promise to become the first in their families to graduate from college; at-promise for expanding their worldview beyond their neighborhood.

The Support

Ms. Lurie is a fifth-year teacher at an inner-city high school located in St. Louis. She graduated from Earlham College where she had the opportunity to travel and study abroad in Israel, Senegal, and Spain. She is passionate about providing her students the opportunity to benefit from international travel in the same way she did. She is committed to broadening her student’s horizons outside of their own community while helping them reach their goals on a larger scale.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out about our project by sending this campaign to people that you know. We would greatly appreciate it! Also, if you have any opportunities for our students to work to earn money for the trip, they are totally willing to work to raise the money!

story:
snake, rabbit, and snail is a bookmobile that will be selling used children's books and accepting books for trade.  my main goal, however, is to provide books to children from all walks of life.  i will also be hosting free events such as story time, plays, puppet shows, carnivals, variety shows, etc.  this has been my dream for three years now and i have just received a small grant to help me out, but i still need more money.  any money i receive will go toward the purchase of books to stock the bookmobile, the shelving/construction/painting, and any repairs that may need to be done to the vehicle i buy.  i am currently trying to find something on craigslist and given my financial situation, will probably be an older vehicle.  i'm not doing this to become rich, i'm doing it because i want to work for myself and because i am not rich and know how difficult it is, as a parent to afford to buy books for a child.  and i truly believe that a child needs to own their own books.  the library is awesome, but there is nothing like having a book that you keep forever, or at least until you grow tired of it.  i've never owned my own business and am currently enrolling myself in different classes to help me learn how.  any help you could give will be greatly appreciated.  and once the bookmobile is on the road, maybe it will come to your neighborhood!!!!  one more thing, i'm doing this thing for profit because i need to make some money to support myself and my child.  i swear i'm not greedy.  p.s.  i'm still trying to think of perks.  i don't have much to give except for books.  

p.s.s.  i will also, gladly, accept any children's book donations.

story:
Short Summary

DIVAS For Social Justice, a Bedford Stuyvesant based non-profit organization catering to young women in underprivileged communities, has assembled a team of youth—ages 7 through 9—to build and program a Lego Mindstorm Robot that will address social inequities in underserved communities.

Andrea Taylor, Pace University Professor and creator of the Divas For Social Justice Robotics teams, says the program is designed to encourage young people in underserved communities to pursue careers in Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM) while using technology towards social change.“Currently, non-white college students are less likely to obtain a bachelor’s degree than white students and in the STEM degree programs, this gap is even wider,” says Taylor.  “The basis for this disparity is largely due to economic factors and academic preparation.”  DIVAS is also interested in intergrating the STEAM into STEM which is incorporating the arts because creativity and technology are necessary for innovation

What We Need & What You Get

DIVAS needs funding for the robotics program for the following items:MORE ROBOTS- We currently only have one robot! The kit is about $400 for one and we need at least two more to continue programming.
COMPUTERS DEDICATED TO ROBOTICS- We are currently utilizing to old mac books to teach the programming. If we had computers specifically for robotics we could serve more youth.
TRAVEL EXPENSES & FEES for placing in competitions- We need to be able to pay the filing fees for teams to enter the competitions as well as traveling expenses.
 ADDITIONAL ROBOTICS ACCESSORIES- So we can have the best robots ever to be a change agent for underserved communities

The Impact

There is a dire need for STEM programming in communities of color. Only 1 out of 10 people of color is involved in STEM careers and your contribution could help launch the interest of our future innovators in creating green jobs and having a more sustainable and just world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
  • PLEASE SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN WITH AT LEAST TEN PEOPLE YOU KNOW
  • IF YOU CAN DONATE EQUIPMENT, THAT'S GREAT TOO!!!!!!!
  • Feel free to learn more about us at: http://www.divasforsocialjustice.org

story:
LOVE FOR LOCKLIGHT is an emergency relief fund for our friend, engineering student Angel Ureña, who had his school books, laptop, pro tools rig, hard drives, projects, and other important personal effects stolen last week. 

Angel--or as we lovingly call him, "Leonard Locklight"--is a humble, hardworking dude putting himself through school for audio engineering here in Los Angeles. He is a 'starving student', essentially living out of a backpack that was stolen at a gig on August 2nd, 2012. He's in desperate need of a replacement computer, drives, software, and new books (he can't work or continue his studies without them). He also needs a few basic essentials like clothes and a new backpack.

To the thieves, it was easy loot. To our buddy, it's devastating. Anyone who knows Angel, knows that he is a wonderful human who gives his all to the team. This is our chance to give back. We can't replace some of the things he lost, but we can definitely help him get back on his feet!

Please contribute whatever you can right now. This is an emergency relief effort (not to mention that there is a processing period to collect the money we raise) -- our window of time for raising funds is short!

Show your Love For Locklight today!

THANK YOU SO MUCH.

 

With gratitude,
Team Locklight

* Please note: We're happy to receive direct donations if you do not wish to pay by credit card or PayPal. We're also asking that anyone at the 8/2/12 gig at Formosa Cafe who might have seen something, come forward.

If you'd like to contribute a physical item, or want to purchase something specific like a book, software, etc., we will accept that in lieu of cash donation. Please email AE @ SPRWHRT@gmail.com for more info, questions, etc.

story:
Short Summary

Sondé, her 2 young children, and her dog are staying in a motel temporarily.

We are trying to get her into a new home and we could use your help. So far, her entire paycheck is being used to cover the cost of the temporary lodging and unless we can help her out with the costs for move in, she will have to return to Atlanta. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for enough to supplement her in covering the first month and security deposit for a new place if possible, but anything helps!

You get the satisfaction of keeping an awesome member of the team employed, and helping a family find a place to live.

The Impact

Sondé is 1/8th of our new Team and has become a major resource for her colleagues. She wants nothing more than to stay in Denver, her life is falling into place here, this is where she wants to raise her children, and it would be hard to go back to Atlanta. 

Risks & Challenges

This is a tall order, there are many associated expenses with Sondé staying in Denver, with your help we can make it happen. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help

If you know any property owners that would consider taking her in as a tenant that you can suggest, that would be amazing.

story:
I am Solar Man. My passion is to help people all over the world live a comfortable yet sustainable life through the use of my inventions.

I am introducing the Lotus Awning, a light weight carbon fiber composite solar panel that runs a coolant through carbon fiber tubes. Cool panels  give you more electricity and collect heat to give you hot water. It is not grid tied so you don't need utility approval. If you add battery storage of electricity, you can save electricity when the sun is not shining. Better, you can save the day when natural disaster strikes. Think Super Storm Sandy!

The Lotus Awning is beautiful and economical, easy to install, and requires no expensive rooftop improvements.  The US government gives you a 30% tax credit and your utility company may give you a hot water rebate. In Arizona, you have an additional 25% tax credit for up to $1000. For a 6 panel system, your out of pocket cost can be as low as $1000 for about 2KW of electricity plus another 2KW of heat for hot water. Solar Awning pays for itself in less than three years!


We also produce a Lotus Survivor that gives you 100W of solar electricity and another 100W of solar hot water. Weighing only 5 pounds, don't leave home without the Lotus Survivor!

Let's Build the Solar Wonderland!

We have a pent up demand for the Lotus Awning. We came up with the idea of building a Solar Wonderland where solar panels are built besides an energy amusement park about solar power and the Physics of energy.

Why do we want to build a Solar Wonderland? First, to meet your demand for our carbon fiber panels, we are designing a low cost Giga-factory to build these panels. Second, the factory is going to create jobs, hundreds in manufacturing and thousands in the installation and services supported. Third, the energy amusement park can teach our students about the Physics of energy. Fourth, you can also donate solar panels to US veterans so that they can enjoy free solar electricity and hot water. 

The Circle of Energy and the Lotus Beer Garden at SkySong:

We start with building a 4000 square foot factory floor at SkySong, the head quarter of our company Monarch Power Corp. The factory can produce up to 20MW of solar panels each year. We plan to hire up to 20 people this year.  

We also plan to open an exhibit called the Circle of Energy by early next year. The exhibit hall covers a floor space of 4000 square feet. There you enjoy a 3D video called "What's the Matter with Energy?" that explains solar power in terms of the relationship among matter, energy, space and time; all in the context from the Big Bang till the birth of our sun.


After the 15 minute video, you can wander through 10 holographic stations, where Solar Man explains 10 forms of energy including the 5 forces of nature: Electric, Magnetic, Gravitation, Weak and Strong, as well as the 5 other kinds of energy we experience: Motion, Heat, Pressure, Chemical, and Light.

Behind each multimedia holographic display, we have hands on experiments to illustrate how one kind of energy can be converted into another kind of energy.

The Solar Wonderland has a shop for buying solar products, for example the Solar Man Grill. You can also have a cool beer and hot solar cooked food at our Lotus Beer Garden, a 2000 square foot indoor and outdoor space that features our products the Lotus Mobile, Lotus Heat, Lotus Max, Lotus Ice, and the Lotus Water Chair.

Solar Wonderland at the Odyssey of the Desert:

We are going to lease a 5 plus acre land from the Pima native tribes to build a full size Solar Wonderland. We have designed an 80 foot tall Solar Pyramid topped with a Golden Sun made to rise by solar heated air.

The ground floor is a 40,000 square foot factory that can house up to 6 production lines each with annual production capacity of 200MW of solar panels. The production facility will hire about 100 workers. The marketing, sales, installation, service, and applications of the Lotus line of products will create thousands of jobs.

Connecting the parking structure to the plaza on the second floor of the pyramid is a ride called "Maglev Back to the Future". Inside the pyramid, the second floor houses three thrilling rides: "Doctor Frankenstein in the Tesla Tower", "Alice in the Optics Wonderland", and "The Heat is On". 

At the center of the second floor is a 3D theater showing the movie "What's the Matter with Energy". On top of the theater on the third floor is the Circle of Energy exhibit. The third floor also is the launch pad of a free fall ride called "Gravity".

The 40,000 square foot base of the Pyramid faces an 80,000 square foot Lotus Garden that has a Lotus Pond, a Lotus Beer Garden, and an extra pay ride called "Electric Car Grand Prix". Surrounding the Lotus Garden is the Solar Bazaar where renewable energy products are demonstrated and sold. 

Please Donate to Build Solar Wonderland.

Your reward is great. You can prepay tickets for the "Circle of Energy" Exhibit or the Solar Wonderland.  You can buy our cool products that give you comfort and  save the environment. You help create thousands of jobs. You help our students understand solar power and energy. You can help US veterans with clean and abundant solar power. You can also donate a solar panel with your name inscribed on the Solar Pyramid.

About Joe Hui, Solar Man

Dr. Joe Hui got his BS, MS, and PhD degrees from MIT, all in 6 years. Since then he has taught at Columbia University, Rutgers University, Chinese University of Hong Kong, and during the past 15 years holds the ISS Chair Professor of Electrical, Computer and Energy Engineering at Arizona State University.

He is a prolific inventor with 40 issued or pending patents. He is now working on solar photovoltaic systems using carbon fiber panels that track the sun and fold in strong wind. His proud inventions include solar desalination of water, solar heat engines and heat pumps using supercritical carbon dioxide, concentrated solar thermal generation of hydrogen for a fuel cell electric car, and a revolutionary turbine for solar or natural gas generated heat.

His passion includes also making Physics and Electrical Engineering fun for students. He makes 3D and holographic multimedia presentations that explain energy in a dramatic manner. He understands that students need exciting rides to impress upon them the various forces of nature. Solar Wonderland is also a museum to explain his many inventions that help mankind live a comfortable life.

He has received many awards, including the best paper award from IEEE, the IEEE Fellow, the Presidential Young Investigator Award from President G. H. Bush, and the Innovation of the Year Award for his Lotus products from the Arizona Chamber of Commerce and Industry.

About the Lotus Awning
Here is a description of the Lotus Awning solar panel:

Here is the specification of the Lotus Awning solar panel

About the Lotus Survivor
Here is a description of the Lotus Survivor solar panel:

Here is the technical specification of the panel:

Wonderland at the Odyssey of the Desert: We are going to
lease a 5 plus acre land from the Pima native tribes to build a full size Solar
Wonderland. We have designed an 80 foot tall Solar Pyramid topped with a
Golden Sun made to rise by solar heated air. The ground floor is a 40,000
square foot factory that can house up to 6 production lines each with annual
production capacity of 200MW of solar panels. The production facility will hire
about 100 workers. The marketing, sales, installation, service, and applications of the Lotus line of products will create thousands of jobs.Connecting the parking structure to the plaza on the second floor of the pyramid is a ride
called "Maglev Back to the Future". Inside the pyramid, the second floor houses three
thrilling rides: "Doctor Frankenstein in the Tesla Tower",
"Alice in the Optics Wonderland", and "The Heat is On". At the center of the second floor is a 3D theater showing the movie "What's the Matter with Energy". On top of the theater on the third floor is the Circle of Energy exhibit. The
third floor also is the launch pad of a free fall ride called
"Gravity". 
The
40,000 square foot base of the Pyramid faces an 80,000 square foot Lotus Garden that
has a Lotus Pond, a Lotus Beer Garden, and an extra pay ride called
"Electric Car Grand Prix". Surrounding the Lotus Garden is the Solar
Bazaar where renewable energy products are demonstrated and sold. 
Please Donate to
Build Solar Wonderland.
Your reward is great. You can prepay tickets for the "Circle of Energy" Exhibit or the Solar Wonderland.  You can buy our cool products that give you comfort and  save the
environment. You help create thousands of jobs. You help our students
understand solar power and energy. You can help US veterans with clean and abundant
solar power. You can also donate a solar panel with your name inscribed on the Solar Pyramid. 
About Joe Hui, Solar Man

Dr. Joe Hui got his BS, MS, and PhD degrees from MIT, all in 6 years. Since then he has taught at Columbia University, Rutgers University, Chinese University of Hong Kong, and during the past 15 years holds the ISS Chair Professor of Electrical, Computer and Energy Engineering at Arizona State University. He is a prolific inventor with 40 issued or pending patents. He is now working on solar photovoltaic systems using carbon fiber panels that track the sun and fold in strong wind. His proud inventions include solar desalination of water, solar heat engines and heat pumps using supercritical carbon dioxide, concentrated solar thermal generation of hydrogen for a fuel cell electric car, and a revolutionary turbine for solar or natural gas generated heat. His passion includes also making Physics and Electrical Engineering fun for students. He makes 3D and holographic multimedia presentations that explain energy in a dramatic manner. He understands that students need exciting rides to impress upon them the various forces of nature. Solar Wonderland is also a museum to explain his many inventions that help mankind live a comfortable life. He has received many awards, including the best paper award from IEEE, the IEEE Fellow, the Presidential Young Investigator Award from President G. H. Bush, and the Innovation of the Year Award for his Lotus products from the Arizona Chamber of Commerce and Industry. About the Lotus AwningHere is a description of the Lotus Awning solar panel:Here is the specification of the Lotus Awning solar panelAbout the Lotus SurvivorHere is a description of the Lotus Survivor solar panel:Here is the technical specification of the panel:

story:
Welcome to The Brooklyn Waldorf School’s 8th Grade Culmination Trip To Iceland Project.

Every year the graduating 8th grade class celebrates the conclusion of their elementary school years with a special trip that expresses the students’ educational and personal growth, and reflects upon specific topics covered in the curriculum. The trip is a springboard for deeper understanding of what the students have learned and their responsibility to it. Waldorf Education is a rare pedagogy that nurtures the individual. It asks the student  not just to go to the next step but rather to come up with what is the next step and how one should reach it. To this end, this year’s 8th grade students are determined to explore the land of fire and ice; Iceland.

Why Iceland? During their time at the Brooklyn Waldorf School the class has studied subjects ranging from Norse Mythology to Earth Sciences, including Climate, Geology and Physiology.  They focus on these subjects for extended weeks at a time in a “Main Lesson” block.  At the end of this block they produce their own handwritten and illustrated textbook on the subject.  Waldorf Education is about learning not only through your head but also through your hands and heart. Traveling to Iceland and experiencing its rugged yet fragile environment will give the students an opportunity to experience a place that reflects the reality and legacy of these topics. 

This will be a practical and metaphoric journey. Iceland is geologically young and always in a state of change. These qualities, along with its simultaneous fragility and potential volatility reflect the adolescent state of mind.

The students will be able to feel the geological pulse that defines the island, observe the weather at its most primal, and walk in the space between the North American and Eurasian tectonic plates: the site where the mid-Atlantic ridge rises from the sea and makes the earth’s inner workings over millions of years visible in our own time. They will gain a direct sense of the history of the people of Iceland, have a visceral experience of the climate and gain a new understanding of the micro and macro environment. A profound appreciation of time will be revealed through living for a few days under the midnight sun. 

Also critical to Waldorf Education is the power of creating beauty - whether through words, images or deeds.  These students will return from Iceland with original photographic work and recordings that will enable them to share this moving experience and inform others of the wonders and needs of both fire and ice.  They are making drawings of Icelandic landscapes as part of their study of the island and as preparation for their trip. These works comprise the rewards for donations at various levels. 

Help us realize this goal and make it possible for our 8th graders to culminate their studies with a trip that expands the curricular dimension rather than completes it. As they start to become adults these students will carry memories of Iceland’s fugitive landscape, its ancient stories and remarkable capacities for change to their future endeavors and communities. As witnesses to this evolving world, our students, in turn, will see themselves as agents of dynamic and sustainable transformation. 

Please consider contributing to our students’ project. The world needs more environmental stewards. And thanks for your consideration.

story:
Short Summary

The Central Coast Autism Spectrum Center is working to provide support and services to individuals throughout the lifetime - from early diagnosis and intervention, through pre-vocational and vocational training, to transitional services and beyond. 

Because ASD’s affect more than the individual diagnosed, CCASC provides support for parents and grandparents and offers workshops and play groups for siblings and families. Just as we aim to support families throughout their journey, CCASC provides support, training and education for professionals in our communities. Many professionals work side by side with children or adults on the spectrum, and may not know how to best serve them, or how to bring out the individuals best strengths. By providing education, training, and community outreach, CCASC can support those that work closest with those individuals affected by autism spectrum disorders.

One area we would like to raise funds is for our teens in the community. We would like to continue to offer Teen Dances throughout the year.

Watching the teens come year after year is exciting and really motivates our organization to do more. Having a regular dance is something these teens look forward to every time we hold one. 

We have music and lights with extra consideration for sensory sensitive guests. We have a quiet room with games and arts and crafts. We have a group of student volunteers to help organize, greet, dance and make friends with all dance attendees. It's a fun environment for everyone!

What We Need & What You Get

We need approximately $2,500 to put on each dance and would like to offer up four dances a year. The costs include venue, DJ, food, drinks and payroll to a dance coordinator through the center. If we do not meet our goal, we will use whatever funds we do get toward at least one dance with an anonymous matching donor. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate to this campaign, please help us get the word out using the Indiegogo share tools. Contact your local autism organization and help build more awareness. 
Thank you all!
Central Coast Autism Spectrum Center
http://www.autismspectrumcenter.com/

story:
Accessible, Challenging and Doable

The Jade Robot has been shown to be superior in not only teaching students about robotics and programming but also excite and engage them in Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (aka STEM). 

Surveys from students working with the Jade Robot, show the following successes:

  • 25%+ increase in interest in STEM as a career
  • 30%+ increase in interest in post-secondary education

What makes the Jade Robot special is the results we are seeing with girls:

  • Girls match (and often exceed) the successes of boys have with the Jade Robot
  • After working with the Jade Robot, girls' interest in STEM as a career matches boys, even though their initial interest was only one third of that of boys

These numbers are not for "gifted" or members of a robot club, we work in typical classrooms with all types of students and are changing their attitudes towards STEM.

Featured On:

You can read more about the Jade Robot here: December 2014 Servo Magazine: The Evolution of the Jade Robot

What Makes the Jade Robot Special

  • Features and capabilities only found in robots costing ten times more
    • All aspect light and object sensors
    • Spectrometer with line following capability
    • Expandable for servos, a digital camera or your own hardware
  • Ready to go right out of the box
    • Built in User Interface allows immediate use and fun!
    • Example applications already loaded in
    • Develop Programs on the Jade Robot

  • Classroom ready
    • Curriculum specific lesson plans and teaching materials available from Mimetics
    • Jade Support Development Tool Works on Windows PCs, Macs and Linux systems as well as Chromebooks!
    • Cloud based software means no more lost and forgotten assignments on USB Thumb Drives and Email
    • Rechargeable batteries, no need for stockpiling “AA” batteries
    • Rugged, reusable packaging.  Storage, protection and no waste!
  • Proudly manufactured in Canada 

Built in Jade Robot Applications 

Object Avoidance - Using the all-aspect object and ranging sensors.  

Light Following (Moth) - Follow a light, but back away when it gets too bright!

Line Following - Use the bottom sensors and LEDs to follow a line.

Reflectance Spectrometer - Using 6 different wavelengths of light, perform a spectrographic analysis of what the Surface is underneath the Jade Robot.  

Learn to Program the Jade Robot in 30 seconds 

Using the built in "Program Demo" application, you can create simple robot applications without a computer as shown in the animation below: 

Next, the "Sensor Logic" application allows you to create applications that respond to sensor inputs on the Jade Robot without a computer.

Scratch/C Programming

Installing and setting up the Jade Support Integrated Development Environment (IDE - Available Here for Chrome equipped systems) takes just a few moments:


Jade Support can be used for the development and debug of Scratch and C applications for the Jade Robot like this simple object avoidance project:


Along with being able to create your own programs, you can try out one of the hundreds of user created example applications available as "Community Projects".

What will Students be Doing with the Jade Robot?

Cross-Curriculum Learning

The Jade Robot provides practical, hands on educational opportunities in the following classroom studies:

  • Mathematics
  • Motion (Physics)
  • Mechanics with gears and wheels
  • Energy Conversion
  • Electricity and Electronics
  • Light and Optics
  • Chemistry
  • Space Exploration
  • Geology (with the reflectance spectrometer)
  • Art
  • Reading

The Jade robot also provides opportunities for children to develop "soft skills" including:

  • Teamwork
  • Problem Solving
  • Project Planning
  • Digital Literacy

Example Classroom Materials:

  • Grade 6 Classroom Materials
  • Grade 8 Classroom Materials

For students younger than high school age, we have found that a two student to one Jade Robot is the optimum ratio.

Expanding the Jade Robot

Camera/Gripper 3D printed Parts Available on Thingiverse


The next adapter we're working on is a pen holder.  With the videos currently available showing the Jade Robot drawing is accomplished by holding a Crayola Washable (very important when drawing on a floor) Marker using elastic bands.  

I2C Expansion Ports are available for adding your own sensors and hardware:

What's in the future for expansion, we have some ideas.  What do you think of a Marshmallow Shooter for the Jade Robot?

The Jade Robot Evolution


Mimetics Team

Current Funding

So far, Mimetics has received just over $300k in funding from a variety of different sources including:

  • Canadian Small Business Financing Loan
  • The Canadian Scientific Research and Experimental Research Grant
  • The Industrial Research Assistance Program

Traction

NASA Administrator Charles Bolden talking to Myke about STEM education.  

There are hundreds of Jade Robots in use throughout the world.

  • Classrooms from Grades 5 to 12
  • Universities for undergraduate education and outreach
  • Youth groups serving children from 8 to 15
  • Maker Spaces
  • Demonstrating Technology in Science Museums
  • Challenger Learning Centers for STEM Education
  • Many different homes and workshops

Mimetics News

  • Mimetics Twitter Feed
  • Mimetics Tumblr Blog
  • Mimetics YouTube Channel
  • Weekly Newsletters

Availability

We have 100 Jade Robots available for this Indiegogo campaign in various configurations including class sets as well as camera and gripper equipped Jade Robots.  Product will be shipped immediately upon the end of this campaign.    

Shipping is free within North America.  For orders elsewhere in the world, please add the appropriate shipping Perk to your order.  

What the Future Will Bring

The next production build is projected to have a late 3Q 2015 availability date.

We will continue to improve the Jade Robot and Jade Support software:

  • Integrate Bluetooth pairing into Jade Support
  • Further simplify Jade Support and make it even more intuitive to use
  • Add the ability to output musical notes from the Jade Robot
  • Create more expansion options for the Jade Robot

Along with this we will be developing (and publishing) more classroom and workshop materials and presentations.

Call to Action

Parents: Order a Jade Robot for learning at home or to be used at your child's school.  Raise funds for a class set.  

Teachers: Buy a Jade Robot for your class.  Work through the on-line teaching materials.  Promote the Jade Robot class sets to your administration and Parent Teacher Councils.  

Youth Groups: Contact Mimetics for information on how to do a Jade Robot workshop as well as how to buy robots for after-school and other programs.  

Corporations: Contact Mimetics for information on give back to your communities with Jade Robot workshops.

Frequently Asked Questions

  • How can I contact you for problems, suggestions and sales opportunities?
    • Send an email to: info@mimetics.ca 
  • When I look at the videos and animations, the Jade Robot's screen is pulsating.  Does this happen on the actual robots?
    • No.  The pulsing that you see is an artifact of the camera and the display not being synchronized.  To the human eye, the actual display doesn't appear to pulse at all
  • Where can I get ongoing information about the Jade Robot
    • See Mimetics News above
  • Why aren't there covers on the Jade Robot?
    • As part of our process for defining the product, we interviewed 200 teachers and 100% told us they wanted their students to be able to touch and experience technology directly
  • Can Jade Support be used in system that doesn't have an Internet connection?
    • No. The decision was made to only execute in a networked environment was made for two reasons. The first was to use cloud-based (GitHub) storage of user and community projects. The second was to provide storage and invisible updates of the large file processing classes
    • This decision has been questioned, but we have never encountered a situation or venue where an internet connection was not available
  • What systems have you run the programming tools on?
    • WinXP, Win7, Win8, Macs OS 10.8 and later, Linux Ubuntu 11.04 and later, Chromebooks
    • Chrome version 42 or later is required
  • Where did the survey results listed at the top of this campaign page come from?
    • The survey results come from the 12,000 surveys given to class and workshop attendees since 2001
    • Before session responses being 26% interest in STEM for boys and 9% for girls (with a combined average of 17%). These values match numerous studies done on STEM interest in children 12-14 which gives us confidence in our approach
    • After class/workshop interest in STEM shows an increase to 45-65%. For Grade 6-8 students, the post class/workshop interest is normally 60% or more. This interest declines for older students. These results also match published studies which indicate that Grades 6-8 are the optimal time to interest students in STEM
    • In all age ranges, girls interest in STEM matches boys at the end of the sessions
  • How do I get software updates for Jade Support and the Jade Robot?
    • Updates to Jade Support happen automatically. You may be prompted to restart Jade Support if they come through when you have it up and active
    • Jade Robot firmware and file system image updates will be sent out when they are available with instructions on how to carry out the update
  • How is the robot charged and can it be charged from a PC?
    • Charging is accomplished through the USB Port
    • The Jade Robot can be charged from a PC
  • What is the recommended Age range for the Jade Robot?
    • 8 Years and Up
  • How fragile is the Jade Robot?
    • The Jade Robot is very tough.  After four months of 5-12 classes per week for 16 Jade Robots, none have failed or had any hardware issues requiring repair
  • Can I control the Jade Robot remotely?
    • The Jade Robot's movements can be controlled using LG, Panasonic and Toshiba DVD IR Remote Controls
    • The Jade Robot with optional camera/gripper can be controlled via Bluetooth using "Jade Action"
  • What surfaces will the Jade Robot run on?
    • Any typical inside surfaces (including carpeting)
    • Outside operation or use on wet surfaces will void the warranty
  • What about tablet and smartphone support?
    • We will be porting Jade Support onto Android and iOS devices in the future
  • What expansion products are available?
    • Currently we have .stl files for the Camera/Gripper and Pen Holder.  We sell Jade Robots with the Camera/Gripper installed
    • We have schematics and software for an I2C digital compass interface as well as a 6 axis accelerometer
  • What other services does Mimetics offer?
    • We do workshop and classroom sessions as well as consulting and school curriculum and lesson plan development
  • Will you do children’s birthday parties?
    • We're happy to do them but be warned; we're terrible at balloon animals
  • What does it cost for Mimetics to come and do a class/workshop session?
    • We charge $15/attendee-hour plus travel expenses
  • Where do I pay for shipping?
    • Shipping is free for North American customers
    • International orders must click on the "International Shipping" and "Class Set Shipping" Perks along with the Jade Robot that you are interested in
  • What kind of Bluetooth Adapter is required?
    • Bluetooth 2.0 and later
    • NOTE: For older PCs, BT 2.0 devices have been found to work best
  • What is the Bluetooth Range?
    • We find that 10 metres in an empty space is possible
    • In practical environments, 7 metres is a good rule of thumb for a "typical" space with metal furniture and structures
  • How many Jade Robots can work in the same space?
    • We don't know.  Our current record is 22 Jade Robots in a classroom
    • Downloading programs and control operation can slow down if there are a lot of WiFi devices present but Jade Robot Bluetooth operations remain reliable

  • What kind of warranty do I get with the Jade Robot?
    • One year replacement
    • Note that the Jade Robot can only be used indoors and the warranty doesn't cover physical damage or modifications to the product
  • How long will the Jade Robot run on a full battery charge?
    • The Jade Robot was designed for a typical school day and will work for at least 7 hours in the stock configuration
    • With the camera and gripper operating, 3 hours is typical
  • How long will the Jade Robot stay in Sleep Mode on a full battery charge?
    • Two weeks
  • How many charge cycles will I get from the built in battery?
    • Unknown.  We've never had a battery lose it's charge capacity. The charger circuitry built into the Jade Robot is designed to charge the Jade Robot's battery within specified limits, not placing any undue stress on the battery
  • How long does it take to charge the battery?
    • Typically five hours from fully discharged to fully charged
  • What improvements are you planning in the future
    • See What the Future May Bring

How can I contact you for problems, suggestions and sales opportunities?



Send an email to: info@mimetics.ca 



When I look at the videos and animations, the Jade Robot's screen is pulsating.  Does this happen on the actual robots?


No.  The pulsing that you see is an artifact of the camera and the display not being synchronized.  To the human eye, the actual display doesn't appear to pulse at all



Where can I get ongoing information about the Jade Robot



See Mimetics News above



Why aren't there covers on the Jade Robot?



As part of our process for defining the product, we interviewed 200 teachers and 100% told us they wanted their students to be able to touch and experience technology directly



Can Jade Support be used in  system that doesn't have an Internet connection?



No.  The decision was made to only execute in a networked environment was made for two reasons.  The first was to use cloud-based (GitHub) storage of user and community projects.  The second was to provide storage and invisible updates of the large file processing classes


This decision has been questioned, but we have never encountered a situation or venue where an internet connection was not available



What systems have you run the programming tools on?



WinXP, Win7, Win8, Macs OS 10.8 and later, Linux Ubuntu 11.04 and later, Chromebooks


Chrome version 42 or later is required



Where did the survey results listed at the top of this campaign page come from?



The survey results come from the 12,000 surveys given to class and workshop attendees since 2001


Before session responses being 26% interest in STEM for boys and 9% for girls (with a combined average of 17%).  These values match numerous studies done on STEM interest in children 12-14 which gives us confidence in our approach


After class/workshop interest in STEM shows an increase to 45-65%.  For Grade 6-8 students, the post class/workshop interest is normally 60% or more.  This interest declines for older students.  These results also match published studies which indicate that Grades 6-8 are the optimal time to interest students in STEM


In all age ranges, girls interest in STEM matches boys at the end of the sessions



How do I get software updates for Jade Support and the Jade Robot?



Updates to Jade Support happen automatically. You may be prompted to restart Jade Support if they come through when you have it up and active
Jade Robot firmware and file system image updates will be sent out when they are available with instructions on how to carry out the update


How is the robot charged and can it be charged from a PC?



Charging is accomplished through the USB Port


The Jade Robot can be charged from a PC



What is the recommended Age range for the Jade Robot?



8 Years and Up



How fragile is the Jade Robot?



The Jade Robot is very tough.  After four months of 5-12 classes per week for 16 Jade Robots, none have failed or had any hardware issues requiring repair



Can I control the Jade Robot remotely?


The Jade Robot's movements can be controlled using LG, Panasonic and Toshiba DVD IR Remote Controls

The Jade Robot with optional camera/gripper can be controlled via Bluetooth using "Jade Action"



What surfaces will the Jade Robot run on?



Any typical inside surfaces (including carpeting)


Outside operation or use on wet surfaces will void the warranty



What about tablet and smartphone support?



We will be porting Jade Support onto Android and iOS devices in the future



What expansion products are available?



Currently we have .stl files for the Camera/Gripper and Pen Holder.  We sell Jade Robots with the Camera/Gripper installed


We have schematics and software for an I2C digital compass interface as well as a 6 axis accelerometer



What other services does Mimetics offer?



We do workshop and classroom sessions as well as consulting and school curriculum and lesson plan development



Will you do children’s birthday parties?



We're happy to do them but be warned; we're terrible at balloon animals


What does it cost for Mimetics to come and do a class/workshop session?


We charge $15/attendee-hour plus travel expenses


Where do I pay for shipping?



Shipping is free for North American customers


International orders must click on the "International Shipping" and "Class Set Shipping" Perks along with the Jade Robot that you are interested in



What kind of Bluetooth Adapter is required?



Bluetooth 2.0 and later


NOTE: For older PCs, BT 2.0 devices have been found to work best



What is the Bluetooth Range?



We find that 10 metres in an empty space is possible


In practical environments, 7 metres is a good rule of thumb for a "typical" space with metal furniture and structures



How many Jade Robots can work in the same space?



We don't know.  Our current record is 22 Jade Robots in a classroom


Downloading programs and control operation can slow down if there are a lot of WiFi devices present but Jade Robot Bluetooth operations remain reliable




What kind of warranty do I get with the Jade Robot?



One year replacement


Note that the Jade Robot can only be used indoors and the warranty doesn't cover physical damage or modifications to the product



How long will the Jade Robot run on a full battery charge?



The Jade Robot was designed for a typical school day and will work for at least 7 hours in the stock configuration


With the camera and gripper operating, 3 hours is typical



How long will the Jade Robot stay in Sleep Mode on a full battery charge?



Two weeks



How many charge cycles will I get from the built in battery?



Unknown.  We've never had a battery lose it's charge capacity.  The charger circuitry built into the Jade Robot is designed to charge the Jade Robot's battery within specified limits, not placing any undue stress on the battery



How long does it take to charge the battery?



Typically five hours from fully discharged to fully charged



What improvements are you planning in the future



See What the Future May Bring

story:
Summary

Virtual Worlds Best Practices in Education is a global grass-roots community event focusing on education in immersive virtual environments. This peer-reviewed conference is organized by educators, for educators, to provide an opportunity to showcase the learning that takes place in this community of practice. All educators are encouraged to present, attend and take part in this discussion of collaborative deeper learning and co-presence in virtual worlds and games.

This is our 8th annual conference which is only possible through generous donations from conference sponsors and the many volunteers that help put on this four day event. The conference materials are made available through our archives including the Journal of Virtual Studies (ISSN: 2155-0107), and over 100 hours of video / machinema'd materials available, for free, for educational and research purposes after each conference is over. 
Each year VWBPE attracts between 2200-3500 educational professionals from around the world. Our tracks include presentations and workshops which span the entire gambit of education from K-12 all the way through to post-graduate levels. 
See http://vwbpe.org for more details.

What We Need & What You Get

What we need is simple. Cash donations. The conference costs a minimum of $5000 each year. We are in a position that we can do more with a larger budget up to $15,000 but $5,000 is the minimum amount we need to raise to make the conference successful. This is in a large part due to a few in-kind sponsors that have been dedicated to helping this conference succeed since it first started in 2007. 

Funding goes completely (100%) to program related activities. No one involved with the organization of the conference receives a salary or stipend. Funds are used to help support our information systems, development of video and machinema archives, live video streaming, social activities, swag  bag materials for conference attendees, buildings supplies (mesh 3D objects), and graphics designs. 

VWBPE also spends a lot of time ensuring that the conference is as accessible as possible for persons with disabilities. 

The VWBPE Committee is asking for your support at one of four sponsorship levels Gold ($1500), Silver ($1000), Bronze ($500) or Blue Ribbon (any amount under $500).

Gold Sponsor ($1500 x 2)

  • Premier placement on Conference Homepage on VWBPE website with hyperlink
  • Premier placement on Sponsor Page on VWBPE website with hyperlink
  • Premier placement on Sponsor Boards throughout the venues
  • Sponsor Booth in the Poster Area (see poster guidelines on the VWBPE website)
  • Full Page ad on the Conference proceedings (inside front or inside back page - 22 x 18 cm) to be provided by the sponsor
  • 15-30 second ad spot on VWBPE live streaming of conference main channel (to be provided by the sponsor).
  • Your choice of any three swag items from VWBPE's Cafepress storefront.

Silver Sponsor ($1000 x 4)

  • Premier placement on Conference Homepage on VWBPE website with hyperlink
  • Premier placement on Sponsor Page on VWBPE website with hyperlink
  • Premier placement on Sponsor Boards throughout the venues
  • Sponsor Booth in the Poster Area (see poster guidelines on the VWBPE website)
  • 1/2 Page ad in the Conference proceedings (back pages 10.5 x 18 cm) to be provided by the sponsor
  • 5-10 second ad spot on VWBPE live streaming of conference main channel (will be created by VWBPE film and stage crew)
  • Your choice of any two swag items from VWBPE's Cafepress storefront.

Bronze Sponsor ($500 x 16)

  • Preferred placement on Sponsor Page on VWBPE website with hyperlink
  • Preferred placement on Sponsor Boards throughout the venues
  • Sponsor Booth in the Poster Area (see poster guidelines on the VWBPE website)
  • 1/4 Page ad in the Conference proceedings (back pages 10.5 x 8.5 cm) to be provided by the sponsor
  • Your choice of any swag item from VWBPE's Cafepress storefront.

Blue Ribbon Community (varying amounts over $50 and under $500)

  • Honorable mention placement on Sponsor Page on VWBPE website with hyperlink
  • General placement on Blue Ribbon Community Board in Second Life
  • LD Video Sponsor mention at least once throughout the 4 days
Note: All graphics, logos, ads, and artwork need to be print ready and submitted to VWBPE no later than February 29, 2015. 
The Impact

Your contribution makes a huge difference. Depending on how much we raise we can introduce new program elements into the conference such as live streaming of the conference on multiple video streams, full transcription of all video presentations, mobile accessibility, and more. How much we can do depends on you. 

As the 8th annual conference this event is well attended, well respected, and is at the forefront of where technology and educational practices are headed. The fact that the conference is free makes this event unique. No other educational conference in the world has this large of an attendance, this broad of a spectrum, this inclusiveness of community, and this accessible of any conference ANYWHERE. We are the vanguard and with your help we intend to continue to be so for many more years to come. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are interested in helping but cannot contribute as a conference sponsor there are many other ways that you can help. 

Submit a proposal: If you are an educator using Second Life, OpenSim, or other gaming or simulation environment and have something to contribute there will be one more opportunity to submit a proposal in early January.

Attend the conference. Its free. Come out and meet hundreds of people from around the world interested in gaming and simulation and how best to apply those techniques in the classroom.

Volunteer. This conference runs primarily off the volunteers that are dedicated to making education better. We need people who are familiar with video streaming (within a gaming environment) and editing, voice to text transcription, mentoring within Second Life or OpenSim, and other roles.

 Share with Others. Let your network know about this conference. Our primary marketing is through word of mouth. So please let people know.

story:
Dragi romani,


In ultimul an autoritatile romane nu si-au facut datoria fata de noi, fie cei din Diaspora, fie cei din Romania.

Cineva a trebuit sa intervina si sa preia multe dintre rolurile pe care oamenii platiti le-au lasat de izbeliste.

Eu am fost unul din aceia.

Intr-o oarecare masura caderea lui Corlatean mi se datoreaza, dar dansul nu a fost decat un pion de sacrificiu.

Cand am initiat primul protest impotriva discriminarii in Marea Britanie si a suspendarii studentilor romani de la finantare, acum un an de zile, nu mi-am dat seama cat de dur va fi anul ce va urma, in conditiile slabiciunii unei societati civile romanesti in UK.

Dar am perseverat si am inceput sa abordez pe rand o serie de probleme.

-  A suspendarii studentilor romani si drepturile celor internationali

-  Problema discriminarii romanilor in UK si reprezentarea comunitatii

-  Problema discriminarii cetatenilor romani de etnie roma

-  Problema stabilirii unui sistem de vot reprezentativ pentru cetatenii romani

Pentru toate astea am lasat o slujba foarte lucrativa in sistemul bancar din UK, pentru Lloyds Bank in cel mai scump oras al lumii, Londra. Dar l-am lasat datorita unei istorii personale in care si eu am lucrat ani buni in meserii grele din constructii sau chelnarie, desi cea mai grea a fost cred banca (nu stii pana nu ajungi) ca si imigrant timp de 10 ani (Spania, USA, UK). 

Am lasat-o pentru chemarea nebunilor din strada, a Rosiei Montane din Londra, care m-a politizat suficient cat sa incep sa folosesc vasta mea cunoastere a sistemului in interesul cetateanului si a organizarii comunitare a diasporei romane, pe care multi politicieni traditionali o gasesc acum ca un ghimpe in planurile lor bine pregatite.

Acum trei ani de zile am scris lucrarea mea de baza, practic un manifesto de actiune in care promovez cu putere votul electronic si imputernicirea omului dependent de sistemele ierarhice, inlocuindu-le cu un sistem egalitarian.

Scopul meu final e eliminarea sistemelor de partide existente si reformarea Europei.

Pentru aceasta trebuie sa ma finantez.

Am decis pe aceasta cale sa constitui o entitate de analiza politica, un fel de imagine institutionala pentru un singur individ care sa-mi deschida usile inchise. E un fel de think tank social, care interpeleaza creatorii de politica din domeniul public si privat in folosul cetateanului. 

Nu reprezint pe nimeni decat niste principii de eficienta sociala, desi sunt membru asociat al unui numar de organizatii (uneori fara stirea mea). Nu sunt finantat de nimeni si-mi creez agenda dupa cum cred de cuviinta, participand la intalniri la toate nivelele, incluzand Parlamentul UK si EU. 

Daca credeti ca un astfel de proiect in care eu imi torn sufletul si care deja din fondurile proprii a penetrat o structura de putere monolitica e important pentru viata voastra, va rog sa contribuiti.

Orice suma e binevenita. Daca strang 3 lire o sa-mi iau o cafea si va multumesc pentru timpul pierdut in a citi ce am scris. Daca strang 10K o sa pot sa ma finantez pentru un an de zile si sa particip la conferinte gen ThinkTwice unde se discuta democratia directa la nivel mondial si unde am fost invitat ca unul din speakeri si unde nu am putut sa reprezint interesele comunitatii si cu rabdare si legitimizarea de catre societate sa schimb incet lumea pentru romani si nu numai.

Sincer, as vrea ca sa pot sa fac asta fara finantare din orice parte, dar nu asa functioneaza lumea. Toti suntem datori cu o viata si trebuie sa platim un acoperis, mancare, bani de drum.

Pentru cine crede in campioni perfecti… ii urez noroc si-l indrum sa citeasca Magicianul lui John Fowles. Explica mai bine decat as putea eu explica vreodata umilinta aparuta din presiunea universului asupra egoului uman, cat si erorile de organizare care pot aparea.

Eu, un "neica nimeni", posedand doar legitimitatea discursului, va multumesc anticipat celor care mi-au acordat si legitimitatea multimii, prin banul greu castigat si implicit o particica din ei insisi, practic sacrificiul personal a unei vieti ca noi toti pentru imbunatatirea vietii celor multi si chiar mai umili dintre noi.

Intr-un fel tot ce am nevoie e de o plata onesta, pentru o munca onesta si deosebit de dificila care sper ca va putea continua, mai ales ca pregatesc guvernului Romaniei o surpriza.


Multumesc,

Paul Suciu, economist si analist politic

PS NGO-ul nu e formal inca, asa ca tehnic vorbind banii mi-i  dati direct mie. Pe incredere.

story:
Wouldn't it be great to be able to monitor the reading habits for your students? set homework which is automatically pushed to your class and allow your students to ask questions and share their notes? This aim of this project is to build a practical, useful educational tool for both teachers and students.

I believe that any technology that helps teachers teach more effectively and students learn more effectively is priceless.  I believe that EduReader as a platform (a specialised educational eReader and Learning Analytics Engine) can contribute valuable information to teachers and can help the teachers in the following ways:

-  predicting future student performance

-  intervene at times when students are struggling to understand or when students excel

-  personalize the learning process for each student

-  encourage improvement and playing to the students strengths in the indicated areas

-  adapt the teaching styles and also the learning styles including the use of socialization and other technologies

The eReader component of the solution allows students to create and share their notes, teachers to post questions and students to answer questions.  The eReader also provides real-time information on reading behaviour, time spent on each page/chapter and answering questions.

The EduReader Learning Analytics Engine can be customized to individual student requirements which in turn helps students get a a better picture of their performance.

These are just a few of the many ways that this educational platform can be used by both teachers and students to improve education!
